story:
Above: Sculptor in Bhutan

The founders of the festival are not being paid and are personally funding this festival.  But, they do not have enough to cover all of the expenses.

The funds from this campaign will be used as follows:

  1. Pay the artists, filmmakers and musicians that have volunteered to defer payment until after more funds are raised.
  2. To pay back the festival organizers who aren't being paid but have contributed their own personal funds to get the festival going.
  3. Banners, plane tickets for artists and musicians, art supplies. 

We need to raise at least $30,000 to cover a budget shortfall to pay for artists, musicians and film makers who are forgoing getting paid in advance knowing we simply do not have these funds now. 

above: Kevin Ledo (artist)

These artists love the idea of this festival so much that when we told them we had no more money left to help pay them, they offered and agreed to come and get paid when we can pay them. 

James is a serial entrepreneur who has started nearly 10 companies in various industries mostly geared toward supporting Bhutan which include:

www.BHIF.org,  www.CafeBhutan.com, www.DreamsOfBhutan.com, www.SpiritsOfBhutan.com, www.FacilitiesUSA.com, www.GuardServicesUSA.com, www.FlavinUSA.com  

About Bhutan 

People – measured by Gross National Happiness - the ONLY country in the world to place the wellbeing of its populace at the center of all policy and decision making. 

Planet –carbon neutral now and forever - Bhutan is the ONLY carbon neutral nation on earth. The ONLY nation guaranteeing a high percentage of forest cover. The ONLY country aiming to be 100% certified Organic (by 2020)

Profit –Located between two of the world's most important growth economies (India and China) presents a unique socio/political/religious economic challenge to this small country but here it is punching through and making waves - outperforming its neighbors with its own Economic theory not based entirely on growth, and reaching out internationally with key nonprofit events like BHIF. 

  • Tenacity and a great team of volunteers.
  • We have a great team of non-paid festival directors and volunteers, artists, musicians and performers.
  • Please like us on Facebook and please share with everyone, everywhere,

But none of this would be possible without the real heavy lifters:  First and foremost, Thinley Palden Dorji, Co-Founder, Kinley Ganchu Wangchuk (Radio Valley 99.9FM Thimphu and Mojo Park) Music Festival Co-Founder , Ginny Galloway and John  Hendicott from EdenLabs and last but really first in my heart, Justin Wickham who brought EdenLabs to us for without them, this event would not be possible. 

We are a big team with countless volunteers and a great non-paid management staff team.  I would never in a million years be here but because of these great people we have all built something so special. Please join us in the great legacy event.

story:
Hi my name is Elide. I'm 16 and I come from a small city near Modena, Italy. Last summer I went on a study vacation in Ireland for two weeks and I fell in love with it. Next year I could go to Ireland for a semester to study but I don't have enough money because, unfortunately, three years ago there had been an earthquake that damaged my house and we just started restoring it. We have to spend a lot of money in order to do that and we don't have enough money for me to go to Ireland. I'd like to study english literature at university so this semester abroad would really help me.

If I won't raise enough money I will still use what I've raised for a 15 days study vacation this summer.

If you could help me to make my dream come true it would be awesome and I would be eternally grateful.

story:
"Teach 'Em Early" Crib Mobile Overview...

"It's the gift that keeps giving the whole year round, Clark."

  • What is it? An entertaining crib mobile for newborns (up to 5 months) of waterfowl enthusiasts, friends and/or parents, grandparents, etc.

  • What's a Crib Mobile?  You know, that thing that hooks onto the side of a crib, rotates and plays music to entertain and calm your newborn and provide them with a useful learning experience at an early age... : )  (I used them with my kids and they're very smart kids now...)

  • Who is it for?  Any duck hunter or waterfowl enthusiast expecting a newborn, so if you or someone you know is expecting, this is the perfect gift!

  • How much?  $39 each.  This campaign is attempting to raise enough money to purchase the initial minimum manufacturing run.  (1,000 units total). 

  • What do I do?  Please contribute by pre-purchasing one, then share this with all your friends on Facebook, Twitter and Email, or donate large sums of money toward the manufacturing of this and other products like it.   (Story below)


The "Teach 'Em Early" Story...

Do you know a waterfowl enthusiast who is about to add to their "brood"?  The "Teach 'Em Early" Waterfowl Identification Crib Mobile is a product for them that speaks directly (and humorously) to waterfowl hunting parents who are expecting a newborn.  If you are (or if you know someone who is) a fanatic about duck hunting and expecting a newborn, this is the perfect gift.  Seriously.  There is no other product in the Baby or Outdoor products industry like the "Teach 'Em Early" Waterfowl Identification Crib Mobile.

With this Indiegogo campaign, I'm trying to raise enough cash to purchase the initial production run of inventory by "pre-selling" it — For your contribution of $39 or more, you'll get an inaugural "Teach 'Em Early" Waterfowl Identification Musical Crib Mobile for your own personal purposes... The $14K is the amount it takes to purchase the minimum order quantity from the supplier. 


Hi, I'm Brandon Foster and I created the first "Teach 'Em Early" product for some good friends of mine who happen to work for a very familiar and large conservation organization with headquarters in western Tennessee (I don't think I can name drop here).  They were expecting their first child and I wanted to give them something unique that they could identify with while at the same time welcoming the new addition to their family with a "tongue in cheek" humorous yet functional product.

Contributors to my campaign will first receive the product (duh).  It's what you're buying for yourself or your friends.  And if you're buying as a gift, you'll also be viewed by your peers as the coolest "Friend, Spouse, Aunt, Uncle, Mom, Dad, Sister, Brother, Stranger" on the planet.  You'll hear things like, "Wow!  Where did you get that!" and "Dude, that's freaking awesome" and all sorts of other accolades.  (Be aware, you might also get a few dirty looks from non-amused spousal units... you know who they are...)



But what's more important is that when you participate in my campaign by purchasing  a "Teach 'Em Early Waterfowl Identification Crib Moble" product (or 10 of them for future "gifting"), you're passing along a legacy of conservation and family tradition to the next generation in a very cool way.  You're passing to the next generation your passion for outdoor pursuits and support for conservation organizations... 2% of the net sales of these products from this campaign will be donated to wildlife conservation organizations, most likely the big one I referred to in the first paragraph... : )


The back story behind the original "Teach 'Em Early"

When I made the first one for my friend, there was nothing like it in the market (and still isn't).  I went to baby store after baby store after baby store... outdoor mass retailers and small hunt/fish stores and had ZERO success finding something like this.  “Surely there are other outdoorsmen and outdoorswomen who "get it"? I asked myself.  After a little impromptu research (a.k.a. "duck blind" questions during the slow periods - "hey, would you buy one of these?"), the answer was a resounding "YES!!!"  Hopefully, that sentiment will be reflected here in about 30 days.

The original package design for the Teach 'Em Early crib mobile... the first unit featured "Hartz Dog Toys" as the plush ducks.


Back to the story… I searched the world over (and thought I found true love… no wait, that was HeeHaw) and eventually found the “ducks” for the original version not at a toy store… not in a baby product store… but, get this, in the dog food aisle at the local grocery.  No one makes a realistic looking duck out of plush material.  Insane.  So I bought 4 “mallard-looking” dog toys, sewed string into the body of them and hung them on the mobile.  My oldest daughter had received a sewing machine for Christmas one year, so I enlisted her to sew the canopy and support structure cover out of material I found at the local  fabric store.  (She now wants a cut, or a new saddle, whichever is more attainable... darn capitalist.) 

I needed a custom look to complete the “package”, so I started designing… After an hour or so with Illustrator & Photoshop, the first package was born.  I printed it out and pasted the sheets over the original box I purchased and it was ready!

We went to the baby shower (with other gifts as well) and gave it to the couple.  Everyone thought it was a hit, and most asked where we got it.... hmmmmm, was I on to something or on something?  We'll never know, but that’s how this idea came to life.

From its crude beginnings, the idea for a series of products was born.  I found a company that could help me in the sourcing and manufacturing of the components, paid them to create some sample prototypes (which you see the first round here and in the video), and now it’s time to make it happen!


Does it work?
I know research has been done about infant brain stimulation and most logic would tell you that anything that goes in during the critical formative periods stays in. Google it.  However, I have evidence in the form of a conversation I had with the same friend I made the original mobile for, and the conversation went something like this...

"You know, there's probably something to this.  I mean, when I was tiny, I distinctly remember being in a bouncy chair at my grandpa's house.  They'd put me in front of the fireplace and all I could see were three wooden ducks he had up on the mantel.  I'd stare at those things for hours... maybe that's why I'm such a fanatic about waterfowl hunting..." 

See, it works.  Case dismissed.

So anyway... I created this campaign to fund the manufacturing and marketing of these crib mobiles (and more like them in the future) By participating in the funding of this campaign, you’ll receive the actual product, and you’ll be able to spread the love to others like us.

Changes for the final version in process – what will be different about the final product is the following:

  • Ducks will be 15% larger & color correction and revisions will be done to make them more realistic looking
  • Blue Sky under the canopy when viewing from underneath – the sky print will also feature small silhouettes of ducks in the sky
  • Lab Center – there will be a black Labrador retriever suspended from the center loop slightly lower in elevation from the ducks.

The view from the Crib...

How much, and what's in it for me?

When you participate in my fundraising campaign, you’re purchasing the product for your own personal self and/or gifting.  Simply stated, you’ll be the coolest “gifter” on the planet with this unique product.  And, it’s been a cold winter up in the northern segment of the country, so the Fall will be a banter season for infant production, if you know what I mean…

But you're also helping me create a whole new category of affinity products in a market space that currently has very little innovation.  I’ve been in marketing my entire life, and I can see the potential here.  My goal is to use this funding to start a business that caters to people like us... people who have interests outside of what's currently being offered at the major retailers. 

The Waterfowl Crib mobile is just the beginning.  If successful, I'll be rolling this idea out into all kinds of unknown territory, including other outdoor sports pursuits like big game, sport fishing and upland game, but also into the licensing world.  Harley Davidson?  Fender Guitars?  John Deere?  Absolutely.  I know people...

Goal - Raise (hopefully) $14,000 or more, $49 at a time.   The main purpose of this campaign is to fund the startup and manufacturing of the first series of "Teach 'Em Early Waterfowl Identification Musical Crib Mobiles"...  This is the primary purpose of this campaign.  I’ve been to banks… most don’t “get it.”  You do.  Please help!

The money will also be used to fund marketing activities and product development.  As I said earlier, this is just the “starter” product.  I have many more on the drawing board.  Marketing activities will be focused around digital direct response advertising (Facebook, Google, YouTube, etc.) and design.

Teach 'Em Early Camo Pattern I designed...

Where I am in the Process now... a.k.a. - when will I get my stuff?

I am in the final stages of prototype and sample development.  I have a few tweaks to make to the ducks (colors were off on the wigeon and the wood duck needs a little more finesse), the canopy underside pattern has been designed and sent off for printing, and the Labrador retriever design is in process now.  I anticipate all of these changes to be done and completed by the 3rd week in February.

If funding goes well, estimated delivery of product will be mid to late May, 2015.  Just to be safe, let's call it early June.  If I don't reach my funding goal (but please don't let that happen... this is a cool concept and execution!), the ship date may get delayed because I'll have to seek additional funding for the initial minimum order quantity.  Package design is almost complete and production on it will most likely commence over the next few weeks.  I'm still tweaking the packaging because eventually I'll have it retail ready.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like this project but don't want the product, I'll gladly accept donations small and large for funding purposes.  I'm pretty sure there's a way to do this via Indiegogo...  at the top right, just select the "other" box and type in how much you'd like to give.  It's easy, pain-free and remember, every little bit helps.  As Ed Bartles used to say, "Thank you for your support."

Also, PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE share this campaign on your facebook page, email it to friends, text it to your buddies... however you choose to get the word out.
Use all of the "share" tools at the top (just under the video) to post, tweet and email to the friends you think would be interested in this project.  Send it to all of your hunting and non-hunting buddies... you never know who will want to "Teach 'Em Early!"  I'd really appreciate it!

Thanks for your support!

Brandon

story:
Summary

  • We are The Foundation of WOMEN in HIPHOP. Our mission is to educate and empower the community through sharing love of the arts, inspiring growth, building leadership, and influencing the perceptions and roles of women in hip hop for current and future generations..
  • After 5 years of running a Successful Transformative Truly Open-Mic/Open Cipher Space in Detroit dedicated to Uplifting Women's Voices, Showcasing Women Talent, Conducting Healing Workshops, and Expanding Opportunities for Women Artists, The Foundation has been selected to produce a WOMENinHIPHOP Track at #AMC2015 (Allied Media Conference) alliedmedia.org
  • Inside of our track we will:

    • Develop awareness of the cultural significance of  the inclusion of Women in Hip Hop.

    • Strengthen Detroit as a connected node in the extensive network of global cities that celebrate Women in Hip hop

    • Develop a “young ambassadors” role & structure & formally train youth to become directly engaged & responsible for the operation & sustainability. of The Foundation of Women in Hip Hop, & to be recognized for such roles.

    • Present a community event that showcases & celebrates achievements of The Foundation of Women in Hip Hop participants to a broad audience.

What We Need:

  • We need $2500 to cover free conference registrations for youth, travel and housing support, and food for presenters.

The Impact

The Women in Hip Hop as Resistance and Expression Track will bring together artists, activists and academics to creatively confront dominant misogynistic narratives in music and media. We will get to the root of how violence, and especially violence against women, became embedded in the cultural code of Hip Hop and we will rewrite that code to work towards the liberation of all people, drawing upon the brilliance of feminist Hip Hop activism, artistry, and scholarship.

Participants walk away with a greater understanding of the value of women in Hip Hop as a culture across disciplines.:  Art (Graffiti/StreetArt etc.), Dance, Technology (DJing/Music Production/Video), Words (Emceeing/FreeStyling/Writing/Rhyming/Poetry), and Culture (the Knowledge Element of reading, observing video and listening to audio media, discussion)

Risks & Challenges

One major risk to us achieving our goal of having a major youth presence is that the population we currently serve is considered in the "low-income" bracket and unable to afford the cost of entry to the conference.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • APlease help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

Inside of our track we will:

Develop awareness of the cultural significance of  the inclusion of Women in Hip Hop.
Strengthen Detroit as a connected node in the extensive network of global cities that celebrate Women in Hip hop
Develop a “young ambassadors” role & structure & formally train youth to become directly engaged & responsible for the operation & sustainability. of The Foundation of Women in Hip Hop, & to be recognized for such roles.
Present a community event that showcases & celebrates achievements of The Foundation of Women in Hip Hop participants to a broad audience.

   What We Need:  We need $2500 to cover free conference registrations for youth, travel and housing support, and food for presenters.
    The Impact 
The Women in Hip Hop as Resistance and Expression Track will bring together artists, activists and academics to creatively confront dominant misogynistic narratives in music and media. We will get to the root of how violence, and especially violence against women, became embedded in the cultural code of Hip Hop and we will rewrite that code to work towards the liberation of all people, drawing upon the brilliance of feminist Hip Hop activism, artistry, and scholarship.
Participants walk away with a greater understanding of the value of women in Hip Hop as a culture across disciplines.:  Art (Graffiti/StreetArt etc.), Dance, Technology (DJing/Music Production/Video), Words (Emceeing/FreeStyling/Writing/Rhyming/Poetry), and Culture (the Knowledge Element of reading, observing video and listening to audio media, discussion)   Risks & Challenges One major risk to us achieving our goal of having a major youth presence is that the population we currently serve is considered in the "low-income" bracket and unable to afford the cost of entry to the conference.
    Other Ways You Can Help Maybe you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  APlease help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who We Are

  • Erica started Who's Your (s)Hero in 2015 because she felt there is a need for girls to have positive strong role models to look up to and mentors to help them navigate new careers.
  • Who's Your (s)Hero is a 501 c3 Non-Profit organization that aims to inspire and mentor girls to become successful, happy, and confident women. We shine a light on women who are leaders in their fields, both past and present. We focus on women who have pushed past boundaries, soared to new heights, and those who have broken through the glass ceiling.

  • Through education, sponsorship, and mentoring, Who's Your (s)Hero unites women with the opportunity and access to become tomorrow's leaders.

  • Mentorships are open to any girl who is leaving her education level, from high school through college, and is entering the work force. They just need to apply and we will match them with a mentor. 
  • We are recruiting mentors in every field, whether they are an artist, professional or retired.   All that is required is a desire to help another woman get ahead.
  • Both Mentor and Mentee should be happy and comfortable in their relationship.  All mentor relationship are different.  The time and ways they communicate are exclusive to each relationship.  We are here to facilitate finding the best match and help make that relationship work.

The Starting Costs

This is the first stage of funding to create Who's Your (s)Hero foundation.

  • $3000 administration cost 6 months
  • $2500 Branding and outreach
  • $1000 marketing material to acquire more sponsorship and mentors
  • $3500 rewards for web content contest

Remember! All donations are 100% tax deductible.

The Impact We Can Make

We want to help young women succeed in strong and influential careers and help create tomorrows leaders.

  • Girls benefit from strong mentors.  Mentors can help them gain confidence in their new work environment, learn essential negotiating skills and lean into their career, especially where women are are the minority .
  • Mentors can help girls understand what is possible, set realistic career goals,  and encourage them where and how to shatter glass ceilings.
  • Everyone deserve a fighting chance.  Women deserve an equal chance.

No Risk- Only Reward

As with all non profits this is one of many fundraising rounds.  Money is essential to operation and is solely donation based.  Our service is offered to any girl who is interested and will never be charged for any service provided.  Our data base is user friendly and is free and open to anyone.

But we know how to stay funded.

  • We have many more fundraising opportunities coming up.
  • Additional grants are being be pursued in every way.
  • There are some marketing options in the works to help raise funds needed to continue to provide support and sponsorship for eligible candidates.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

We are recruiting professionals who might be interested in sponsoring, mentoring or offering internships to young women.  Please send them to www.whosyourshero.com for more info.

  • Ask friends to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • share this link with anyone you know with a daughter, niece or female friend.  All of them can benefit from Who's Your (s)Hero!
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
(Latin meaning "the way")

The combination of reading and listening to the word of God has inspired a small group of Christians to be Jesus Christ's witness to the end of the earth:

  • Leading as many people to faith in Jesus Christ and His salvation from sin is our number one goal!
  • Hi I am Nick Duran, faithful follower of the Lord Christ Jesus with support from my amazing wife Angela Duran, my children and brothers and sisters in Christ.
  • My goal is to give, free of charge to the end user, a small business card sized digital device in an effort to bring as many of my brothers and sisters here on earth to faith in Jesus the son of God.
  • Reading the Bible, hearing the Bible and having it explained saturates an individuals understanding of God's word, strengthens their faith and gives them the courage and desire to become disciples themselves.

With one very inexpensive and small audio/visual device we can give thousands of potential Christians all around the world all of God's Word. And just imagine how many people they in turn will reach.

To the end of the earth.

What is in✝via

in-via is a small business card sized text e-reader and audio content player with the following attributes and digital content for learning God's Word, finding faith in Jesus Christ, becoming disciples and additionally gaining literacy:

  • a text copy of God's Written Word (KJV to follow along with thru the bible).
  • an audio copy of God's Word (KJV).
  • an audio copy of the Thru the Bible Radio ministries featuring Dr. J Vernon McGee.
  • All of Dr. McGee's Notes & Outlines.
  • Optional USB cable for charging (if this feature falls in the per unit budget).
  • Rear button navigation, side power button, side audio jack and lanyard loop.
  • A graphene ink display for viewing and navigating the content with very low cost and very low voltage use.

  • A graphene solar panel on the backside for charging anywhere.

  • Headphones for hearing the content.
  • Bluetooth for sharing the content.
  • Synchronized text and audio content so the person can view and follow along with the text of the scriptures as they read aloud.

  • Pending the the overall budget, it is also our goal to give all of this content in the end user's native language as well as in English in an effort to teach English.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's how simple it is:

  • Our initial goal is to design, produce, package and ship 20,000 in-via units all around the world, include right here in the US, to people of many different languages and backgrounds in order to teach them God's Word,  lead them to salvation is Jesus, and ultimately make disciples of them.
  • Are we to reach our goal then this initial batch will see a single in-via unit shipped for your small donation of $50.

  • Were we to fall short of our goal we will attempt to get the design phase of the project finished so that a prototype can be presented again as a new crowd sourcing campaign; or to acquire other private Christian backing for the production/shipping phase of the project.
  • What do you ultimately get? The knowledge that you are saving souls. And some free stuff that acknowledges your gift to others; which may perk the interest of those around you that they might consider doing the same.
  • And most importantly, we need your prayers. God listens to his people and it will only by His will that this project should be a total success.

The Impact

And you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the end of the earth:

  • Jesus' final words to his disciples before ascending into heaven were his command that they spread his good news to all of the people of all the world.

  • We as Christians are to pick up that torch, but often we do not even know where to begin. The in-via digital content player is an effective and inexpensive way of overcoming that hurdle, and giving our fellow man the gift of eternal life with God.
  • A secondary but still very important impact would be that this device could increase literacy among those it reaches. Looking at the Word and listening to it spoken helps people understand what they are able to read in the written form. Knowledge is strength, which we hope will lead to courage. Courage to share the blessing that we wish to bestow up them.
  • God has called my heart to this simple solution. Please listen him call your heart to do the same.

Risks & Challenges

Persecution. Spiritual attacks:

  • Putting the word of God in people's hands is sometimes very dangerous depending on where they are in the world. A portion of the proceeds will be use to organize the distribution of the units via partnerships with Christian Mission Organizations to ensure that they are given to the end user discreetly; and to help them to learn how to use the unit, should they need assistance.

  • The battle between Good and evil is all around us at all times and the deceiver will attempt to place many stumbling blocks in the path of this and other projects that wish to increase the body of Christ. But with your prayers and any financial blessings this simple idea could become a phenomenon that is pleasing to the Lord Jesus, God the Father and Holy Spirit; and could save millions of souls.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone has extra to give financially, especially today:

  • Your prayers would be a blessing to help spread God's Word.
  • Share this campaign on all of your social media and help to spread the Word (pun intended).
  • Consider donating to, praying for and promoting the Thru the Bible Radio Ministries to help support the legacy that Dr. McGee established to disciple to all people, to the end of the earth, with God's Good News! - http://www.ttb.org/supportus

May God Bless You All!


____________



3D Renderings

Coming soon: 3D Print Photos.

This 3D render shows the device from each side:

story:
Hello! My name is Maddie Cohen. As a recent high school graduate, I am excited to begin my adventure into adult life.  Before I attend college, I plan to spend a year abroad with the program “Thinking Beyond Borders”. I hope this amazing opportunity can help me focus my passion for global issues in an area that I will study in college.

Why Take a Gap Year?

Service and celebrating cultural diversity has been a major part of my life. I started doing community service in middle school and have traveled to Mexico and El Salvador for service trips. While here in the States, I have participated in other service projects in Baltimore, MD, Camden, NJ and Washington, DC. Every summer since seventh grade, I participated in the “Friends for Peace” summer camp in a the DC low income community.


When I first started going on these service trips, I saw volunteering as giving back to the community and helping people better themselves. Instead, I learned that volunteering is a two way street of giving and receiving. Where I often feel like the people I meet give more to me than I give to them.  Each volunteering experience has greatly influenced my decision to dedicate my life to service. In Baltimore, I helped a wealthy family, who had settled in a dilapidated neighborhood, renovate the house next door to give to a homeless family. They had sacrificed their life of privilege in order to create a supportive community in this impoverished area. They chose to use their wealth to buy homes and renovate them for those who did not have basic necessities. This experience inspired a desire to pursue a career in non-profit work.

I look forward to attending college after my gap year and I hope to identify a specific area of focus before I attend. I know that eventually, I want to have a job that enables me to travel around the world and tackle issues that affect people each day. Taking a gap year allows me to explore the world beyond my D.C. “bubble” and help me make responsible decisions in college.

Why Thinking Beyond Borders?

The Thinking Beyond Borders gap year program will allow me to continue and focus my passion for global social justice issues. Thinking Beyond Borders encourages students to explore the challenges and solutions to critical global issues in communities around the world. This program enables me to travel to six different countries, including: Ecuador, Peru, Thailand, Cambodia, India, and South Africa. Each country focuses on a specific global issue that I will learn from and discover first hand. I am excited to live with a rural farming family in Thailand to see the path of food from field to plate. I will be able to experience what I learned in AP Environmental Science first hand. Thinking Beyond Borders teaches students through first hand experience, opposed to a traditional classroom. This opportunity will expose me to communities and people outside of the world I have grown up in. Staying with local families will allow me to learn from different cultures and diverse ways of life. My love for volunteer work and travel has greatly influenced my decision to go on this program. This program will allow me to explore my passion for history and humanities in the cultural emersion opportunities. It empowers students with the skills and experience to critically address global issues - fieldwork, homestays, Program Leaders, and the curriculum will challenge us to look critically at global issues and create solutions. 

Itinerary:

1.  Ecuador- orientation / investigate how industry, agriculture, and cultural conflicts threaten forests and clean water in rural areas. I will experience the towering peaks of the Andes, equatorial beaches, and the colonial architecture of Quito.

2.  Peru- Hike to Manchu Picchu and learn the history of the Incan Empire

3.  Thailand- Discover how farmers, the government, and businesses cooperate to balance the demand for food with the ecosystem. I will live with a rural farming family to see the path of food, from field to plate.

4.  Cambodia – Visit Khmer temples at Angkor Wat and tour the museums in Phnom Penh

5.  India – Explore how education can empower individuals and communities to treat disease, produce goods, and support effective government by working in education centers for women and children in some of the poorest parts of Jaipur. I also will visit the breathtaking Taj Mahal and immerse myself in the culture through the markets and festivals. I also get to travel to Udaipur and Pushkar on India’s famous railroads and visit the Hindu pilgrimage city of Pushkar and camp on a camel trek.

6.  South Africa – Investigate how a country recovering from Apartheid is attempting to address the needs of those infected with HIV/AIDS through work with home-based caregivers, a nursing center, and clinics. I also will travel to Addo National Park for a safari

7.  Washington, D.C.- Meet with representatives from the World Bank, Congress, and NGOs to discuss international development and the relationship between the US and the rest of the world.

At the end of the program, I will create a Presentation of Learning to raise awareness about critical global issues, and finally I will attend the TBB gap year’s graduation.

How You Can Help?

This program will allow me to participate in many different volunteering experiences in diverse cultures. Hopefully this year will allow me to focus my passion on a specific issue! I need your help in order to participate in this amazing experience. This donation is about much more than just paying for me to travel around the world - it is an investment in me as a social change agent. Thank you so much for your support and for making my dream a reality.

story:
It’s all about the experience! 

Stagecraft Institute of Las Vegas is hands-on training for live entertainment -fifty years in development - now launching Season 9!

SILV has become a worldwide leader exemplifying what the collaboration of integrity and imagination can accomplish in eight extremely intensive weeks in summer in Las Vegas.

SILV students have come from 49 states (come on, North Dakota!) and 41 countries.

Pay it forward Founder Don Childs and friends shared a vision of training taught by working professionals and supported by manufacturers and production groups paying forward to the students who will be the future of our industry. The industry faculty and friends of SILV believe in this mission, and they freely and wholly invest themselves (i.e., no salary on this gig)!

Facts:

Annual SILV program valued at roughly $6,000,000 - $ 21,819 per classroom seat

Annual actual SILV cost with industry support roughly $200,000 - $800 per classroom seat

This reality proves that friends are more valuable than money

SILV believes that the criteria for a student’s success is individual potential.

96% SILV students require and receive some level of tuition waiver from SILV

92% SILV alumni work in the industry

SILV makes it happen!


SILV 2015 Full to capacity with 27 students for the full 8-week session and another 40+ students taking one or more individual weeks.

SILV routine expenses include local transportation, gas, parking, daily lunches (saves class time!), storage for gear and van in off season, insurance and more insurance, computer labs, rig space, faculty travel and housing as needed, traditional weekly Grill Chats, summer staff (SILV alumni ) token salary and housing, and investment in finding the next generation of SILV students.

SILV believes providing student transportation contributes to collaboration and is critical to the overall effectiveness of SILV. The logistics of providing transport to all of the venues where SILV classes and events are held has become a major financial consideration.

SILV needs help to make this happen! 

SILV owns one 12-passenger 1997 Ford van.

SILV needs 3 vans to handle all of the daily student transport for SILV 2015.

The hard numbers:

$7090 (rental for 2 vans $5490 plus gas $1600)

Extra-Extra- Bonus SILV 2015 Experience:

$1975 bus for backstage tour of multiple venues on The Miracle ship in Long Beach Harbor and a Custom Technical Theatre Workshop at Disneyland Resort


The success of SILV is judged only by what becomes of their students. 

Don Childs, 2004

SILV alumni are working in our industry with:

Cirque du Soleil

Disney Entertainment

Marvel Experience

Touring with “The Boss”

The Alley Theatre

Carnival Cruise Lines

Criss Angel

Touring with Spiegleworld

TAIT/Stage Tech

Alabama Shakespeare

Blue Man Group

Wynn Las Vegas

Princess Cruise Lines

Morpheus Lighting

MGM Grand Garden

Rock in Rio Las Vegas

Oregon Shakespeare Festival

David Copperfield

Norwegian Cruise Lines

Teaching high school

Teaching college

And lots, lots, lots more!


SILV admission scenario: when their alumni are out in the world working and someone asks "Where did you learn all of that stuff?" the SILV alumni will answer "At Stagecraft Institute" and the someone will say "I should have known." 

SILV process:  a work in progress preparing each year to push beyond the work they have done before and totally energize the next level of training!

SILV business model:

And it never gets any easier!

By traditional business standards SILV should never have survived - let alone be embarking on their 9th summer! SILV had no outside funding, no reserves, and no resources other than the nerve of the founders and their hundreds of friends within the industry they were intent on serving. The commitment of those friends allowed SILV to act on its mission of better training for a better tomorrow, and those friends invested right along with SILV itself.

Truth is that training and learning are not just task or industry specific - they are life specific. Sharing the potential of what the collaboration of integrity and imagination can accomplish is the reality that is Stagecraft Institute of Las Vegas. SILV goes after it one day at a time.

Ways you can help 

You can help SILV by simply spreading the word about what SILV is doing out in the desert of Las Vegas. You can also help us with whatever support is available to you. To date, students have come to SILV from 49 states (come on, North Dakota!) and 41 countries and we want to be here for them! 

The Legacy that is SILV believes that entertainment transcends borders of all kinds and contributes to a better world. SILV exists on the kindness of friends, so welcome to our world. You can help make a difference! 

Now, SILV invites (challenges?) you to pick up your piece of the challenge and keep SILV students rolling!

It’s all about the experience!

Find This Campaign On FacebookTwitterYouTubeWebsite

story:
Short Summary

The Eagleworks lab has been studying the EM Drive, and interesting and baffling piece of equipment that seems to generate thrust for reasons we are only just starting to understand. Just recently, however, tests showed that this technology seems to have the capability to create what is known as a 'warp bubble'. The team needs funding to confirm their test results further. If it does turn out to be the case that what they detected in their tests was, in fact, a warp bubble the implications for the future of space exploration are, quite literally, out of this world. You can find more information here- http://www.inquisitr.com/2040259/did-nasa-just-accidentally-produce-a-warp-bubble-emdrive-could-lead-to-warp-drive/

And here, however this is the forum at NASA's website and without some knowledge of physics and complicated math it may be harder to read for some- http://forum.nasaspaceflight.com/index.php?topic=36313.1860


What We Need & What You Get

We need to ensure that this team gets some funding however NASA, being a government entity, can only accept donations from the public aside from their federal budget. So we need to help them. 

What do  you get out of it? Imagine if the findings are confirmed. You would get to know that you directly helped mankind step into the future we all dreamed of watching Star Trek as kids/adults. 

The Impact

The initial tests seem very positive that they have observed a warp bubble, but they now need to recreate these tests in a vacuum to ensure the accuracy of the results. This takes money. A lot of money. 

If we can help them and the results remain accurate, I personally think the positive find of a man made warp bubble (which would inevitably lead to a warp drive years and years and years down the road) would be just as important as finding alien life on another world. It opens up all the initial doors to exploring the cosmos in a way that is just not possible right now. 

Risks & Challenges

What do we risk here? We risk that the results may not be confirmed in a vacuum and we are back to square one. But that's science. Personally, I think the positives here outweigh the possible negatives. 

If the results are confirmed, however, does that mean we'll have a functioning warp drive in the next 10/20/30/50 years? Not necessarily but it DOES mean that work towards that end would start pretty much immediately. The challenge here, then, is the wait after these tests are either confirmed or denied.

story:
WHO I AM AND WHY I NEED YOUR HELP

Hello, and thank you for looking at my campaign. My name Is Miles Plemmons. I live in Eureka, Montana, just seven miles from the Canadian border. I turned sixteen this month and I want the opportunity to grow beyond farming in my life. I want  to attend the ID TECH INTRO TO PROGRAMMING course at Stanford University this Summer. I need your help to get me off the farm and to the camp where I will learn C++ and other important software programming knowledge.

I’ve been learning arduino, micro-electronic projects at home because my school doesn’t offer much computer or software education. In my spare time, I try to read and learn as much as I can about programming. I know that this IDTech Summer School will give me the knowledge I need to move forward with my engineering education and allow me to develop some unique software, which I've been interested to pursue.

The view from our farm

HOW WILL YOUR DONATIONS HELP ME?

Though I come from a small farming community of 3,500 people, I know I can do anything in my life with the proper education, and I want to learn to write computer programs.  I am asking for your help to fund my trip to Stanford for a summer programming course -- an opportunity of a lifetime for me :).  I work on the farm every day after school and most of the summer. This has taught me that effort and dedication always pay off. I’m raising money through crowdfunding because my family doesn’t have the money to pay for this program. 

My parents have donated a hog and I have been selling raffle tickets for the pork, but it’s only given me $1,800. I need $4,000 more for the two-week course. Your donations will help pay for my airfare, lodging and of course this GREAT tech camp, which I know will be amazing. Once I take this intensive course, I'll have enough programming experience to start writing programs myself.  My goal is to develop programs so I can help my parents pay for my college expenses.

If I make more money in the campaign, I’ll save the money for another course next year and my college education fund. Although I love helping my family on the farm, planting, and raising all the animals, I want to become a software engineer and not feed pigs my whole life!

A LITTLE MORE ABOUT ME

I have been in the Boy Scouts of America since the first grade, and I am currently working on my Eagle Scout project, the highest award a Scout can earn.  I am building a memorial park for all the past Lincoln County High School students. This project will be completed the day before I head to Stanford -- with your help of course! I also compete in track, wrestling and play varsity football. My other interests include playing the clarinet, guitar and flute, which I enjoy whenever I have time.

On my way to Eagle Scout

My ultimate goal is to serve my country and attend the Air Force Academy, or perhaps West Point. Any extracurricular activities and educational programs will help me achieve this dream.

My recent visit to a Montana Air Force base

ABOUT OUR FARM

I live on a pig and garlic farm where our family raises rare organic Heritage pigs from the 1800's and grows beautiful organic garlic which I will hand pick and ship to everyone who donates.

Miles and Shirley, my favorite pig, taking a break.

Organic garlic from our farm


ABOUT THE COURSE I WANT TO TAKE

iD Tech Programming Summer School

The basics of the course include some really great programming lessons for me. Here's what it includes:

ID TECH Programming 101 STANFORD UNIVERSITY

"Course Description: This beginner through intermediate level course bridges the gap: first covering broad object-oriented programming (OOP) concepts common to modern programming, then building on that foundation with an overview of languages such as C++, Java™, and scripting. You'll also be introduced to HTML and CSS. Your new coding skills will be polished through hands-on exercises and mini applications."

If you want to see more information on the course, please see IDTECH.COM

I am excited about it because not only am I going to be able to stay on the campus of one of the best universities in the world and experience the college atmosphere, but I am going to learn the basics of programming so I can use this for future schooling and projects.

FINALLY...

When I return from the two week course, I am going to give a presentation to my school on my experience at the ID TECH camp, what I learned, and demonstrate one of the software programs I learned to write. I know this will be a great incentive to other students.

Any additional monies donated will go towards my college education fund so you'll be helping me in more than one way! Can you please help me get there?

Thank you again and I really appreciate any help you can offer! This course and learning basic programming skills, are the first steps toward my most promising future.

Thank you again.

Miles Plemmons

story:
Cari amici,


L'Isernia FC ha appena concluso una stagione straordinaria dal punto di vista sportivo, aggiudicandosi con 5 giornate di anticipo il campionato di Eccellenza e la Coppa Italia di categoria, ma fallimentare per quanto riguarda l'aspetto economico.
La squadra si é ritrovata da novembre 2014 senza dirigenti e senza fondi. I giocatori guidati dal capitano Nicola Panico hanno rilevato la societá, ormai sulla via del fallimento, incaricandosi quindi degli oneri e delle responsabilitá derivanti e rinunciando inoltre ad ogni compenso. Questi ragazzi meravigliosi, con l'aiuto di pochi sostenitori, per mesi si sono incaricati della manutenzione del campo di calcio e di tutto l'impianto sportivo, ad esempio tagliando personalmente l'erba del terreno di gioco. Hanno autofinanziato ogni trasferta e chi, come molti giovani, é lontano da casa si é dovuto incaricare personalmente di ogni spesa di vitto e alloggio senza alcun aiuto.
Contro ogni pronostico e in mezzo a mille difficoltá sono riusciti a salvare la societá portando la squadra a compiere quello che é a tutti gli effetti un vero miracolo sportivo, grazie anche all'aiuto dei tifosi, dominando in campo per quasi tutta la stagione.


_____________________________________________________________________________

Dear friends,
Isernia FC has just concluded a fanstastic season from a sports perspective, winning the championship 5 match day earlier and the Italy Cup, but bankruptcy.
From November 2014 the team has no management and no funds. The players, guided by the captain Nicola Panico, have taken over the club taking all the risks and responsibility and giving up to any remuneration. These wonderful guys, with the help of a few supporters, have taken care of the stadium, cutting the grass of the soccer field for example. They have payed for the travel expenses and those who were living away from home, like many young people, had to pay for room and board by their own.
Against all odds and facing many difficulties they managed to save the club bringing the team to accomplish a real sports miracle, thanks also to the help of the supporters, dominating on the soccer field for the most part of the season.

_____________________________________________________________________________

Perché raccogliamo i fondi?


Ad oggi la societá é ancora in mano ai giocatori che a questo punto sono encomiabilmente motivati a perpetrare lo sforzo della passata stagione, volendo in ogni caso partecipare al campionato nazionale di Serie D. 
Qualora la societá fallisse, andrebbe perso quanto di buono i ragazzi hanno fatto in questi anni e lo sforzo di molti sarebbe vano.
L'aiuto che vi chiediamo é per dare una mano all'Isernia FC a sostenere i costi di iscrizione al campionato da versare alla F.I.G.C. a breve.

Ci rivolgiamo a tutti coloro che amano lo sport, quello vero privo di interessi economici. In un calcio sempre piú corrotto e malato riteniamo che ci sia bisogno di realtá sane e ancora attaccate a valori che vanno scomparendo giorno per giorno.


_____________________________________________________________________________


Why do we raise funds?
The club is still without management and the players are still motivated to participate to the championship in the national "Serie D".
If the company should fail, everything good done until now by the players would be vain.
We ask for help for paying the entry fee to the F.I.G.C. for participating to the next year championship.
We call on to everyone who loves sport, the real one without any economic interest. In a sport more and more corrupt and sick we feel there is a need for healthy reality and people still attached to values that are disappearing day by day.


_____________________________________________________________________________

L'aiuto di ognuno di voi é indispensabile! Ed é importante per noi anche spargere la voce! Su Facebook, Twitter e Youtube potete seguirci sul profilo ufficiale dell'Isernia FC:

_____________________________________________________________________________

Everyone's help is essential! And it's also important for us to spread the word! On Facebook, Twitter and Youtube you can follow us on Isernia FC's official profile:


https://www.facebook.com/IserniaFc?fref=ts (Facebook)

https://twitter.com/IserniaFC (Twitter)

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCaQR4GHQqVxosE9r4EhKJ5w (Youtube)


Scarica l'app per donare comodamente dal tuo smartphone o tablet!

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.indiegogo.android&hl=it (Android)

https://itunes.apple.com/it/app/indiegogo/id752234889?mt=8 (iPhone & iPad)





FORZA ISERNIA!!!



FAQ

Come si effettua una donazione?

Sulla destra della pagina cliccate sulla donazione che avete scelto con il rispettivo premio(perks). Nella pagina che viene caricata potete scegliere se aumentare la donazione, se renderla anonima e se registrarvi tramite facebook o inserendo il vostro indirizzo mail. Cliccate su continua.

In questa pagina potrete inserire i dati della vostra carta per la donazione, che verrà effettuata tramite paypal, uno dei sistemi di pagamento online più sicuri al mondo.

Compilate il form e cliccate su continua.
Nella schermata successiva cliccate su “paga” e avrete effettuato la vostra donazione.

Sulla destra della pagina cliccate sulla donazione che avete scelto con il rispettivo premio(perks). Nella pagina che viene caricata potete scegliere se aumentare la donazione, se renderla anonima e se registrarvi tramite facebook o inserendo il vostro indirizzo mail. Cliccate su continua.
In questa pagina potrete inserire i dati della vostra carta per la donazione, che verrà effettuata tramite paypal, uno dei sistemi di pagamento online più sicuri al mondo.
Compilate il form e cliccate su continua.Nella schermata successiva cliccate su “paga” e avrete effettuato la vostra donazione.

story:
On March 19th, 2014, the wine merchant Peder Molin experienced something that nobody should ever have to experience. A police van, filled with armed police, stopped outside of his place of business in Hjorthagen, Stockholm, and performed a warranted search. The bottles of wine in his posession, imported from abroad, addressed and ready to be shipped to their customers, were impounded. Molin was told that he was facing charges of unlawful sale of alcohol, a crime that, in Sweden, can warrant six months or more in prison.

His crime, essentially, was that he had registered his business in Sweden. In early June, 2015, he was sentenced to more than €10,000 in fines, in addition to high legal costs and a commuted sentence.

Swedes have had a long and complicated relationship to the sale and distribution of alcohol. It is a state-run business, and much has been said about the horrors that would happen if sale were to be extended into Saturdays. Then, when that was permitted, the terrible effects of advertising alcohol were raised. When that passed without incident, the next scare was the sale of alcohol from online sources. The facts are that consumption of alcohol in Sweden is shrinking. The doomsday prophets of the past decades are now decrying the horrors of microbreweries and private sale of alcohol. Apparently, e-trade entrepreneurs registered in Sweden are as scary as well.

My name is Breki Tomasson. I am a liberally minded politician and the founder of the Liberal Trade Party in Sweden, and I believe that this kind of enforcement is beyond reproach and needs to be looked at. The monopoly that the state enjoys when it comes to the sale of alcohol needs to end, and this is a fight that I will take as high as it needs to be taken. Along the way, I hope others will join me in helping Peder Molin and other innocent victims of a law that punishes people for nothing more than importing and exporting legal commodities. Should we really punish entrepreneurs for trying their hardest to improve the state of business in Sweden, pay their taxes and find a nische to thrive in?

story:
What is Dyslexia?

Dyslexia is a learning disability characterized by trouble reading despite normal intelligence. Different people are affected to various degrees with problems that may include sounding out and spelling words, reading quickly, writing and pronouncing words when reading aloud and understanding what was read. Often these difficulties are first noticed at school.

The difficulties are not voluntary and people with this disorder have a normal desire to learn. Dyslexics if given the appropriate coaching can achieve great heights in academics and career. They have normal or above average IQ and hence they cannot be accommodated in special needs schools. So they require innovative education.

                     

My Story

I am a visual dyslexic. This means that I can learn and understand things better when given as charts and pictures. Throughout my school days, I have been scolded, beaten and thrown out of classes for not grasping the syllabus and performing well in exams. No one realized that the only problem I faced was understanding the conventional methods of teaching and expressing it on paper. Today the world has changed with many studies and effective results to improve learning conditions for both children and adults with dyslexia.

 Together with my wife, I wish to provide a learning platform for such children along with school drop-outs and adults who require professional training.

Our Dream

We dream to implement innovative learning methods with a goal of providing an educational opportunity for people from all walks of life.


The Academy for Innovative Learning (AFIL) is for all students irrespective of age who require a guide for excelling in their studies. This is not a special needs school but an educational centre for innovative learning. 

                                      

We also plan to provide educational opportunities to adults who wish to continue, all children with learning disabilities and professional training.

                          

       

Our Promise to You

We promise to help all students irrespective of age to achieve their goals in education through our innovative methods of learning. Knowledge is every one's right.

How can you help?

 All contributors shall be eligible for a free course at the academy and would be acknowledged by displaying their names at the Academy, Official Academy Website and Magazine.

Your contributions will be used for the start up investment costs which include government fees, legal fees, rent, computers, furniture,teachers' fees and books.

Let us build together a ground with a solid vision as "Education for all" through our innovative learning platform. No one should be denied education just because of not scoring well. We aim to make education a lifelong experience beyond any examination hall.

story:
Short Summary

Ninja Circus is an Indigenous Youth Circus Troupe and charitable nonprofit based in Uluru, Ayer's Rock. This is a group that works with some of the most remote and isolated people in Australia. Through the medium of circus and performing arts they can improve their self-esteem and confidence in efforts to lower the rate of substance abuse, self-harm and suicide that is prevalent in many Aboriginal communities. We are now in collaboration with Nyangatjatjara College to incorporate Circus into the school curriculum and help improve the concentration and work ethic of the ninjas in the classroom.

The Impact

The kids work hard to train and practice skills in juggling, acrobatics, comedy and magic. Having the opportunity to go on tour is the highlight of the program and often the highlight of their lives. These kids live amongst their indigenous community and rarely have the chance to leave their homes and travel around the country. There is much misunderstanding and prejudice about indigenous people in Australia, and performing is a very special way for the kids to showcase their hard work and take pride in what they can do, while showing that to non-indigenous Australians.

(NOW FUNDED!) The Garma Festival tour will be a two week trip, by bus across the desert, from the Red Centre of Uluru up to Arnhem Land at the top of the country. This is a huge opportunity for the individual kids and for Desert Ninja Circus to be seen and possibly to gain critical funding to continue as a nonprofit, charitable organization. (NOW FUNDED!)

The National Circus Festival will be held in Mullumbimby, NSW. For some of the ninjas it will be there first time seeing the Ocean. Included in the trip is an intensive professional training and development week with some of the top performers and artists and in the country. They will also get to perform several shows in front of large crowds of non-indigenous Australians who have never even heard of Mutitjulu or experienced the remote areas of this country.

Last year the kids went to Byron Bay, Alice Springs, and Melbourne for Dreamtime at the 'G in front of 85,000 people! The whole community, elders, younger siblings, came out to welcome them home and show their pride. It impacts everyone, not just the ninjas. 

Risks and Challenges

These kids come from a very unique and ever-diminishing tradition and it still poses a lot of challenges for living in the way they are expected to today. They often get very shy and nervous before performing in front of large groups of both indigenous and non-indigenous crowds. Sometimes they change their mind the day or minute before a show. But over time, Ninja Circus has created a team and a family that is separate from their home life and separate from school. It's a place that they have learned responsibility and discipline as well as creative expression. So far, we haven't had a single show where they actually drop out and the troupe is constantly growing and evolving.


What We Need

The ninjas are very excited for the trip! The money raised will go towards plane tickets, fuel, food, and accommodation for the long journey. If there are any unused funds they will go into the charity's bank account towards new circus equipment to create a safer training space and provide new props to replace the old damaged ones we still use. One the list is a new stunt trampoline, stilts, and unicycles which the ninjas are very eager to learn and use in upcoming shows.

Thank you so much for any size of donation that you can manage. If you can't donate financially at the moment, just help us share this page! Also, you can visit our website www.ninjacircus.org and www.facebook.com/ninjacircus to see some awesome photos and videos of the kids and stay updated with our tour and spread the word.

Much love and appreciation.

story:
[SSEX BBOX] international is a conference to organize and develop strategies and political tools to make progress on issues of public policies concerning sexuality and to combat recent advances by the religious fundamentalists.

The goals of this conference are:

1. Build new strategies with community to deal with misogyny, homophobia and transphobia.
2. Bring national and international media attention to these issues as a way to push government action.
3. Discuss epidemic of murders of trans women.
4. Exchange experiences and produce knowledge through lectures, debates, workshops, and coexistence.
5. Produce video and written material from the conference to share online.


[SSEX BBOX] is a global platform that brings together and strengthens the LGBTQIA community against violence and injustice. Please join and support our gathering in Brazil to help support bringing an end to this violence in our communities.

The First International [SSEX BBOX] Conference aims to discuss gendered and sexual violence in a way that builds community and finds ways to push back against a history of suffering and oppression. We will also be offering training and train-the-trainer opportunities for both community and service providers. With your help, we can create an impact on the violence again LGBTQIA people, in one of the most dangerous places to be an LGBTQIA person.


Why we need your support

Having a space to talk about this in Brazil is very important. The federal legislative body is led by a religious fundamentalist and the country faces great setbacks on promoting equality and civil rights.



Trans Murder Monitoring (TMM) project

For now we are so thrilled to announce the global conference in Brazil to bring together a ton of amazing people, perspectives, and community love!

1st International [SSEX BBOX] Conference is teaming up with the well established Mix Brasil Festival. Mix Brasil Festival is by far the largest LGBTQIA cultural event in Latin America, and one of the world's leading queer cinema festivals.This partnership’s goal is to facilitate discussions around previously unexplored issues facing the LGBTQIA community in Brazil. In the past 22 years Mix Brasil has seen crowds averaging 52,000 participants per year.

ENTRY TO THE CONFERENCE IS TOTALY FREE!!!

with $ 45,000 our event will be exactly the way we want it: all the people we wish to bring get their tickets to fly and the team gets paid for all the hard work. ;)

with $30,000 we have to cut some speakers and find friendly couches to accommodate our guests, the crew’s will be  paid a little less. Even so, it will be amazing!

with $10,000 [SSEX BBOX] will be working just out of love, we will cut 1 day on the conference and a few less guests. But we will make it happen!!!

How we will spend the money


[SSEX BBOX] is  Pri Bertucci’s vision, executed by an ever-changing team of  dream builders. [SSEX BBOX] is a labor of love that is a tool of communication and awareness sharing. So far, [SSEX BBOX] is a  film series, ‘zine,  photography series, website, podcast and now conference! [SSEX BBOX] will to continue to grow as dreams evolve and community needs change.



Transparent writers ~ for [SSEX BBOX] & MixBrasil International Conference GLOBAL LGBTQIA COMMUNITY AGAINST VIOLENCE!!!
‪#‎socialchange‬ ‪#‎26hourbrazil‬ ‪#‎lgbtqiabrazil‬



Aside from empowering community, you will receive our love and gratitude !!!

story:
Kids need to be, just that... Kids.

Summer camp activities 4Kids and especially 4PalKids are needed more than ever. PalKids are no different in wanting to have fun and participating in community spirit. Because feeling good about oneself is just so important.

850 Palestinian Kids in Central Gaza belong to the Herak Youth Centre and this summer hopefully will be a summer with some good times and positive lasting memories. Herak Youth Centre volunteers don't want to miss one opportunity for the kids to be...  just kids this coming summer!

  • To learn more about the Herak Youth Centre which is completely run and supported by volunteers: please see www.herak-youth.org for more on this great youth centre!
  • The youth centre kids don't just play, they learn and they participate in community outreach activities too, helping more than 10,000 people just in 2014.
Summer camp is critical at this time because not only is the weather nice, and the kids can be outside, but the fun activities also embrace elements of pyschosocial support that is so needed for the children and youth in Gaza. These kids are are at high risk for war trauma as per the concerns of the United Nations who have expressed that 373,000 children are at risk for PTSD.
  • Simple excursions and events can make memories of a life-time and take the minds off the challenges of living with drones up above, a siege from the land, sea and air, and threats of violence and war from Israel.
  • Kids NEED to be just that, Kids.

Phase 1: What We Need ($1500 USD)

Because of the siege, we need to use what is on hand:

  • Kites for kids to play on the beach
  • Snacks and drinks during gatherings to stay fueled and hydrated
  • Art supplies so the kids can be creative
  • Balloons, soccer balls, face painting supplies
  • "Film nights": access to films that the kids can attend and enjoy an day of entertainment
  • Transportation to the beach and other places for picnics, fun and games

Funds:
  • Once the funds have been collected they will be sent to the Herak Youth Centre board treasurer (Rana Jamal Quffa) for dispersement which we will report on how the funds are spent in September 2015.
  • Because the Herak Youth Centre is integrated and the kids have a say and participate in its work and development, the kids will help us with the perks.
  • We are starting low because we can make money stretch far and wide. But the more we raise, the more we can do! Such as English classes, music and dance training and other cultural activities important to being Palestinian.

The Impact

850 kids from central Gaza will have the chance to experience positive moments in a social setting in which they are secure and able to express themselves while enjoying themselves in just being a kid.

  • Most adults in North America have experienced summer camps whether they are day or overnight camps and have many positive memories that last their lifetimes.
  • Camps are places for kids to be just kids.
  • We can take a little and make it go far in Gaza. Our Gaza team are dedicated volunteers since 2013 and have given not just their time and expertise but also money and material things to make this youth centre not just fantastic but also functioning.

Risks & Challenges

Sadly the world thinks that Palestinians and Palestinian kids are not deserving of joy or peace and therefore make great efforts to block these initiatives.

  • We use local technologies and materials that with our ingenuity we will find ways to give these kids time to smile and experience positive life. 
  • Instead of flying kites, we can build sandcastles; instead of providing snacks and drinks we will ask parents to pack a light snack and water; instead of hiring a coach to transport the kids, we will make a trip to the park and have sing-a-longs and other activities that don't require material things; instead of having a movie night, we will make skits and play games such as charades. We will probably do all these things anyway, but we want to make the experiences this summer diverse and engaging for something different and inspiring. We want the kids to experience being just a kid and enjoying what other kids enjoy too.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The Camp

Following in the footsteps of AYF Western Region’s Youth Corps initiative in the city of Gyumri, the Armenian Youth Federation of Canada began a camp in Vanadzor in the summer of 2011, the third largest city in Armenia. The idea was to organize a free two-week camp for local children aged 8-14, many from the nearby orphanage and other disadvantage families. 

Camp Vanadzor will be running from July 20 to 31, 2015!


How You Can Help

Of course, none of this would be possible without our self-sacrificing and dedicated members. The camp seeks volunteers to dedicate two weeks in Armenia. For those two weeks, volunteers will work at the camp as counsellors, implementing a predetermined curriculum and supervising their arranged group. Past volunteers have described the experience as both challenging and rewarding.

Funding will go towards:

  • Supplies for various camp activities including: sports, arts and crafts, music, and education.
  • T-shirts for the campers.
  • A bag for each camper filled with school supplies and hygiene products. 
  • Daily lunch for over 350 campers. 


The Impact

Apart from games and activities, the children are provided the opportunity to receive lessons on English, computers, health, Armenian history and citizenship. The children are also provided with a daily lunch and snack as well as a backpack full of school supplies.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a donation we ask you to please share this page to your friends and family. Camp Vanadzor cannot be made possible without the funding we require to run the camp. Please do all you can to ensure the children of Vanadzor are able to attend this camp this summer.
story_txt:
The Camp 
Following in the footsteps of AYF Western Region’s Youth Corps initiative in the city of Gyumri, the Armenian Youth Federation of Canada began a camp in Vanadzor in the summer of 2011, the third largest city in Armenia. The idea was to organize a free two-week camp for local children aged 8-14, many from the nearby orphanage and other disadvantage families. 
Camp Vanadzor will be running from July 20 to 31, 2015!

How You Can Help
 Of course, none of this would be possible without our self-sacrificing and dedicated members. The camp seeks volunteers to dedicate two weeks in Armenia. For those two weeks, volunteers will work at the camp as counsellors, implementing a predetermined curriculum and supervising their arranged group. Past volunteers have described the experience as both challenging and rewarding.
Funding will go towards:  Supplies for various camp activities including: sports, arts and crafts, music, and education. T-shirts for the campers. A bag for each camper filled with school supplies and hygiene products. 
Daily lunch for over 350 campers.     
The Impact Apart from games and activities, the children are provided the opportunity to receive lessons on English, computers, health, Armenian history and citizenship. The children are also provided with a daily lunch and snack as well as a backpack full of school supplies.   

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a donation we ask you to please share this page to your friends and family. Camp Vanadzor cannot be made possible without the funding we require to run the camp. Please do all you can to ensure the children of Vanadzor are able to attend this camp this summer.

story:
Thank you for checking out our cause! 

We are launching this fundraising campaign to ensure that our arts and creative writing youth program, SUMMER AT SIXTH STREET, is accessible to the low-income community we serve. We need your help! All proceeds go directly towards the students, and making sure they can attend the program for free or very low cost. 

Here’s some background information on what we’re up to:

For the past 3 years, Jen has run a thriving, FREE summer and after school program for middle school youth at Sixth Street Community Center, a cozy and colorful neighborhood enclave in the Lower East Side that runs a bustling CSA program and focuses on food and housing justice in the neighborhood.

Jen’s programs were a great success, grounded in rich exposure to the creative arts and building affirmative and inclusive community for youth during the critical beginning of adolescence. The programs supported low-income families by providing their children with no-cost, varied and enriching summer and after school experiences. All of the work was funded with the support of a company, whose three year commitment to the program recently ended. 

Our partners at Sixth Street Community Center encouraged us to continue the summer program, offering help in fundraising as well as providing the needed program and office space. Jen brought Libby, a dear friend and collaborator, back on board, and we began advertising Summer at Sixth Street in early May, with a vision of charging families a per-session fee in order to fund our first independently run program for upper elementary and middle school youth. The program would feature daily arts and creative writing/poetry workshops, supplemented by urban/rooftop gardening and capoeira workshops. Students’ creative work would be shared and celebrated at the end of the session with an open house for friends and families. The program would celebrate creative self-expression and skill building, friendship and community building, and exposure to new and enriching experiences. 

Many of the families in our community network expressed great enthusiasm for having their children attend the program, but the prices just weren’t in their budget. We have a growing amount of interest for both our July and August sessions, and we would love to offer the program to families for free or very low cost, as we have in the past. Many young people in the neighborhood still don’t have summer plans, and anybody who has attended an amazing summer program knows the lasting impact such an experience can have.

Please watch our video to learn more about what we value about teaching, the kinds of creative arts workshops we plan to offer, and why this project is important to our personal growth. 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

LOVE, JEN AND LIBBY

A LITTLE BIT MORE ABOUT US:

Jen Chantrtanapichate is an artist and youth worker with a background in visual arts and jewelry design. Jen has directed thriving summer and after school programs out of Sixth Street Community Center for the past three years. Her workshops with young artists have explored Suminagashi inks, printmaking techniques including collagraph, watercolor, observational studies, textiles and weaving, and sculpture. Jen particularly enjoys using artistic expression as a vehicle to build community and empowerment amongst young people. She is currently pursuing a Masters in Urban Planning at Hunter College and is particularly interested in planning at the community-based level.  

Libby Mislan is a teaching artist and performance poet who is passionate about community-based arts. Libby has worked as a poetry and creative writing teaching artist with The Harlem Children's Zone, Arts! by the People, and Grand Street Settlement. Workshops she has crafted for young writers have explored the themes of neighborhood, community, love, relationships, learning experiences, myth and folktale, and magical realism. She loves to fuse her writing workshops with elements of visual art and movement, and prepare young people to read their work with expression and confidence.

story:
I'm a family man with three kids. I've been fixing primarily Apple products in everything from local warranty shops to Apple's testing facility for fifteen years. At this point I need to move on to a steadier occupation with better pay. 

I've entered the Automotive Technician program at Bellingham Technical College in pursuit of an Associate of Applied Science degree and a new career. I'll be pursuing ASE certification and in August I'll be interning with a local business.

In order to have the best chance of finding a good job from my Internship on I need every advantage I can create. Since I'm attempting this entirely on grants and juggling three kids, a wife with severe PTSD and school I have exactly ZERO budget for tools.

In the Auto industry there are a few things employers look for. I have a clean driving record and no drug habits. I don't even drink more than a handful of beers a year. So that part is covered.

What I need is my own set of tools. Small shop owners, who make up the market I'm most interested in are very possessive of their tools and shop space. Over the years of fixing small machines I've come to really appreciate the difference quality tools make.

For the month of October in conjunction with standard Educational prices I have a chance to order a complete set of tools from Matco at the ridiculous discount of 60%. Naturally I'd like to leverage that as far as possible.

A full set of tools, storage included comes to just under $8,000.00 for about $15,000.00 worth of professional grade, lifetime warranty tools. 

If I can combine a full set of my own tools with the above and get them ordered before October 30th I'll both be able to get the whole set for a lot less than I will ever be able to again and have enough time to get muscle memory with them before the onset of my internship.
