story:
A STOP Gala would be a night to remember. But...

Imagine the expense of having a Gala, to the organization and to you: 

Car cleaning/gas/parking: $40;  Food & Drink $35;  Space Rental $1,500; Outfit $100; Hair  $100;  Decorations $200; Event Planning $5,000.

IT ADDS UP!

As a supporter, you know we can do so much towards our mission with that money.

Earlier this month 9 trauma center protesters, including 2 FLY youth leaders, were arrested at a sit-in at the University of Chicago Administration building. They were demanding that University President Zimmer take action to open a needed south side trauma center. Donors gave to support bail and legal fees which allowed us to ensure everyone's release and to support the lawyers representing the protestors. These donations emboldened trauma center protestors and is inspiring youth leaders to take similar stands in the future. It lets us know that when we take a bold stand, our community has our back.

So instead of buying a ticket for a gala, let us use your most generous donation (anything from $5 to $500 counts!) towards the work of building FLY, the Trauma Center Campaign, the Audy Home Campaign, the Mental Health Movement, and the Chicago Tenants Council:

$5 will cover bus fare for a member to attend a planning meeting;

$20 will go towards printing materials for one of our summer door knocking days;

$50 will go towards banners and sign making materials for our next rally;

$80 will go towards a stipend for a FLY youth leader to facilitate a workshop in our summer program and mentor the next generation of youth leaders and organizers;

$200 will register a Mental Health Movement leader for the Roots and Remedies Conference in N.C. to learn from and share with health care justice campaigns;

$500 will send a tenant leader to a national housing conference in D.C.

Please donate it all to the work, and we’ll see you at the next action & victory party.

Our fiscal year ands June 30th; we need your donation today!

story: I want to help Dambar rebuild his home as soon as possible as the monsoon season is approaching! His family also needs money just to eat, as Dambar is a mountain trekking guide, and until people return they are completely broke and homeless, living in a tent in the damaged city of Kathmandu.
story_txt: I want to help Dambar rebuild his home as soon as possible as the monsoon season is approaching! His family also needs money just to eat, as Dambar is a mountain trekking guide, and until people return they are completely broke and homeless, living in a tent in the damaged city of Kathmandu.

story:
Short Summary

My aircraft restoration company, Assend Dragon Aviation, LLC , is soliciting small-to-large fund gifts to donate to a local non-profit which  has been able to procure a restorable 1943 US Navy TC45-J (Beechcraft Model 18, BU #51242) under a  2 year "lease to own" contract. This well-known (but for now un-named) restoration & preservation group hopes to be able to place this historic warbird in its Historic Flights Program along with a B-25 and T-6's once it has been completely refurbished to modern configuration and safety standards.  My name is Doc Hecker, and I am a WWII aviation enthusiast with an  A&P, IA (Inspection Authorization), and warbird restoration experience.  This flying historical twin-engine aircraft is in need of radio upgrades, paint and minor engine, structural, sheet metal and fabric control surface repairs.  We have been relying on personal member contributions so far, but we were not budgeted for this project when it recently became available to us.  YOU can be part of this historic return to service of an unique part of WWII  military aviation history. A donation of any size can be hugely crucial to our success in returning this iconic aircraft to service! 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $25,000.00 to upgrade our avionics, interior and exterior fabric and paint.  Our maintenance teams are currently doing all of the work at no cost to the unit.  All donations collected through Assend Dragon Aviation, LLC will go directly to the aircraft restoration - there are no admin costs at my level.  Any leftover funds will go towards purchasing the aircraft in 2 years.  All donors will be honored on an aircraft sandwich board which will accompany the aircraft on its tour schedule.  

The Impact

The central Texas located non-profit restoration group has a great track record of restoring historic WWII aircraft to flying status.  This non-profit group also maintains a museum of authentic rare WWII artifacts from all branches of military service.  ANY financial assistance that you can provide will allow this warbird to return to the skies in a short matter of time in 2015.

Other Ways You Can Help --> Come Out and See Us in Action - Or Help Us in Person in the San Marcos, TX area!

story:
Summary

A devastating 7.8 magnitude earthquake hit Nepal on Saturday, April 25th. Over 8,000 have been injured, over 5,000 have died, and over 10,000 may be confirmed dead soon. Tens of thousands, including children, have been displaced and nearly 8 million have been directly affected. 1.4 million of this 8 need food aid. Help these people get the food, water, and medical assistance they need by donating today.

Your Donation

All funds will go directly to the following relief programs as needed: World Food Programme, Charity: Water, UNICEF, and Doctors Without Borders, to provide sanitation, rehabilitation, humanitarian assistance, medical supplies, food, and water. 

  • After donating $5 or more, you will receive a light blue "Make a Difference: Help Nepal" wristband to spread awareness to this cause.

Tens of thousands, including children, have been displaced and nearly 8 million have been directly affected. 1.4 million of this 8 need food aid. Help these people get the food, water, and medical assistance they need by donating today.   Your Donation All funds will go directly to the following relief programs as needed: World Food Programme, Charity: Water, UNICEF, and Doctors Without Borders, to provide sanitation, rehabilitation, humanitarian assistance, medical supplies, food, and water.   After donating $5 or more, you will receive a light blue "Make a Difference: Help Nepal" wristband to spread awareness to this cause.

story:
Short Summary

Robert Ricks , the Lead Mentor in this program, has requested help fundraising for the organization, Mentors Inspiring Boys & Girls....let's help them!

He writes, "To Friends and Fans of M.I.B. Mentors Inspiring Boys & Girls We have outgrown the space that has been allotted to us at Edgerton Recreation Center and we are looking at some space on Monroe Ave. In order for us to make this move we are going to need to do a different fundraiser during the month. I don't beg because I was told that begging makes people hate you. We are simply asking you to support our Youth and Family events. I assure you that they will be fun, engaging and informative. I am a little afraid but I know God is not the author of fear…..If you got us say you got us, If not we still love you!!!"


What We Need

Funding request: venue rent ($10,400)

The funds are needed to help M.I.B. afford a larger space, to meet and impact Rochester city youth where they can be themselves (boisterous, loud, creative, fun, and excited to learn); not only to learn about hip hop dance, step, theater, and creative writing, but also a space where they can have social events, play music, sing, play ping pong, play pool, and be themselves. M.I.B. has found such a space and it costs $200 per week. They will offer this program July 2015-July 2016.

part two of funding request: (operations/staffing: if over goal....)

Most of our work so far has been on a volunteer basis.  We are a fledgling organization and have no paid full-time staff at this time.  To continue to support the mentoring program (teaching kids creative writing, theater, and hip hop dance step, we will pay our staff mentors a living stipend if we go over goal.

part three: Admin: ($936) the website charges a small fee for running the campaign.


The Impact

  • Your contributions help the mentors to provide an alternative to stagnation and crime for kids in the inner city of Rochester, NY, the third-poorest city in America.
  • We have made great strides with the M.I.B. youth. Many of our youth have come out of their shells and where initially they spoke just above a whisper, upon entering the program, now have little issue speaking in front of a group, socializing with their peers, sharing their ideas and performing in front of an audience. We have seen many cases where youth were struggling in classes, and with the support of our staff, have raised their grades.
  • Because of the level at which our youth carry themselves at events and perform on stage, they have been asked to perform at numerous events around the city and have even performed in Albany, in front of an audience of 2,000! One of performing groups won 1st place in the Ms. Sweet Potato Pie Talent Contest.
  • M.I.B. has produced plays and involved youth from the city of Rochester, NY at every level of production, including acting in shows to a packed house!  One  play produced was called "Black and Blues" and another was called "Where You At Lord".  Mentors weave the moral and the real: the lessons taught via creative expression are of African American faith and perseverance restored despite tragedy, trouble, and chaos in the inner city where stories unfold.  To learn more, visit http://ddppmedia.com/  and https://www.facebook.com/pages/Mentors-Inspiring-Boys-Girls/651532078211877 on Facebook.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the link even if you can't give a donation today!! If you know our program, share your experience and let people know we are committed, passionate, and able to provide inspiration to our youth!

story:
On April 25 2015, a devastating earthquake of 7.8 magnitude struck the country of Nepal. The earthquake caused fatalities, injuries, and major structural damages - including homes and schools. As a school community, closely linked to Nepal, we are reaching out to help raise funds in their recovery. This is an effort led by Dream Flag schools to raise funds to help support Khumjung school children affected by the earthquake in Nepal. Funds raised will go towards rebuilding the School and homes in the village of Khumjung, Nepal. Please join us as we help children in Nepal rebuild their mountain of DREAMS!


About the Dream Flag Schools

The Dream Flag Project® began in 2003 at The Agnes Irwin School in Philadelphia. Students studied the poetry of Langston Hughes and then wrote their own dream poems. They printed them on cloth, decorated them with art, and connected them on clotheslines. Modeled after Nepalese Prayer flags, the Dream Flags were meant to share positive hopes with the world. Today, there are more than 400 Dream Flag Schools, across 42 US states and in 26 other countries.

http://dreamflags.org


Where the Funds Will Go:

We are raising funds to go to the Greater Himalayas Foundation, an existing partner of the Dream Flags Project. The GHF is a 501 c 3 tax-deductible nonprofit organization which has been working in Nepal since 2007. All of the funds raised here will go to supporting the rebuilding of Khumjung.

www.theghf.org

Modeled after Nepalese Prayer flags, the Dream Flags were meant to share positive hopes with the world. Today, there are more than 400 Dream Flag Schools, across 42 US states and in 26 other countries.http://dreamflags.orgWhere the Funds Will Go:We are raising funds to go to the Greater Himalayas Foundation, an existing partner of the Dream Flags Project. The GHF is a 501 c 3 tax-deductible nonprofit organization which has been working in Nepal since 2007. All of the funds raised here will go to supporting the rebuilding of Khumjung.www.theghf.org

story:
Short Summary

I know the video is not great but the idea is! My name is Arpita Khadria and I am an Entrepreneur. I run a small brand consulting firm called Barefoot. For the last one year I have been passionately working on a game idea that I firmly believe in. $15,000 of my personal savings have already been invested by me to bring this idea to life! I think it has tremendous potential and varied applications, especially in the education space. Now we need your help! www.signtistgame.com

So in short:

· All other word games today are just about jumbled letters. Be it Scrabble, Ruzzle, Boggle. Signtist is different!

· The idea- You know how we unknowingly make a pattern while typing an SMS? Signtist does the opposite! It gives you the pattern and you have to crack the word. The idea is an absolute original and I have copyrights in 135 countries.

· Signtist is fun, educative, challenging and addictive. Here you either get the word or you don’t. So the satisfaction of solving the puzzle is much higher. Also this game can be played by anyone who can spell.

· The Signtist puzzle books are available on Amazon and Flipkart (India) and are becoming exceedingly popular among kids and adults alike. Especially for gifting as opposed to buying expensive plastic toys.

· Parents are demanding more categories of puzzles for kids and there is a huge market in the education space as well. Therefore the need for Signtist Kids App.

· We need money for the development of Signtist Kids App. A mobile game which will cater to kids aged between 5-15yrs. It will be offline and available on iOS and Android. This game will feature categories of words like animals, fruits, countries etc which children can solve. There will also be a vocabulary section based on age groups.

· Signtist can take various forms like puzzle books, mobile App, active game on TV, international game show, on ground events (quiz),a board game etc. It is a fun new way to learn and play. 


The Impact

After I launched my puzzle books, I realized that kids (even those below 10yrs) were taking to the game in a big way as well.  We have books on categories like Animals, countries etc so it is very useful for kids. They learn spellings, improve their vocabulary and increase general knowledge. What we also noticed was parents also encouraged their kids to buy the puzzle books. They told us to launch many more categories like fruits, vegetables, modes of transport etc. – topics which kids are learning.  They even suggested we launch a board game of Signtist.

It is this first hand feedback from kids and parents that led us to believe that we should launch a kids’ version of the app as well-An app that makes learning fun and competitive. Signtist kids will aim to become the next spelling bee. It is a property that can be taken to schools and colleges in the coming years. It is for this vision that we need your support!

Signtist requires fast decoding skills and sharpens the brain. It is a challenging and interesting game that can be used by teachers in schools to conduct quizzes and teach children new words. We think it can be the new sign language among kids!

Other Ways You Can Help

·  We need your help to make this the most loved word game! So tell as many people to contribute, even if you cannot. Share, like, spread the word!

·  Tell more people about the Signtist Puzzle books (available only in India as of now), which is a much better gifting item than plastic toys!

story:
One reason why children in Ghana don’t go to school is because they don’t have a school uniform. The lack of school uniforms has become an obstacle which has a negative impact on school attendance and education.

When the parent or caretaker doesn’t have enough money to buy a uniform they don’t send the child to school. Also, when a child’s uniform gets torn and the parent can’t afford to fix it, the child will stop attending school.

The aim of this campaign is to provide uniforms to 91 children in the community Mafi-Dedukope. The children are in Kindergarten, lower primary and the middle school and lack a uniform or wear a torn uniform.

                         

The plan is to give uniforms to the youngest children (5-6 years) first, as they begin 1st class in August and the uniform will give them a good start to their education.

The cost of making the uniform (the fabric and the tailor fee) is $13 (50 Ghana Cedi). The uniforms will have a positive effect on the children’s attendance in school as well as contribute to the livelihood of the tailors in the community.

Please contribute to a brighter future for the children by making a donation or by sharing the campaign with your friends and family! Every contribution is valuable and much appreciated!

story:
Hello everyone!


My name is Tigran Tarbiyan, from Yerevan, Armenia. This year I got an Admission from one of the best universities of Germany Goethe University Frankfurt and I am highly motivated to do my two-year Master in Management at Goethe University Frankfurt. After a long research I came to INDIEGOGO and strongly decided to start my fund-raising campaign for one of the most important for me life-event. Through INDIEGOGO I am going to apply You - my Friends and Followers to raise money for my studies.

It has been always critical for me to constantly enrich and diversify my educational background taking into account that more than 12-years working activities in my life made me always busy, as since the start of my study at Yerevan State University my parents had health problems and weren't able to work - so I was studying and working part-time to ensure the study expenses and support my family. 

So the reason I apply for financial help is justified on the grounds of my limited resources to finance myself.

The best point is the semester fee amounts to approximately 350 EUR per semester - it is why I had selected to apply to this university, otherwise the study expenses would be at least 3 times more than now. 


The $15.500(13.400 EUR) amount include these expenses:
  • 8.040 EUR - Living costs per year: the applicant must have 8040 EUR on a German bank account.
    Master in Management course is a full-time consecutive studies program for 2 years. 
  • 350 EUR - the fee per semester. I will study 4 semesters, so the total amount will be 1.400 EUR. 
  • For the second year I need 8.040 EUR as well, but I want you to contribute me only for 1,5 year, as while studying I hope I will the rights to do a part-time job and will ensure myself the living costs for the next 6 months (I'm not sure I will the rights to do a part-time job, as this is a full-time course).
I kindly ask you to bring your active contribution to help me to care my study expenses at Goethe University Frankfurt for which I am going to state other reasons why you shall make your financial contributions for me.

The first reason is that Goethe University Frankfurt is one of the Europe’s oldest and most well established universities. In a large student survey, about 80% of students recommended studying at Goethe University.
One of the reasons is that Armenia is an economically developing country and it is in the beginning stage of its development therefore our country is seeking to build bridges between Armenia and Europe in the fields of business and culture. The promotion of the European model is crucial and me and my generation want European values to have an impact in our country too. It is our task to adapt European values to the realities and needs of the 21st century by setting the right priorities and by bringing the European Union closer to our citizens.

The other reason is my confidence that Master in Management at Goethe University Frankfurt will provide me with knowledge, confidence, and contacts to realize my dreams. I do believe that this program will enhance my knowledge in the sphere I work and will help me with implementing the acquired knowledge and techniques in my country upon return. 

Taking into account all above mentioned and also the fact that there is no course of Master in Management in Armenia, I am highly inspired to do study in Frankfurt, which is the heart of Europe, and I strongly believe that I can learn much from the professionals in an economically developed country. 

The Master in Management at Goethe University Frankfurt will provide me with the skills that I need to operate as an experienced marketing and management professional and finally to help my country to flourish and enter the international arena as an economically developed country.

Anyway, I thank you for your time and efforts - at least you can share my campaign with your friends and followers. 


The winter semester starts on October 12th, and I will be in Germany in September. It's why the deadline of my campaign is 45 days after launching, as it can take up to 15 business days after the deadline for me to receive my funds.

Thanks in advance and waiting for your active contribution.

story:
Introduction

Hi, my name’s Alex Landry. I live in Auburn, Maine and attend Edward Little High School. I’m going to graduate next year, but before I do I have an amazing opportunity. I was recently accepted into an esteemed gap year program called Thinking Beyond Borders. The program selects eighteen young people to embark on various journeys throughout the world, and I am glad to say I am one of the few selected!

                                                                   

                   

What I Plan To Do

Thinking Beyond Borders (TBB) is unlike any other gap year program I researched (and I did a lot of research) because it is more than simply going to a different place in the world and doing service there. Sure, service and enrichment are integral parts of the program, but Thinking Beyond Borders is more dedicated to fostering long-lasting change. This is attempted by thinking critically about various world issues, such as education, justice and morals, and sustainable agriculture, and possible solutions to worldwide “problems.”

While looking externally at critical issues, Thinking Beyond Borders also stresses internal growth and development. While interacting with and learning from host families and the esteemed group leaders who will help guide the journey, I hope to develop and grow stronger as a person on an intellectual and emotional level.

Why I’m Doing It

As I end high school and prepare for college, I want to put myself in a position to be successful, happy and contribute in a meaningful way in the world. I believe TBB is a great way to provide more worldly experience for me as I begin to contemplate what exactly I want to study, but also they type of person I wish to become. I want to learn and grow and fail and succeed in order to get the most out of a wonderful opportunity – higher education. I believe the opportunity of a college education is a wonderful one, and I want to get as much as I can out of it. I believe a gap semester with Thinking Beyond Borders will be abundantly valuable in helping achieve this goal. Alums of TBB have praised the program as a life-changing experience that helped shaped their views on different cultures and define who they were as people. I hope to get a similar result out of this great opportunity, and am extremely excited for the life-changing experience!


The Itinerary

The program starts on February 14th, 2016 in Mindo, Ecuador. Mindo is home to “cloud forests” and canopies of vegetation. It’s here where the members of the TBB program meet and get to know each other. After that initial week, we travel to live with host families and study education in Ecuador. We’ll work with public and private schools, and try to evaluate how education effects equity and justice within the community and as a whole.

Next is an excursion to the Incan ruins of Machu Picchu, in Peru. The ruins are mysterious as they are beautiful, as the actual construction and use of the many fortresses remains unknown.



       

   

After our hike, we go to Bolivia to study sustainable agriculture. Bolivia is one of the most prominent farming countries in South America, so it is a great place to learn firsthand the “ins and outs” of long-term, reliable food supply for a vastly expanding world.

At long last, the TBB group will return to the United States. Our nation’s capital – Washington, D.C. – to be exact. Here we will bring what we learned during our three months abroad to critical discussions with members of Congress, the World Bank, and various NGOs. This part of the trip is labeled the “culmination” and it is just that. Here is an opportunity to reflect on my learning and experiences into powerful conclusions, and create a final project to raise awareness about critical global issues.

How You Can Help

Thinking Beyond Borders is an amazing, enriching experience. But with all good things comes a price. The total cost of a gap semester with TBB is $12,000, not including airfare and other expenditures. I’m asking you to make a contribution towards this campaign and my goal. This contribution serves as an investment in me, and will not be taken lightly. I understand that in asking for money to attend a program dedicated to fostering worldly understanding and self-improvement, I will have to take risks and action. I want to live up to the expectation presented here that I am a driven individual who wants to understand both himself and the world he inhabits better.

ANY contribution, large or small, is so greatly appreciated. A donation shows me that my story resonated with you, and that you believe in me and my goal. That kind of interpersonal faith is truly inspiring, and extremely powerful.

Thanks

I’d like to thank you for taking the time to read my story and for considering contributing to my goal. As a major “thank you” for showing your support in both me and my goal, I’ve listed some “perks” that are available to contributors. I hope you find them satisfactory! Also, if you leave me your email address, I intend on providing updates along the way describing my journeys and learning for those that wish to follow me on this experience.

I want to reiterate how thankful I am. Even if you didn’t donate anything, the fact that you read my story all the way down to here is extremely supportive. I’m quite apprehensive about this trip, after all. It’s defiantly a wonderful opportunity, but it is also quite scary to leave home and travel to unfamiliar territory, with people you don’t know, doing things you’ve never done before. Knowing that others support me and this trip is reassuring, and gives me courage to go through with this adventure. Thank you for your support.

story:
Help Humanity First restart its vocational training operations in Liberia after the Ebola Outbreak !!!


Vocational Training Project

Humanity First set up a vocational school in 2011 to help the underprivileged youth in Liberia to become self-sufficient.  The goal is to teach the youth skills at a subsidized rate so that they can earn a living.  After being non-operational for a year during the ebola crisis, the HF Liberia team has just restarted its new session this past May.  Currently the school offers the following trades: construction works, electrician, auto-mechanic, auto-electrician, plumbing, and AC repair.  The courses are 6 months long and we offer certificates and references through which the graduates are able to find employment.  In our current operations we are able to generate back 70% of the cost of operations while relying on external funding and grants to sustain the remaining costs.  Since 2011, the school has graduated 800 students and approximately 40% have found jobs in their relevant trades.

Now we are seeking to expand through several projects and seeking funding for the following: staring up a driving training program, starting a computer literacy class, building renovations, and lab equipments.

Startup of a driving school

Many prospective students have inquired about driving classes.  Driving is indeed a privilege in Liberia and most of the youth do not know how to drive.  By opening a driving school within the current infrastructure of our vocational college we will be able to teach approximately 20 people how to drive each month.  This will pave the way for employment opportunities for underprivileged youth to get jobs as chauffeurs, taxi drivers, and truck drivers.  Below is a financial breakdown of what we need to get started

  • 2 used cars ~ $2500
  • Auto-mechanical adjustments to install instructor side controls ~ $500
  • 2 instructor salaries to cover first 3 months ~ $600
  • classroom items such as whiteboards, tables, instruction manuals ~ $200

Total cost: ~$3800

Startup of a computer literacy class

It is not possible to survive in today's world without a computer, yet too many youth in Liberia don't know how to use a computer, let alone use it proficiently.  Humanity First want to start a 3 month computer literacy training course for underprivileged youth.  The course will cover basic component of a computer, typing, using word editors and other office software, and using the internet.  Your donations will help us set up and start this meaningful project in the upcoming semester.

Below is a financial breakdown of what we need to get started

  • 20 computers ~ $5000
  • One instructor salaries to cover 1st 3 months ~ $600
  • classroom items such as whiteboards, tables, instruction manuals ~ $200

Total cost: ~ $5800

Lab Equipment

The HF vocational school seeks to prepare students in their respective trades with a solid theoretical foundation as well as provide them with an opportunity for applied and practical training.

We need to complete our lab equipment inventory so that our students have access to top quality practical training.  We need equipment ranging for ignition switches for the auto-mechanical students to flexible tubes for plumbing students, to refrigerants for air conditioning students.  In total we need about $850 dollars worth of equipment.


Total Cost : $850

Building renovations

After 1 year of being non-operational their is an urgent need to repair the surrounding walls and floors.  While fixing all the walls and floors will be quite expensive we are starting by fixing the main entrance wall and the main auditorium floor.

  • main entrance wall ~ $700
  • main hall floor ~ $ 600

Total Cost: ~ $1300

Team

Sabeel Sandhu - Prinicipal

Sabeel hails from Pakistan and has been the principal of the institution for the past 18 months.  He has a BS and Mphil in business administration from NUML Islamabad and graduated with distinction.  He held down the fort during the ebola epidemic and passionate about human resources, negotiation, entrepreneurship and business development for non-profit organization.

Barley F. Jensen - Vice Principal

Barley (BJ) is jack of all trades and master of them too!  He teaches the AC technician course and handles the day to day administration.  He is also a certified electrician.  He has been with the HF vocational school for the past 5 year starting off as a volunteer working his way up to be Vice Principal.  His super powers include laser vision!

Hassan Ahmed - Project and Operations Coordinator

I've come to Monrovia, Liberia on a one year volunteer mission with Humanity First.  My goals are to grow the HF projects currently in Liberia in terms of income and impact.  I have a BS in electrical engineering from University of Miami and MS in computer science from UNC-Chapel Hill.  I am interested in operations management and economic development in developing countries.

Perks

HF - pin for $10 contribution

HF - suncap $35 contribution

HF - 10 years of Serving Humanity memorial magazine - comes with $50 contribution

HF - picnic bag $20 contribution

More About Humanity First...

Humanity First is an international charitable trust established to promote and safeguard the preservation of human life and dignity.  Humanity First was established by the Ahmadiyya Muslim Community leadership and operates as a non-political, non-sectarian international relief and development agency that works with the world’s poorest and most vulnerable people.

Humanity First was established in the UK in 1994 and now has operations in 43 countries across 6 continents. The majority of our aid workers and management are unpaid volunteers and our administration expenses are negligible. We are able to deliver significantly more aid value in the field from the funds we raise because our labour costs are very low.

Humanity First’s objectives are to:

  • Relieve suffering caused by natural disasters or human conflict
  • Promote peace and understanding based upon mutual tolerance and respect
  • Strengthen people’s capacity to help themselves

for more information go to www.humanityfirst.org


If you've made it this far, kudos to you :) !!!! I hope you can help us achieve our goals.
story_txt:
Help Humanity First restart its vocational training operations in Liberia after the Ebola Outbreak !!!
Vocational Training Project Humanity First set up a vocational school in 2011 to help the underprivileged youth in Liberia to become self-sufficient.  The goal is to teach the youth skills at a subsidized rate so that they can earn a living.  After being non-operational for a year during the ebola crisis, the HF Liberia team has just restarted its new session this past May.  Currently the school offers the following trades: construction works, electrician, auto-mechanic, auto-electrician, plumbing, and AC repair.  The courses are 6 months long and we offer certificates and references through which the graduates are able to find employment.  In our current operations we are able to generate back 70% of the cost of operations while relying on external funding and grants to sustain the remaining costs.  Since 2011, the school has graduated 800 students and approximately 40% have found jobs in their relevant trades.
Now we are seeking to expand through several projects and seeking funding for the following: staring up a driving training program, starting a computer literacy class, building renovations, and lab equipments.Startup of a driving school
Many prospective students have inquired about driving classes.  Driving is indeed a privilege in Liberia and most of the youth do not know how to drive.  By opening a driving school within the current infrastructure of our vocational college we will be able to teach approximately 20 people how to drive each month.  This will pave the way for employment opportunities for underprivileged youth to get jobs as chauffeurs, taxi drivers, and truck drivers.  Below is a financial breakdown of what we need to get started 

2 used cars ~ $2500
Auto-mechanical adjustments to install instructor side controls ~ $500
2 instructor salaries to cover first 3 months ~ $600
classroom items such as whiteboards, tables, instruction manuals ~ $200

Total cost: ~$3800
Startup of a computer literacy classIt is not possible to survive in today's world without a computer, yet too many youth in Liberia don't know how to use a computer, let alone use it proficiently.  Humanity First want to start a 3 month computer literacy training course for underprivileged youth.  The course will cover basic component of a computer, typing, using word editors and other office software, and using the internet.  Your donations will help us set up and start this meaningful project in the upcoming semester. Below is a financial breakdown of what we need to get started

20 computers ~ $5000
One instructor salaries to cover 1st 3 months ~ $600
classroom items such as whiteboards, tables, instruction manuals ~ $200

Total cost: ~ $5800
Lab Equipment
The HF vocational school seeks to prepare students in their respective trades with a solid theoretical foundation as well as provide them with an opportunity for applied and practical training. 
We need to complete our lab equipment inventory so that our students have access to top quality practical training.  We need equipment ranging for ignition switches for the auto-mechanical students to flexible tubes for plumbing students, to refrigerants for air conditioning students.  In total we need about $850 dollars worth of equipment.



Total Cost : $850
Building renovations
After 1 year of being non-operational their is an urgent need to repair the surrounding walls and floors.  While fixing all the walls and floors will be quite expensive we are starting by fixing the main entrance wall and the main auditorium floor.



main entrance wall ~ $700
main hall floor ~ $ 600

Total Cost: ~ $1300
Team
Sabeel Sandhu - Prinicipal


Sabeel hails from Pakistan and has been the principal of the institution for the past 18 months.  He has a BS and Mphil in business administration from NUML Islamabad and graduated with distinction.  He held down the fort during the ebola epidemic and passionate about human resources, negotiation, entrepreneurship and business development for non-profit organization.
Barley F. Jensen - Vice Principal

Barley (BJ) is jack of all trades and master of them too!  He teaches the AC technician course and handles the day to day administration.  He is also a certified electrician.  He has been with the HF vocational school for the past 5 year starting off as a volunteer working his way up to be Vice Principal.  His super powers include laser vision!Hassan Ahmed - Project and Operations Coordinator

I've come to Monrovia, Liberia on a one year volunteer mission with Humanity First.  My goals are to grow the HF projects currently in Liberia in terms of income and impact.  I have a BS in electrical engineering from University of Miami and MS in computer science from UNC-Chapel Hill.  I am interested in operations management and economic development in developing countries.
Perks
HF - pin for $10 contributionHF - suncap $35 contributionHF - 10 years of Serving Humanity memorial magazine - comes with $50 contributionHF - picnic bag $20 contribution

Humanity First was established in the UK in 1994 and now has operations in 43 countries across 6 continents. We are able to deliver significantly more aid value in the field from the funds we raise because our labour costs are very low.
Humanity First’s objectives are to:

Relieve suffering caused by natural disasters or human conflict
Promote peace and understanding based upon mutual tolerance and      respect
Strengthen people’s capacity to help themselves

for more information go to www.humanityfirst.org

story:
Short Summary


“Ambassadors of Hope” is a feature-length film documenting India’s child laborers. Children in several parts of India are subject to torturous work conditions in mines, factories or farms  to support their families. Despite the country’s “Right to Education Act,” the promise of free compulsory education remains an unrealized dream because India’s child laborers are the backbone of the economic engine that runs the heavily populated South Asian country.

 Now, there may be hope. A new generation of empowered students, nestled in  Silicon Valley, home to high-tech innovation and development, want to turn that unrealized dream into a reality.

Can they do it? Can these students change a legacy of torment and abuse? 

Our team's mission through this documentary is to reveal the practices of child labor and hopefully show how educating India's youth can begin to lay a foundation to help end child enslavement. Telling the children's stories can change, one life at a time, which  causes a ripple effect that can transform communities. Imagine what these children can contribute to their family, their community and to the world once they are no longer bound by harsh work conditions and able to help others! Mostly, kids can be kids.

 A percentage of your donation will go to Home of Hope, a charity that works to help these children rise out of poverty and create a new way of living. Please join our movement.

Meet our Team

Vera Anderson, Co-Director, Executive Producer
Vera Anderson is an award winning producer whose passion for excellence in media production is the cornerstone of her company, Anderson Entertainment. Her love of television, music and film continues to fuel her career.

It was an interview with famous philanthropist that would inspire her to become a documentary filmmaker. Transformed by her conversations with Alice Waters, the mother of the slow food movement, educator Oral Lee Brown, and Dr. Nilima Sabharwal, the founder of Home of Hope, Anderson continued to fuel her drive to tell stories that would impact the world.

Anderson's career has taken her to both the East and West coast producing and writing. Her credits include “The View” on ABC and “Today in New York” on WNBC. A senior producer and writer, Anderson crafted promotion for WNYW/Fox Television's, “Good Day New York,” and "The TEN O’CLOCK  NEWS. A winner of two PROMAX GOLD NORTH AMERICA awards, an Addy, four bronze TELLY awards and six EMMY nominations for her work at NBC. Prior to graduating from Long Island University, Anderson obtained production credits at Spike Lee's FORTY ACRES AND A MULE FILMWORKS and DEF JAM RECORDING GROUP, INC. Anderson received her graduate degree in management from the University of Phoenix.


Jonathan Drum, Director of Photography
Jonathan began his professional career at Washington, DC as a photographer and instructor, where he later became member of the White House and Congressional Press Corps, with BELO Corporation’s national bureau. Working as a photojournalist for the next eight years, Drum interviewed presidents and members of Congress, covered national and global issues including 9-11 attacks on the Pentagon and the World Trade Center. Later he became an EMMY Award winning photographer and editor for “IN WINE COUNTRY” on NBC utilizing his knowledge of wine after studying at the world famous Culinary Institute of America. Drum recently helped launch a national TV show called, "ECO COMPANY," hosted be teenagers, exploring the aspects of going green and understanding how it affects our world. Drum received his masters in Film and Television from Northwestern University.
 
Pamela Gibson MacDougall,  Writer, Producer
Pamela Gibson MacDougall's diverse media career has taken her inside the halls of many major networks and around the world.

MacDougall has been a senior writer, producer and editor for Fox, NBC, ABC Family, and Walt Disney Studios. A certified paralegal specializing in forensic law, she was on the production team of "Different Places," a dramatic short about the impact of suicide. Other documentaries include, “Moving Pictures” and “Bay Area Proud” both of which fueled her desire to pursue working on more documentaries. MacDougall shot electronic press kits (EPK's) for movies, directed shoots and worked with actors and musicians such as Jennifer Garner, Gary Cole and Smokey Robinson. She has written for national publications such as Road and Track. MacDougall also worked as a segment producer for the Annual Emmy Awards and has won numerous awards including eight TELLYS, six ADDYS, a PROMAX AWARD and an EMMY AWARD.

Janice Edwards- Writer/Producer
Janice Edwards is an EMMY  nominated producer, and award-winning talk show host and, published author and media coach.

She is the host and executive producer of “Bay Area Vista” airing on ION-TV and CreaTV. “Bay Area Vista” is produced through her production company Edwards Unlimited. (www.edwardsunlimited.com). Edwards is also host and co-executive producer of the award-winning show, “Signature Silicon Valley”, on CreaTV, spotlighting  news-makers, and issues in Silicon Valley. Her other credits include on air and production work at San Francisco's major stations: KNTV (NBC), KPIX-TV (CBS), KBHK (CW) and KRON 4 (formerly NBC). Her interviews span from politicians, actors to thought leaders such as President Barack Obama, Secretary of State Madeleine Albright, Oprah Winfrey, Robert Redford, Jerry Seinfeld, John Travolta, Gloria Steinem, Rachel Maddow, Dr. Cornel West, Deepak Chopra, Iyanla Vanzant,  Les Brown, and  WWE’s John Cena.   
 Her book, "Quality Angles" features interviews with Kevin Costner, Robert Townsend, veteran news anchor Evan White, and the late Tony award-winning director Lloyd Richards. Edwards has received numerous awards throughout her career. Among them include, a two-time CreaTive Award, a Trailblazer Award from the National Coalition of 100 Black Women-San Francisco, NAACP's  W.E.B. Dubois Award and Caring through Communication Award from the American Cancer Society. Edwards received her undergraduate degree from  Harvard University and and  graduate degree from UC Berkeley School of Journalism.

Delores Edwards - Writer, Producer
Delores Edwards is a producer, writer, director and an entrepreneur.  Her work is diverse and varied covering media in news, talk, documentary and entertainment television as well as digital platforms.  Her credits include producing for ABC News & News Specials, The Oprah Winfrey Show, CBS, CNN, A&E Biography, as well as writing and producing for VH1, BET, Good Day New York and PBS. Edwards has written and produced numerous long-form profiles and features on newsmakers, celebrities, and artists including Sheryl Crow, Patti LaBelle, Wyclef Jean, Alicia Keys, Sen. John Kerry and Jennifer Lopez. Her documentary work includes the award-winning, THE MEN OF THE USS MASON, an hour-long film for PBS narrated by Ossie Davis that chronicled the plight of African-American servicemen in the Navy during WW II as a contributing producer.  She was an Associate Producer on Fighter Destroyer Escorts, a full-length documentary on the 13,000 World War II sailors that served on ships during the war and directed HARLEM’S HANDMAIDS, a short on a group of African American nuns living in Harlem. She started her own company, marblehill MEDIA, (www.marblehillmedia.com) to produce and develop stories that continue to spark her interests today.  A graduate of Columbia University’s Graduate School of Journalism, and Northeastern University in Boston, Massachusetts, Edwards began her career at ABC News Nightline.



What We Need

Our goal is to raise 5,000 dollars to cover the following production costs.
$500.00 - Equipment Rental, (see list below) 
$1100 x 3 - Air Travel $3300.00
$300- Ground transportation and meals.
$900 room and board  in India for 5 days for  2 producers and 1 photographer.
Sony PXW-FS7 with a zoom lens
 1DSLR Viewfinders
Zoom H4n Digital Audio Recorder
Rode VideoMic Condenser Shotgun Microphone
Sennheiser Shotgun Microphone
2 - 4TB G-Raid Hard Drive
Shoulder Mount
Tripod
Micro LED On-Camera Light
Black Gaff Tape

& What You Get

All contributors will be invited to screenings where you as a contributor may be able to address the audience and share why contributing to our work was personally rewarding. Your story of contribution may be featured on our final website.

The Impact

 The internet, social media, FaceTime, Skype and so many ways of connecting us have made clear what many of us have always felt deep inside-we are all connected in ways that we sometimes do not realize. What that means is that some night when we can't sleep well, we may be acutely aware on some level that somewhere in the world, children are suffering, without a decent place to sleep, with stomachs growling and a bleak future of back-breaking, spirit stifling work ahead. They need you and the difference that your heartfelt generosity can make.There are nearly 28 million child laborers in India today.  Nearly 10% of adolescents working in hazardous conditions are working in family enterprises. 56% of the working adolescents are no longer studying. And 70% of those in hazardous conditions are not studying.  More boys (38.7 million) than girls (8.8 million) are involved in hazardous work. That means that their brilliance, leadership and important contribution to making our world better is being squandered and irretrievably lost. You can change the course of their lives and the course of our planet with your heartfelt investment in telling their story. They need you.We need you. Thank you.

Risks & Challenges

Our team may face personal danger and unforeseen challenges as we face dangerous circumstances to capture slave operations in the act, businesses that are sometimes funded by organized crime. We will work with local law enforcement and trained abolitionists who routinely raid and shut down these companies.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a donation and you would like to support the making of "Ambassadors of Hope" we're asking you to spread the word about this film. If you have services or skills you would like to contribute to help us get this project done please email us at Pendel1210@yahoo.com

Follow us on Twitter(@Ambassadors of Hope), Instagram (Ambassadors of Hope) and on Facebook

Thank you for making a world of difference and forever transforming the lives of children in need through your generosity.

story:
AXLR8 & F1 in Schools 

F1 in Schools is a huge, global and amazing project: created to promote STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) and Women in Motorsport, it allows students from all over the world to learn a huge variety of skills - from Engineering and Physics to Design and Marketing. Young students must create a team and build a small car, a pit display, elaborate a portfolio and create a brand and promote it, much like a real Formula 1 team.


AXLR8 (Accelerate) is a promising Portuguese team of passionate CLIP (The Oporto International School) students, who have participated in the project twice and finally fulfilled their dream of securing a place in the World Finals, in Singapore. Now they just need the funding to get themselves, and their product, there! 


At such a young age, these students are struggling to find different, creative ways to secure the money they can't earn themselves to meet the goals and aspirations they've worked ceaselessly towards, during the last two years.

With your help, they can go represent Portugal in the International fase of the competition, where they hope to be the highest ranking Portuguese team ever.

Getting to Singapore

In order to get to Singapore the team needs a budget of around 12,000€ to pay for the development and production of the car, the stand and the shipping costs involved, the sign-up fees and travel expenses. Because the campaign is one of Flexible Funding, even if we do not reach our goal, your investment will go towards these same things.

Every contribution counts, and to thank those who believe in the project, we've devised perks (described on the right) that are extremely personal, to truly reflect the team's gratitude.

The Journey

F1 in Schools provides a unique learning experience for students all over the world, and the AXLR8 team is no exception. Having participated in the previous season, where the team only made it to the National Finals, ranking in 6th amongst 20 teams, members have had the opportunity to learn from their journey and apply this knowledge into getting them this year's results: ranking 1st in the Regional finals and getting the awards for Best Identity, Engineering and Innovation; getting 3rd place at Nationals and winning the prizes of Best Social Media Strategy, Identity and Sponsorship and Marketing. This grants them a place in the World Finals of 2015, giving them two more months to fund their trip and gain an even more impressive skill set!


Perhaps one of the most challenging and useful skills the students have learnt over the course of the project is the mastering of several different softwares: Solidworks, a CAD program used by the team to design and conceptualise the car, and several design softwares such as Illustrator, Photoshop and InDesign.

Obstacles

The journey for AXLR8 has been a long and tough one so far, and it isn't over yet! Although the project is extremely enriching and enjoyable, it can be very challenging: as the last country to hold the National Finals, Portuguese teams have a much shorter window of time to raise the funds necessary to be at the World Finals, whilst also developing all other aspects of the project necessary to have an outstanding performance. 

As dynamic, perseverant and passionate individuals, AXLR8's team members are not going to let the circumstances demotivate them! The team shall work over the summer holidays with the same commitment they've put in over the course of the year, so as to take the Portuguese flag to the podium!

Other Ways You Can Help

It's not just about funding the project - the AXLR8 team also needs regular brand empowerment and promotion to spread word about our project and participation in the F1 in Schools challenge!

If you can't contribute towards our initiative, you can share our campaign, promote our team's social media and ask people to interact with them, in order to generate hype around the team and the project.

THANK YOU.

Other Ways You Can Help
 It's not just about funding the project - the AXLR8 team also needs regular brand empowerment and promotion to spread word about our project and participation in the F1 in Schools challenge!
If you can't contribute towards our initiative, you can share our campaign, promote our team's social media and ask people to interact with them, in order to generate hype around the team and the project.



THANK YOU.

story:
Your every cent matters and time is of the essence!

Our young, vibrant and passionate team are working 24/7 to ensure we reach survivors of the earthquake across rural areas of Nepal.

We are in severe needs of funds to continue our efforts.

Our goal is to raise at least 10000 USD.

100% of the funds collected will go directly to building materials & basic necessities.

Full financial evidence can be provided upon completion of the project.

Please help, donate now!

Full financial evidence can be provided upon completion of the project. Please help, donate now!

story:
Short Summary

  • I am an artist/writer/actor based in Kathmandu for the past ten years. My works have been shown widely (London, Delhi, Doha, Kathmandu etc), my writings have appeared regularly on Frieze, Asian Art News, Sahitya Akademi, National Book Trust, Depart, Hyperallergic etc. I have played leading roles in English language theatre productions of Nepal. 
  • As an active member of the arts community of Nepal I am shaken by the lack of infrastructure and support available to the art and theatre community here. I am bringing together respected gallerists, art critics, social workers and directors to form a fund that will help rehabilitate and at least partially reimburse medical expenses borne by the earthquake-devastated arts and theatre professionals of Nepal.

What We Need & What You Get

  • You can contribute as little as USD 10 though we need to raise a minimum total of USD 5000 since we are hoping to support at least 20 affected arts/theatre professionals ($250 each). This will help rebuild homes, pay for medical bills and cremation rites, provide basic support to those rendered unemployed by the quake and also help repair damaged art/theatre spaces. 
  • An advisory committee comprising eminent gallerists, art critics, artists, social workers, theatre directors and performers will distribute the funds to needy individuals and organizations through : a) nomination by existing and credible art/theatre institutions; b) direct outreach to the community.  Jennifer Higgie (Co-Editor of Frieze), Deborah Merola (Founder-Director of One World Theatre), Ingrid Cheron of Newa Chen, Yulia Koirala (Founder-Director Sushila Art Academy) are on the advisory committee of this initiative.
  • A complete record of the funds received and distributed will be made available online.
  • The more funds we receive, the more people will receive help. But we look forward to supporting at least 20 people/families at this point.
  • Each and every contribution will be mentioned and appreciated on our online records.
  •  Contribution above USD 500 will be awarded with a signed print of an artwork  OR a token of appreciation from the beneficiary (artist/theatre professional/organization).

The Impact

  • Your contribution will  help save lives and rebuild futures of talented and brilliant art & theatre professionals who can hardly make ends meet even during normal times. Nepal is a new republic and just recovering from a decade-long civil war, and is yet to have a Constitution even. The art economy here is next to nonexistent and though creative brilliance is more than abundant, its systematic promotion is almost nil. The creative community on the other hand is large in number.This leaves most arts/theatre professionals in a double-bind of poverty and declining productivity. A small contribution from you will provide these artists and performers with material relief and help them regain faith in themselves and the possibility of a future.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Do share this through Indiegogo tools as well as on Facebook, Twitter and other social media platforms. The more people get to hear of this, the more chance of a needy artist/theatre professional receiving direct financial support here!

story:
Descubre Una Lengua Una Cultura, Inc. es una corporación sin fines lucrativos que tiene como objetivo apoyar a jóvenes talentosos y de escasos recursos en sus estudios universitarios. 

A través de esta campaña donaremos a estudiantes que han demostrado compromiso en sus estudios, verificando sus notas de clases y logros obtenidos. 
Los recaudos serán otorgados como beca para estudios a una joven que hará su maestría en estudios literarios y lingüísticos en la Sorbona, Francia.
Como custodios de fondos limitados tenemos la confianza y credibilidad de los alumnos y amigos por haber demostrado integridad en el uso de ellos. Los becados, por mínima que sea la ayuda, siempre han quedado agradecidos porque los acompañamos en el proceso de desarrollo de sus proyectos educativos.

Hay varias maneras de ayudar: dona (dinero o tiempo), comparte, habla sobre la campaña y sus objetivos. Toda ayuda es apreciada. 

Como agradecimiento, a las primeras 35 personas, que donen un monto de $65 o más, le regalaremos el afiche de la 6ta edición del festival de Verano. El mismo fue realizado y donado por el artista Luis Maisonet. En el mismo, hace una propuesta dentro de la tradición del cartel puertorriqueño, un homenaje a Edith Piaf celebrando los 100 años de su nacimiento.

El Festival de Verano es un evento anual creado con el propósito de promover las lenguas y las artes así como el intercambio cultural.

story:
A Rage To Live:Surviving The Holocaust So Hitler Would Not Win is the story of Victor Breitburg who survived the Lódz Ghetto, Auschwitz, Buchenwald, Rhemsdorf and Theresiensdtat camps before his liberation on his 18th birthday on May 8, 1945 ... VE Day. We have been awarded an IndieBrag Medallion for our book and all of our Amazon reviews are 5 stars.
We are raising the funds for some travel expenses to New York and LA. Approximately 5 days for recording  and filming an accompanying documentary on the process (NY) and  3 days for final sound editing (LA). We also need a few portable pieces of recording equipment and software to match our studio qualifications for when we are not in a studio. We also need to rent a studio in NY for three days and 3 days in Buffalo.  If requested at the end of the campaign, a financial expenditure report will be available. If any funds are left over, they will be donated to a Holocaust Research Library or cover the cost of us donating books to school libraries. Professional actors including Lee Wilkof (and director), Duane Tucker, Aaron Krygier (playwright, screenwriter and director), Deborah Krygier  Joey Giambra (also boxer, playwright and musician), Janet Zarish,  Marc Blum, David Wohl, Hilary Walker and others from New York, Buffalo, and Hamilton, Ontario as well as all the tech people including our sound engineer, John Sisti in LA, are donating their services for this project for Yad Vashem and other Holocaust Research and school libraries that have had copies of our book since it was published in 2012.  Scott Ouellette and Brian Ferrall, accomplished classical/contemporary guitarists, composers and teachers are working with me to compose a music score for the book and Rocco DiPietro has joined the team

 Brian's Holocaust Suite.  This is 20 minutes in 5 movements.

See www.tolifeink.com and take a peek at the gallery.

You can address any questions to me at tolifeink@gmail.com.

The audio book will be available as a free download to anyone once the project is completed. A dvd with the audio book, a pdf booklet, a documentary on the project and interviews with Victor Breitburg ( the subject of the book) and those who have helped to bring his story to life will be available as a perk or for a fee, (free to libraries) to be determined, and all proceeds will go to Holocaust Education projects as part of our vision at TOLIFE...Ink as a small independent publisher.

We are committed to completing this project even if we do not meet out goal. So, any help we receive will go a long way.

We are also in the pre-publication process of helping another author bring her memoirs to life. She is an educator who has lived in three countries and relates her experiences with how vast the differences are in education from this perspective.

 Thank you for taking the time to visit .

story:
Short Summary

Twenty little dogs snarl menacingly at canine behavior specialist, Teresa Lewin. A word from her and they're all panting and wagging. The next minute they're all transformed into trees. What the heck? Is it dog whispering? Maybe a magic show? No, it's a presentation of the Be a Tree dog bite prevention program for a group of second graders. At the end of the session we ask "who has ever been bitten by a dog?" More than half of them raise their hands. We look at the teachers, the teachers look at us - we're all shocked. We know in that moment that we have to do more... much more, to prevent dog bites to children.


We Wanted to do More to Help Keep Kids and Dogs Safe

This led us to develop the Be a Tree program into a product that more presenters could use in schools. Which led us to create Doggone Safe, a non-profit dedicated to educating even more kids. Eleven years later, there are over 1400 presenters in more than 30 countries and they've educated more than 1 million children. We also created the Doggone Crazy! board game as a fun way to empower kids and families with the knowledge they need to stay safe.

“I really enjoyed doing the actions like the tree. I am kind of afraid of dogs, but now I feel much safer.” Mckay – grade 4 student – Dana Point California


You Can Help Us Keep Dogs in Their Forever Homes

Family dogs that bite or threaten kids are often relinquished to the shelter or worse. You can help us to stop that from happening.

You Can Help Us Keep Kids Safer

Kids that are bitten can carry physical and emotional scars for life. In rare and tragic cases they don't survive. You can help us stop that from happening.

Now that we're in the age of digital entertainment, we need to create an ipad (and later Android) version of the Doggone Crazy! board game to reach even more kids and families. 

You can help us with our mission to keep kids safe and dogs in their forever homes by funding the development of the Doggone Crazy ipad app and an associated "Keep Me Home" program whereby individuals and businesses can provide the app free to families adopting a dog from a rescue or shelter. There is nothing on the market for kids that gives this degree of realism combined with state of the art game capabilities and we hope you would like to help us make it a reality.

"Doggone Crazy is a fun game that teaches children how to interpret the body language and expressions of dogs. I gave the game to my grandchildren and they enjoyed it immensely. The oldest taught the dog signals and appropriate responses to her younger brothers and then proceeded to 'instruct' her parents as well. I think that this is a wonderful contribution toward understanding dogs better and keeping kids safer." Stanley Coren, Author of "The Intelligence of Dogs", "How to Speak Dog" and "How Dogs Think."

The Team

We love kids and we love dogs! As the creators of the award-winning Doggone Crazy board game and ipad apps for kids and many other kid products, this team has lots of experience educating and entertaining kids. 

Joan Orr and Teresa Lewin

Joan Orr and Teresa Lewin are internationally recognized experts in the fields of dog training and behavior. They're the Doggone Crazy creators and cofounders of Doggone Safe, a non-profit organization dedicated to dog bite  prevention and dog bite victim support. Joan is also cofounder and co-owner of TAGteach International, a company dedicated to positive reinforcement-based teaching for children and adults. Teresa is an animal behavior consultant with 30 years of experience. She is an expert in canine aggression rehabilitation and has trained and worked with dogs in  many different applications. They've won many awards for their work.

Greg Lilko and Jeff Kim 

Greg Lilko and Jeff Kim are the development team with over 30 years of combined experience in 3D animation, motion graphics and video production. Greg is a certified apple iOS developer. These talented developers have already produced two children’s apps currently on the app store. An app to help children with autism spectrum disorder and a goal game to help kids learn about money.


What We Need & What You Get

As you probably know, game development is an intense undertaking with gameplay design, graphics, animation programming and testing. A game like Doggone Crazy has an extra challenge. It has to be fun to play, but also has to be accurate and educational. Even though this may seem like we're asking for a lot, it's going to be a tight budget. We're really counting on you to help make this happen.

We Need Funds for Equipment and Production Assistants

We're dedicated to producing this game. In the event we don't reach our full target budget, we'll be working with the funds received to produce a more limited first release of the game. 

You Get Product Perks, Free Apps for Yourself or to Donate to a Shelter

We really appreciate your help and we want to show it! We're offering perks at every level that are worth more in retail value than what you'll contribute. You can see descriptions of the products you'll receive by clicking here.


The Impact

Kids and parents will learn how to read dog body language and how to act safely around dogs. This will help prevent adverse encounters with dogs and will lead to greater empathy for the family dog. Happier dogs and happier kids!

Do You Speak Dog?

Do you know what it means when a dog yawns, wags his tail high in the air, licks his chops or shows a half moon of white in his eye? If you do, then congratulations! If not, you're not alone. Most kids and parents don't know either, but they'll learn this important information and much more from the Doggone Crazy game app.

Half of All Kids Are Bitten by Dog - Shocking, but True!

Half of all children are bitten by a dog and most of these bites are by the family dog or a dog known to the child. Statistics support this assertion, but you can easily verify it by asking a group of adults if they were bitten as a child and if they knew the dog. Dog bites, even if relatively minor (as most are) are traumatic because of the feelings of betrayal and also the impact of being physically harmed by another creature. In many cases the emotional scars last a lifetime, even if the physical ones heal quickly. For the dog that bites, the consequences are often the loss of his home and family and sometimes his life. 

Most Bites are By the Family Dog and Are Completely Preventable

Most of these bites are completely preventable, because dogs don't bite out of the blue and dogs don't want to bite. The dog will have warned, often for weeks, months or even years, but kids and parents don't recognize the warning signs. 

"The kids were thrilled to come and tell me that they did a tree on the beach and made a strange dog go away." Cathy Vanderheyden - mother - Atlanta GA

Compassion

Kids and families need to learn how to be compassionate with their training and management of the dog, so that the dog is happy and does not get anxious enough to bite.

Parents unknowingly allow kids to behave in ways that the dog doesn't like (hugging, kissing, taking things away, sitting on the dog etc.). Most dogs are extremely tolerant, but it's not fair for a good dog to be feeling anxious and unhappy when this could be easily prevented. And it's tragic when this goes on and on and the dog eventually resorts to a bite to get it to stop.

Cool and Fun

The Doggone Crazy app will be a fun, cool and interactive way for kids to learn what it means when a dog uses its various body parts to communicate. This app will provide a new way to reach even more kids and families so that they can learn fascinating facts about dog body language, stay safer and have happier dogs.

"I played your game and it is so cool. I think that all kids should play it to learn about what their dog is thinking." Ashley and Nicky - age 9 and 11

The funding from this campaign will be used to develop 3D animated dogs that demonstrate the subtle body language that kids (and parents) need to know about and to incorporate these into individual-play and family-play scenarios. Kids will learn how to tell if a dog wants to meet them or interact with them and when a dog wants to be left alone. They will learn what to do in various fun and serious scenarios with both strange dogs and the family dog. The focus will be on fun and learning and not fear.

Your contribution to this campaign will help us empower even more kids with the knowledge they need to stay safe around dogs, be compassionate to dogs and keep family dogs out of the shelter.

The funding will also help the development and management of the "Keep Me Home" program that will help provide the app for free to families adopting a shelter or rescue dog.


Risks & Challenges

Joan and Teresa have been dedicated to dog bite prevention and child safety for just as long as Greg and Jeff have been dedicated to 3D animation, graphics, video and iOS development. We are a strong team with the skills, knowledge and experience to bring you a fun, engaging and educational game. Most of all, we are each dedicated to making this happen.

If we don't reach our funding goal, the app will still be developed, but with limitations in functionality and in a longer time frame. With your help it will be as awesome as possible, taking advantage of all the recent developments in 3-D animation and kinetic functions of the ipad and it will be done much faster than without funding. More funding means more different 3-D animated dogs in the game and more and varied game play scenarios. Your contribution will be used for the app development and you will get your app.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute but still want to help, please share this campaign! It's really important and really does help.  When we get closer to launch we will also need help with social media and support. Please click here to sign up for our mailing list so we can keep you updated on our progress.

Visit our blog for informative articles about dogs, the app creation process and updates on our progress in development.

The Doggone Crazy app will be a fun, cool and interactive way for kids to learn what it means when a dog uses its various body parts to communicate. This app will provide a new way to reach even more kids and families so that they can learn fascinating facts about dog body language, stay safer and have happier dogs.
"I played your game and it is so cool. I think that all kids should play it to learn about what their dog is thinking." Ashley and Nicky - age 9 and 11
The funding from this campaign will be used to develop 3D animated dogs that demonstrate the subtle body language that kids (and parents) need to know about and to incorporate these into individual-play and family-play scenarios. Kids will learn how to tell if a dog wants to meet them or interact with them and when a dog wants to be left alone. They will learn what to do in various fun and serious scenarios with both strange dogs and the family dog. The focus will be on fun and learning and not fear.
Your contribution to this campaign will help us empower even more kids with the knowledge they need to stay safe around dogs, be compassionate to dogs and keep family dogs out of the shelter.
The funding will also help the development and management of the "Keep Me Home" program that will help provide the app for free to families adopting a shelter or rescue dog.

    Risks & Challenges Joan and Teresa have been dedicated to dog bite prevention and child safety for just as long as Greg and Jeff have been dedicated to 3D animation, graphics, video and iOS development. We are a strong team with the skills, knowledge and experience to bring you a fun, engaging and educational game. Most of all, we are each dedicated to making this happen.
If we don't reach our funding goal, the app will still be developed, but with limitations in functionality and in a longer time frame. With your help it will be as awesome as possible, taking advantage of all the recent developments in 3-D animation and kinetic functions of the ipad and it will be done much faster than without funding. More funding means more different 3-D animated dogs in the game and more and varied game play scenarios. Your contribution will be used for the app development and you will get your app.


Other Ways You Can Help
 If you just can't contribute but still want to help, please share this campaign! It's really important and really does help.  When we get closer to launch we will also need help with social media and support. Please click here to sign up for our mailing list so we can keep you updated on our progress.
Visit our blog for informative articles about dogs, the app creation process and updates on our progress in development.

story:
PT: se não tens paypal ou cartão de credito ou por alguma razão não queres usá-lo, podes contribuir com transferência bancária para esta conta:
NIB: 0007 0000 0000 4712 0672 3 

EN: if you don't have paypal or credit card, or for some reason don't want to use it, you can donate to the following bank account:
IBAN: PT50 0007 0000 0000 4712 0672 3 
BIC/SWIFT: BESCPTPL


Our video pretty much sums it all up, but here are some more specific applications for your lovely contributions:

  • General construction works and maintenance on the different levels of the warehouse (much needed!)
  • Creation of a total soundproof atmosphere in the basement level (concert room). We want our beautiful noise to be respectful towards its surroundings and thus create a healthy relationship with the neighborhood
  • Equipping the room with a proper PA system, so bands can enjoy playing without trouble
  • Build a studio/rehersal room to provide an affordable alternative for local bands to practice and record their music
  • Design a comfortable "guest room", so touring bands can stay over after their shows and enjoy a good night of sleep
  • Create and equip a community vegan canteen to serve meals and drinks during the shows and several times a week, offering a cheap and healthy alternative to  a city in need of vegan options
  • Establish a library room with alternative and countercultural literature, freely available for everybody
  • Set up a wellness center to host activities such as yoga, kung fu and fitness
  • Buy tools and make a room for different kinds of workshops and talks that promote the DIY culture
We're aware that our monetary goal might not be enough to cover all expenses and keeping this place will be a constant effort so we appreciate any help you can give us. 
If you want to contribute in any other way, please send us an email to disgraca@riseup.net. We'll be happy to hear from you!
Donate, visit and resist.
STOP BY ANYTIME
www.disgraca.com
disgraca@riseup.net
nobordersdiybooking@gmail.com
video and most footage by Fábio Gonçalves, former Juicy TV.


***UPDATE***

Hey!

After some months of benefit events, crowdfunding and cheap talk, the space is real.

For those who don't know, we recently joined forces with B.O.E.S.G., a radical Lisbon-based library, which is moving with us.http://boesg.blogspot.pt/

Right now, we're starting all the construction work. We're in need of some spare working hands, imagination and diy spirit to make it happen, so here goes a list of the needed material and skills:

➡ Various tools
➡ Pallets
➡ Rock/Glass Wool, Cork or other soundproofing equipment
➡ Acoustic absorbers/diffusers
➡ Musical Equipment (the concert room would be very thankful)
➡ Drywall/Plasterboard
➡ Bricks
➡ Cement
➡ Scaffolding
➡ Mattresses
➡ Sheets and pillows, etc
➡ Kitchen stuff
➡ Furniture
➡ Plumbing equipment
➡ Metal bars
➡ Wall paint and spray cans

If you have some experience with building walls, soundproofing, acoustic treatment, metal welding, wood working, plumbing, you're more than welcome!

If you don't, but still want to help or learn, there's still plenty of stuff to do!

See you!

Rua da Penha de França nº217A/B

www.disgraca.com
