story:
You've never seen a campaign like this before...

This campaign, is groundbreaking as we are girls who have come from extreme poverty, overcome the odds and are now using crowdfunding to give other girls in Northern Ghana the chance to attend senior high school.  We are recent high school graduates ourselves, and were able to graduate because we were sponsored through Create Change Foundation by people just like you.  Now it's our turn to do what we can to help the younger girls have the same chance we've received.

Having graduated from high school, we now work for Create Change and have been trained to run almost every aspect of the organization including:

The one thing however we have NOT been empowered to do is to fundraise.  If this campaign is successful, it will mean that you have seen our passion and believe in our cause, to send over 150 girls like us to high school.  


Why We Need Your Help

We know the difference that attending high school has made in our lives, and we want to extend this opportunity to as many young  girls as we can.  We know all too well the alternative, to get married, have children at a young age, and to continue the cycle of poverty.  We will have hundreds of girls and their mothers lining up outside our office by the end of August, and we want to be able to help as many girls as we can to continue their education.  

Some facts about Northern Ghana and why it's so important we support girls' high school education:

We can ensure girls escape poverty and transform their communities by providing them with the opportunity to attend high school.


A Guaranteed Impact

As we have been sponsored students who almost dropped out of high school, we can promise you that this sponsorship program really works to change girls' lives.

If this campaign is successful, it will demonstrate to other marginalized people around the world that they too, can work together to help change their community and country.


About Create Change Foundation

Create Change Foundation became a registered charity in Canada in 2008.  Since its inception, in Northern Ghana it has had the following impact:

Create Change Foundation plans to become 100% financially self-sufficient by 2020 through the launching of a series of social enterprises in Ghana.  Its vision is to one day be completely managed by the girls it supports.

We sponsored graduates now make up the majority of the Create Change team, and are pictured here with our Country Director in Ghana, Emelia.

Find out more about us on our website or staff page!


Unique Perks from Ghana

We are offering perks from our home in Northern Ghana, and we will send them to you directly.  We are sourcing the jewelry, local cloth, and football gear from local merchants, and we will put your package together ourselves and will personally bring it to the post office to send it to you.

Since we have been trained to take videos and use Skype, the Personal Video and Skype related perks will be again managed by us girls in Northern Ghana.  We really want you to know how much your support means to us and the girls you've supported to attend high school, and the best way we know how to show you is to talk to you personally!


But best of all, our Ghana Travel related perks mean you get to come to Ghana and visit us!  While the Create Change team in Canada will organize your trip, we will be part of your hosting team and will act as your tour guides.  While flights to Ghana are not included, after you have arrived in Ghana, we will take care of everything including transport, food, and accommodation.  


The Team Behind This Campaign

We are 7 young women living in Northern Ghana, who work for Create Change: Martha, Gloria, Sumaya, Jelila, Kate, Hamida and Jennifer.   We will be launching and managing this campaign with the support of Create Change's Founder from Canada, Shannen O'Brian.



Other Ways To Help

If you are not able to donate, then consider sharing our campaign with your networks, to help us reach our goal!  You can help us to share our message by:

  • SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN
    Send an E-mail to your friends introducing our campaign or share via the Facebook and Twitter buttons below

  • SPREAD THE HASHTAG- #AfricanGirlsCrowdfund or #OwnOurFuture
    Use this hashtag on social media to help get the word out
  • TELL A WRITER ABOUT OUR STORY
    Forward this on to the journalists and bloggers you know that might be interested in writing about our story: that we want to extend the magic of crowd funding as a tool to some of the world's most marginalized people, African girls living in extreme poverty.


FAQs Answered

If any of your questions are not answered below, please don't hesitate to get in touch!
    • How much money from this campaign actually goes to support girls to attend high school in Northern Ghana?
      With the exception of IndieGoGo/PayPal fees, and the cost of perks and shipping, 100% of your donation will go directly to supporting a girl to get to high school in Ghana THIS SEPTEMBER, 2015.

    • What will you do with funds should you raise more than your financial goal?  
      We hope to support as many girls to school as possible, so any additional contributions will go towards sending additional girls to school.

    • How much of this IndieGogo Campaign is managed by girls' in Ghana?
      This campaign is truly being run and managed by girls in Ghana!  While we have received some support from our founder in terms of setting up the campaign, we did the pitch video ourselves and only had help with editing.  We put together network lists ourselves to try to get related groups and celebrities to share our campaign.  We are also managing all of the perks ourselves, from purchasing them to packaging them organizing their shipping.  

    • Will you update me on the progress of the project?
      Of course!  We will show you videos of when we are able to tell girls we are able to support them, and keep you updated through the year as the girls' progress through school through photo and video.

    • Can I donate from anywhere in the world?
      Absolutely!

    • What payment methods do you accept?
      We accept PayPal and major credit cards.  Funds will go directly to our Create Change Foundation in Ghana, who will transfer 100% of funds directly to our branch in Ghana.

    • When will I receive my perk?
      Anything being sent from Ghana should arrive sometime in September or October, as mail usually takes 4 - 6 week.  For the personalized video or virtual Skype meet ups perks, these will be arranged in September to take place sometime in October.  For trips to Ghana, we can begin planning together once the campaign has ended.
    • How do I get more information on the perks related to traveling to Ghana?
      We have hosted many people in Ghana and would be glad for you to be our next guest!  First, you can find out more about Create Change on our website.  Secondly, read about Field School, our new Voluntourism Centre we are launching in 2016 where we will accommodate you during your time in Tamale.  If you are seriously interested, get in touch with us and we would be happy to set up a call to answer all of your questions.

    • Is Shipping Included?
      Shipping of perks is included in your contribution.

    • Can I get a Tax Receipt?
      Create Change is a Canadian registered charity and but unfortunately can offer charitable tax receipts to Canadians only.
    • Do I get a Tax Receipt if I get a Perk?
      If you are a Canadian and are eligible for a tax receipt, you can receive a tax receipt for the amount of your contribution, minus the cost of your perk.  Unfortunately, we cannot offer tax receipts for any Ghana Travel related perks.

    • What if I decline to receive my Perk?
      If you decline to receive your perk and are eligible for a Canadian tax receipt, then you will get a tax receipt for the full amount of your contribution.


                                   THANK YOU!
We cannot thank each and every one of you enough for helping us to reach our goal: to get as many girls in Northern Ghana as possible to senior high school for the 2015 -2016 academic year.

story:
Who We Are 

Connect the Kids has taken on the challenge of delivering game based digital content to special needs students and schools across the New York City area by raising donations through crowdfunding and other sources. Our goal is to help the 200,000 special needs students from District 75. To achieve this we are working with P.S. 811X in the Bronx, the largest self contained special education school in New York City.



What We Need & What You Get
Donations for Connect The Kids go directly to the P.S. 811X Parent Association, a non-profit 501c3 organization. District 75 schools will then use these funds to provide iPads from Apple and educational software from KNeoWorld Inc, a game based Learning developer and distributor of computer games for grades K – 8 that are designed to serve as an adjunct to classroom learning. Donors are able to witness immediate, firsthand results and see how their dollars are making a tangible difference in the lives of some of the most vulnerable members of our society.

                                              
  • For a $25 donation you can wear your support with a Connect The Kids T-Shirt!
  • For a $5,000 donation, you can be a part of KNeoWorld! An animator will design you in the game! 
  • If we aren't able to reach our goal, the proceeds of this campaign will still go to the schools. However, the program will have to be reduced.


The Impact

In the past year, KNeoWorld has worked with schools in New York City's East Harlem and Bronx neighborhoods to put its award winning software to the test. In doing so, the founders of Connect The Kids have been able to learn about these students, and have identified several of the most immediate needs of their schools.

After interacting with technology and playing educational games, the results were astounding. Non-communicative autistic students surprised their parents and teachers with very positive, and occasionally animated reactions. However, there are only about 2 computers per classroom in a school with over 625 students.


Improved Learning

The KNeoWorld software can track and access students’ achievement after completion of different stages and levels of their game-based learning. Student skill achievements will be noted with incremental steps. This allows educators and parents to know what the child's academic strengths and weakness are so they can tailor lessons to each child.

"One of my favorite features of the KNeoWorld platform is its ability to track student’s progress. Teachers can use this information to note specific skills that students have mastered and be better informed about their students’ prior knowledge when planning lessons.  Teachers will be able to recognize where student difficulty is and can take steps to provide intervention in those areas."           -- Michelle P Fargnoli, Special Education Teacher at P.S. 811X,


Words From Our Supporters

"Our students have a wide range of disabilities, including students with autism, emotional/behavioral disorders, and intellectual and physical disabilities. With our huge percentage of non-verbal students and those with physical limitations, providing them with authentic educational experiences is crucial and this can be done with the appropriate technology. They would be able to not only communicate within the school environment but beyond into the community."  -- Rose Nieves-Greene, Principal of P.S. 811X


Share us!

  • We encourage you to share our campaign on your social media pages!

story:
Short Summary

 

  • MY name is Olayinka Taiwo the founder of IDEAS UNIVERSITY (ideasuniveristy.co.uk) is an online academy, focused... on teaching idea generation techniques. This is one of the revolutionary courses we are launching.

  • In this campaign we are pre-selling one of our courses: “5 years strategic plan on how to be a billionaire”, from our 12 years research on wealth creation.We discovered that in this internet age and the opportunities that abound,one can be a billionaire in 5 years starting from the scratch. A lot of people have done it, which means if someone has done it, then you can do it.                             “Everything around you that you call life, was made up by people that were no smarter than you.” Steve Jobs                                                                                        "The fact that some have become wealthy is proof that others may do it as well."  Abraham Lincoln                                                                                      From these quotes from two of the greatest minds that ever lived, we can deduce that anyone can be a billionaire if you put your mind to it.

  • You will be making the dream of the billionaire in you and the others to come to life by contributing to this campaign. You will help us make history with this first ever online course on how to be a billionaire.

 What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $27700 to complete this course. I have already spent $2300 on this project, The cash raised will be utilized to pay for the written work (intellectual property) and improvement of the course and the expense of accessing it online by the students.
     Some of the money will also be used to pay for a year  of high volume hosting on one of the best platforms for online course delivery.
  • Get lifetime access to first course now for $27 instead of $297 when fully launch.
  •  if we don't reach our entire goal, we will still use the fund for the development of the course.

The Impact


  • The course is valuable to you if your dream in life is to start your own business and be successful in it. This course reveals how to be a billionaire in five years with your own business funded by other people money.  No matter what the economy is saying right now, you can still be a billionaire in 5 years time                " Despite pockets of economic turmoil, the number of billionaires around the world expanded to record 1,826, including 290 newcomers." Forbes
  • 12 years ago, we predicted on how to tap into the the young graduates of universities in Africa and turn them into world class software developers. We sent proposals to many consulting firms,only one responded. The one that responded could not go on with the project based on prejudice. Just last year a startup started exactly what we have in mind then and today had raise more that $13 million in funding. If we launched a course then on how to do it many would have benefited now. This is one of the paramount reasons we are launching this course now. 

Risks & Challenges

 The risk we face is for people to believe that we can teach people how to be  billionaires while we are not yet one. We will rest in the saying of Aristotle that said, "To avoid criticism, say nothing, do nothing, be nothing"  We know people will criticize us about that, but we have to do this. At least our prediction on software development twelve years ago came to pass. 

To overcome this challenge we are using the life of seven dot-com billionaires as case studies. We did extensive research on them, which will help the students.

The only obstacles standing on the way of our students from getting to their goals will be lack of discipline and procrastination.  Let me close with this quote from Brian Tracy  "Self-discipline is the key to personal greatness, It is the magic quality that opens all doors for you and make everything possible. With self-discipline, the average person can rise as far and as fast as his talents and intelligence can take him”

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can please help us spread the word about this campaign by using  the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

In this campaign we are pre-selling one of our courses: “5 years strategic plan on how to be a billionaire”, from our 12 years research on wealth creation.We discovered that in this internet age and the opportunities that abound,one can be a billionaire in 5 years starting from the scratch. A lot of people have done it, which means if someone has done it, then you can do it.                             “Everything around you that you call life, was made up by people that were no smarter than you.” Steve Jobs                                                                                        "The fact that some have become wealthy is proof that others may do it as well."  Abraham Lincoln                                                                                      From these quotes from two of the greatest minds that ever lived, we can deduce that anyone can be a billionaire if you put your mind to it.

story:
Borneo

In August 2015, Kids Lacrosse The World made our inaugural trip to Ranau, Sabah, Malaysia to work with local teachers and leaders to create the Ranau Lacrosse Project at the SMK Mat Salleh School.  With great success, we created a respectful, healthy, and inviting environment for 250+ students to learn the great game of lacrosse.  This program will be expanding to two other schools in the region to create the first interscholastic competition of it's kind in South East Asia.  The program will sustain itself through consistent competition and growth throughout the region.     

Africa 

Anticipated this spring, Kids Lacrosse The World will travel to Mahlanya, Swaziland to create a boys and girls lacrosse team with support from local based organization Kwakha Indvodza.  Kids lacrosse The World will teach and coach 100+ students the game of lacrosse, with an emphasis on education and role model mentoring.  We will also work with local schools in the area to form teams that will compete and work together to grow the sport.  


Where do our program resources come from?

Kids Lacrosse The World sources used equipment from players and lacrosse teams in the Denver area.  This includes all levels, from youth clubs to college varsity teams.  It is through the great generosity of these donors that we are able to provide all equipment required for our Kids Lacrosse The World programs.  

What type of programs do you create?

Kids Lacrosse The World programs are sport based and include English language mentoring, female/male based life skills mentoring, community involvement and personal planning.  For the duration of our time with the students, we like to split our time between lacrosse and fun/educational activities.  Our goal is to strengthen the community through our lacrosse programs by bringing together our student athletes and community leaders to learn and achieve altogether.  

Where will your donations go to and why?

With your support, the money raised from this campaign will go directly to support Kids Lacrosse The World programs and the students involved.  This includes specialty equipment, playing jerseys, playing fields, meals for all day lacrosse camps, clinics, activity costs, English Teaching materials/supplies, student success field trips, and other program expenses.

story:
Our Story 

Oak Hill Center for Education and Culture is a school for learning, researching, sharing, and exploring creative strategies and tools for transformative social movement building.  We develop and identify organizers, educators, and artists committed to social and economic justice.

In the fall of 2013, a small group of organizers, artists, and educators came together to discuss the social and economic challenges facing communities in Baltimore and around the world. At the heart of this conversation lay two questions: How can we develop alternative forms of organizing broad-based social movements?  And, what role can artists and cultural producers play in eliminating social and economic inequality?

This conversation resulted in a commitment to creating a school for exploring the development of cultural tools and creative strategies for change.


Why we need your help

For the past two years the Alternative Press Center library has been a meeting and working space for Oak Hill. We are now ready expand and permanently move into our own space. To do so, renovations and technological improvements are needed. Your generous contribution will help us turn a barren warehouse space into a thriving classroom.


What we've accomplished

So far, we have been able to put together really dynamic programming with young adults combining political education, community organizing, arts, and mindfulness in two cohorts over two summers. Our first summer was a look at the interactions of a Baltimore neighborhood’s history and political economy with that of greater Baltimore and the U.S.. This culminated with an art exhibition with residents and neighbors synthesizing our work into audio-visual experience and dialogue.

During our second summer, we conducted an in-depth study of the Reconstruction era using the text, Black Reconstruction in America by W.E.B Du Bois. In a short time, we were able to create a series of cultural materials to explore complex questions of race and class then and now, which we will continue to build upon to share with larger audiences this spring.


What your contribution will support

With this new space we can expand the programming we have developed since 2013 and introduce new, more ambitious year-round classes, workshops, and events.

$15,000 can give us vital infrastructure to move one step closer to building a lasting educational institution for social change.


What You Get

For contributing to Oak Hill you could get one or a collection of these unique perks:
  • Oak Hill sticker
  • Oak Hill Notebook
  • Oak Hill Poster
  • Opening Reception Invitation
  • Handmade Tote Bag
  • A copy of our limited edition workbook on Black Reconstruction in America. This will also come with a copy of the W.E.B. Du Bois's book. 
  •   1 year subscription of your choice (options listed below)
Publication Perk Options:
  1. The Black Scholar: Is a peer-reviewed, interdisciplinary journal providing cogent articles that help the understanding of issues of social concern to black Americans and other peoples of African descent across the world.
  2. Red Wedge: Is a website and magazine dedicated to the understanding and creation of art and creativity from a revolutionary perspective.
  3. Radical History Review: Has stood at the point where rigorous historical scholarship and active political engagement converge. 
  4. Feminist Teacher: Provides discussions of such topics as multiculturalism, interdisciplinarity, and distance education within a feminist context.
  5. Jacobin:  Is a leading voice of the American left, offering socialist perspectives on politics, economics, and culture.
  6. Rethinking Schools: Is an activist publication, with articles written by and for teachers, parents, and students.
1. 2. 3.

4.  5.  6.

How will we succeed?

Oak Hill will succeed because of our profound commitment to justice and dignity for all.

Oak Hill will succeed because of our love for one another, our families, friends, and Baltimore and beyond.

And Oak Hill will happen because of our collective organizing, arts, and educational experiences and willingness to remain open to learning, growing, and changing.


Other Ways You Can Help

Besides donating, you can help by sharing with others!

  • Get the word out to friends, family, and colleagues
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word out to your social networks.

story:
Everything is Easier Over Tea is an event focused on teaching teenage girls about healthy relationships and sexual health.  The hope is that by having mothers (women role models) and teens present together this will help build a safe space for future dialogue amongst attendees.  We hope that this will be one of many events we host that will help build community and empower women and teens in creating healthy and vibrant relationships and sexual identities.

We Need Your Help

We plan to offer an amazing event to our attendees:

  • We want attendees to leave highly informed, and with tangible tools they can use for future conversations and circumstances.
  • The budget for this event is $2500; which is approximate $50/person. We don't want finances to be an obstacle for any family wishing to participate in our event.   
  • Your donation will help benefit a family wishing to attend our event, but are in need of financial assistance.  Part of the funds raised will also go towards gift bags full of resources for our teens and parents. 

The Impact

Your donation will help empower our community:

  • You will be helping to create safe space for teens to talk to adults about challenging situations.
  • You will be helping us in teaching parents and teens better communication skills.
  • With your help we hope to decrease teenage pregnancy and contraction of STDs/STIs, and overall help our youth learn skills that help them to develop healthy relationships.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share our campaign with others who may be able to donate.
  • Volunteer for our event!!
  • Spread the word to individuals that would like to attend!!
  • Donate items for our giveaways!! We are looking for items that the mother/daughters can participate in together after the event; decorations; food; etc.

Feel free to learn more about our event at: https://easierovertea.eventbrite.com

story:
Hi! I'm David from UK charity HANDS AROUND THE WORLD, and we are delighted to be supporting this brilliant school in India.

Started ten years ago by Alindra Naskar, an inspirational local man, the remarkable New Life Centre School has grown from 35 children to 450. We started with a need for £9500 ($14500) to build more classrooms for older children. But following several wonderful donations on and off line we now just need £3250 ($4928). Please help if you can!

The children in this district of West Bengal are fortunate to have Mr. Naskar, the school Principal, living in their community, as this means that they can have a good education. He has always remembered that from humble beginnings he was sponsored himself through school and university, later working for many years as an orthotist and prosthetist with the Leprosy Mission.

                        

"Education is the birthright of every child" Alindra says. He never turns a child away, no matter how little the parents can pay. The locality is beautiful, for its simplicity and rural life, but the other side of that is much unemployment and very low wages for menial work. As most parents of the school are uneducated, their income is poor. But this does not mean that they undervalue education for their children, as shown by the school roll!

Carefully run and recently awarded secondary status by the government, the school needs to grow to continue to accommodate the older children, and we are very keen to help them! Please join us...

                                                  

                       


The New Life Centre school was awarded Secondary status from the Indian government in February this year. This will change the lives of the children who attend the school forever! They will be able to stay on until they are 16 and take the compulsory Board exam which all students at school in India have to sit.

The big difference will be that whereas in the local Government schools 90% of the children fail this exam, we are confident that with the high standard in this school the students will pass and then have the opportunity to go further in higher education.

For this reason the school is desperate for more classrooms, as more children will stay on, confident of a brighter future.

Alindra Naskar the principal writes: "This is a co-educational School, so the Boys and Girls can grow up with equal opportunity. They are in no way less intelligent than city children; opportunities for them however are limited.

I am narrating about a boy and a girl among many of our children as examples.

ANUPAM N - He was an abandoned boy brought up by a poor farmer and began in our school from the age of 4 years. We took full responsibility for him and now he is 15+ preparing for Secondary Board exams in 2016 February. He secured 75% and above marks in every class throughout the years.  

            


MASUMA K - She comes from a poor family, started schooling from the age of 4 years. Now she is 14+, studying in class-IX, and will appear in Secondary Board Exams in 2017 February. She also obtained around 70% marks in every class so far.


             


There are many other promising children like them to sign up in life provided they have the opportunity and their parents are constantly motivated to bring change in life.

Our aim is to provide them a better educational environment with more ideal class rooms and up-dated study materials.
My personal appeal to you is - please help to grow this school up to college level and we will be able to help many children of this rural community, give them a purpose in life and ultimately they will bring change in their own society.

Thank you so much for your help."

story:
College lifts ALL students.

My son Donald has an apartment and a car and two part-time jobs. Pretty normal stuff for a young man just beginning adulthood. Except Donald has an intellectual disability that not so long ago would have made the normal life he lives today almost impossible.

As with most young people, the difference for Donald was college. It’s where he developed the social skills, confidence and practical knowledge to live independently. And he’s not alone.

Hundreds hungry for college’s promise.

In 2005, we began College Transition Connection to help students who have an intellectual disability experience college. By 2008, three students, Donald among them, had enrolled at the University of South Carolina, the state’s first program. There are now five university programs across the state with 100 students enrolled.

Hundreds more students qualify for college but lack the funds. Lift 100 is a campaign to help qualified students who have an intellectual disability realize their college dreams, reach their potential and live self-directed lives as contributing members of their communities.

Success Stories = Attention = Funding = Sustainability.

Our goal is $1 million to fund scholarship pools at each of the five universities. Deserving students will get help with tuition, fees, books and/or housing — help where they need it to ensure their success. This sum will allow us to drastically increase enrollment, drawing more attention to the need — as well as the success stories — and inspiring the state legislature and philanthropic sources to provide the additional support required to sustain the program. $1 million can lift 100 students through their first year of college. $5 million, our reach goal, would carry them through to completion.

Good for the heart. Good for the head.

There’s a lot of “feel good” in helping make college dreams come true for these students. But the pragmatic return on the investment is worthy, too. Consider this:

Compare that to this:

The cost over the lifetime of each adult in taxpayer-funded residential programs and care has been pegged at $1.5 million. Now multiply that by the roughly 1,500 South Carolina students who have an intellectual disability that finish high school every year. Lift 100 is a much better investment.

The success is scalable.

I could afford to fund Donald’s college education. Many parents are not so fortunate. I’m so proud of where Donald is today, on his own, a working man and tax-paying citizen. A life most of us take for granted but that means so much to him and to his community. Knowing these funds will lift 100 more young people to a full, independent life seems to me a job worth doing. The program and support systems are in place, the efficacy is proven. All we lack are the funds to ramp up the success rate.

Money talks but talking is also needed.

Whatever you can give is greatly appreciated. In addition to funds, awareness matters. Please spread the word about the Lift 100 campaign through your network of friends, family and coworkers. Almost one third of American families have at least one member who has a disability. The need is bigger than most of us realize. Use your favorite social media sharing tools, including those here on Indiegogo, to let others know about Lift 100.

Frequently Asked Questions

Why are you doing this?

Lift 100 is a campaign to help qualified students who have an intellectual disability realize their college dreams, reach their potential and live self-directed lives as contributing members of their communities.

Why the $1,000,000 figure?​

$1 million provides adequate funding for up to 100 students receiving full and partial scholarships to complete their first year of college. The dramatic growth in enrollment should spotlight the need to encourage state funding and corporate philanthropy to sustain the programs long-term.

How will the funds be used?

Funds raised will be put into scholarship pools at five South Carolina universities—Clemson University, Coastal Carolina University, College of Charleston, University of South Carolina and Winthrop University. Deserving students will receive help with tuition, fees, books and/or housing based on their financial need.

How can I help spread the word?

You can help spread the word using your network of friends, family and co-workers. Use your favorite social media sharing tools, including those here on Indiegogo.

Are you a nonprofit? Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes?

Yes, College Transition Connection (CTC) is registered as a public 501(c)(3) nonprofit. Contributions to CTC and lift100.org are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law. CTC’s tax ID number is 57-0841746.

How can I get a tax deductible receipt?

You will receive an email from FirstGiving (Indiegogo’s nonprofit payments processor) confirming your contribution. This email receipt can be used for tax deductible purposes.

Is this campaign open nationwide or just limited to South Carolina?

This is a nationwide campaign! While CTC’s five participating universities are based in South Carolina, students attend the universities from all over the country and world.

If sending a check, please also include a note with your contact information—name, address, phone, email—so we can thank you for your contribution and send you a receipt for your records.

When will my perk be shipped?

Perks will be shipped once the campaign has closed, January 15, 2016. Ticket packages will be available later in the year. 

Is shipping included for the perks?

Yes, shipping is included.

Can my company contribute or match funds? 

In one simple word ... yes! Your company can contribute with a credit card or send a check to College Transition Connection. Please ask them to mention it's matching gift and to whom we should attribute the match. 

What payment methods do you accept?

Lift 100 accepts credit cards through the Indiegogo campaign page. Checks can also be sent to:

College Transition Connection
P.O. Box 31656
Charleston, SC 29417

I have more questions. Who do I ask?

​​Please direct all questions to lift100@collegetransitionconnection.org.
story_txt:
College lifts ALL students.
My son Donald has an apartment and a car and two part-time jobs. Pretty normal stuff for a young man just beginning adulthood. Except Donald has an intellectual disability that not so long ago would have made the normal life he lives today almost impossible.
As with most young people, the difference for Donald was college. It’s where he developed the social skills, confidence and practical knowledge to live independently. And he’s not alone.


Hundreds hungry for college’s promise.
In 2005, we began College Transition Connection to help students who have an intellectual disability experience college. By 2008, three students, Donald among them, had enrolled at the University of South Carolina, the state’s first program. There are now five university programs across the state with 100 students enrolled.
Hundreds more students qualify for college but lack the funds. Lift 100 is a campaign to help qualified students who have an intellectual disability realize their college dreams, reach their potential and live self-directed lives as contributing members of their communities.


Success Stories = Attention = Funding = Sustainability.



Our goal is $1 million to fund scholarship pools at each of the five universities. Deserving students will get help with tuition, fees, books and/or housing — help where they need it to ensure their success. This sum will allow us to drastically increase enrollment, drawing more attention to the need — as well as the success stories — and inspiring the state legislature and philanthropic sources to provide the additional support required to sustain the program. $1 million can lift 100 students through their first year of college. $5 million, our reach goal, would carry them through to completion.


Good for the heart. Good for the head.
There’s a lot of “feel good” in helping make college dreams come true for these students. But the pragmatic return on the investment is worthy, too. Consider this:

Compare that to this:

The cost over the lifetime of each adult in taxpayer-funded residential programs and care has been pegged at $1.5 million. Now multiply that by the roughly 1,500 South Carolina students who have an intellectual disability that finish high school every year. Lift 100 is a much better investment.


The success is scalable.
I could afford to fund Donald’s college education. Many parents are not so fortunate. I’m so proud of where Donald is today, on his own, a working man and tax-paying citizen. A life most of us take for granted but that means so much to him and to his community. Knowing these funds will lift 100 more young people to a full, independent life seems to me a job worth doing. The program and support systems are in place, the efficacy is proven. All we lack are the funds to ramp up the success rate.


Money talks but talking is also needed.
Whatever you can give is greatly appreciated. In addition to funds, awareness matters. Please spread the word about the Lift 100 campaign through your network of friends, family and coworkers. Almost one third of American families have at least one member who has a disability. The need is bigger than most of us realize. Use your favorite social media sharing tools, including those here on Indiegogo, to let others know about Lift 100.


Frequently Asked Questions
Why are you doing this?
Lift 100 is a campaign to help qualified students who have an intellectual disability realize their college dreams, reach their potential and live self-directed lives as contributing members of their communities.
Why the $1,000,000 figure?​
$1 million provides adequate funding for up to 100 students receiving full and partial scholarships to complete their first year of college. The dramatic growth in enrollment should spotlight the need to encourage state funding and corporate philanthropy to sustain the programs long-term.
How will the funds be used?
Funds raised will be put into scholarship pools at five South Carolina universities—Clemson University, Coastal Carolina University, College of Charleston, University of South Carolina and Winthrop University. Deserving students will receive help with tuition, fees, books and/or housing based on their financial need.
How can I help spread the word?
You can help spread the word using your network of friends, family and co-workers. Use your favorite social media sharing tools, including those here on Indiegogo.
Are you a nonprofit?  Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes?
Yes, College Transition Connection (CTC) is registered as a public 501(c)(3) nonprofit. Contributions to CTC and lift100.org are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law. CTC’s tax ID number is 57-0841746.
How can I get a tax deductible receipt?
You will receive an email from FirstGiving (Indiegogo’s nonprofit payments processor) confirming your contribution. This email receipt can be used for tax deductible purposes.
Is this campaign open nationwide or just limited to South Carolina?
This is a nationwide campaign! While CTC’s five participating universities are based in South Carolina, students attend the universities from all over the country and world.
If sending a check, please also include a note with your contact information—name, address, phone, email—so we can thank you for your contribution and send you a receipt for your records.
When will my perk be shipped?
Perks will be shipped once the campaign has closed, January 15, 2016. Ticket packages will be available later in the year. 
Is shipping included for the perks?
Yes, shipping is included.

Can my company contribute or match funds? 
In one simple word ... yes! Your company can contribute with a credit card or send a check to College Transition Connection. Please ask them to mention it's matching gift and to whom we should attribute the match. 

What payment methods do you accept?
Lift 100 accepts credit cards through the Indiegogo campaign page. Checks can also be sent to:
College Transition ConnectionP.O. Box 31656Charleston, SC 29417
I have more questions. Who do I ask?
​​Please direct all questions to lift100@collegetransitionconnection.org.

story:
Science Day 2016

STEM fields represent a significant segment of employment and is steadily growing. Less than 6.5% of the people with any disabilities are working in these fields. You can help the children who are blind in the Boston and New England area gain exposure to STEM principles and skills. This might be the spark they need to pursue a career in a STEM field and change the statistics.

Help Our Space Our Place (OSOP) provide a fun and interactive program for students to jump into STEM! With your support, OSOP can present Science Day 2016.

What is Science Day?

Through this program, up to 40 middle- and high-school students who are blind will have the opportunity to:

·  Uncover information about STEM fields

·  Explore careers in STEM, even interacting with scientists who are blind!

·  Engage in learning about science throughout the year

·  Interact with elements of STEM fields

·  Gain confidence to fully engage in science experimentation in the program and throughout their lives

Let’s get these students ready for their STEM careers. We are starting at the beginning with Science and Technology. OSOP will provide two interactive workshops.

Workshop #1: Science Exploration

Students will learn about scientific concepts and participate in accessible experiments. Then they’ll have a chance to hear from a panel of scientists who are blind. The panel will share their experiences of studying science and working in this STEM field.

Workshop #2: Coding and Programming (Technology)

This program will help youth realize their ability to code and program common technologies. These principles can be the foundation to a future in the technology field.

Your support today will help us make Workshop #1 a reality.

How can we make Science Day happen?

With your support, we hope to raise $11,000 to make Science Day a reality for students. Please refer to the chart below to see how your donation will help us provide a springboard into STEM fields for youth who are blind.  Thank you!

Item

Cost

Materials

$5000

Space

$500

Food

$560

Van rental

$540

Drivers

$1900

Honorarium

$2000

Printing

(Braille and Large print)

$500

Total

$11,000

About OSOP

Our Space Our Place, Inc. is a 501c3 organization that provides after school and career exploration program to blind youth. Our mission is to prepare blind students for their future as productive and successful adults by promoting self-confidence, self-determination, and social and independent living skills through group activities and classes. In achieving our mission, we are guided by the following principles: respect for each other, inclusion of all, safety to explore, and challenging perceived limits. For more information on our current programs and our work in the community, visit our website at ourspaceourplace.org,

story:
Where we are as a nation today is the sum result of the leadership that stands before you in candidates for President.

 My name is John W Hargis Sr and I hope to run for President as an Independent write-in candidate. Can you think of a better message to send than your signing a ballot of an Independent to protest the actions of political parties and their lobby?

 My policies and issue solutions;
  To sign an executive order declaring abortions illegal and a capital crime. An embryo conceived from an American citizen has an innate destiny to become human unless it is terminated, and is therefore an American citizen entitled to protections under the Constitution.

 An executive order declaring foreclosures illegal for family orientated American citizens due to health or employment hardships, I refuse to put American children on the street. Americans are continuously asked to "buck up", the finance sector must buck up with them, work together and find better ways to save Americans from losing their homes.

 Government agencies; To reduce and eliminate redundant and wasteful government agencies. Not even Wikipedia can state the exact number of agencies in our government, we must account and audit for redundancy and waste. To eliminate bonus programs and organize pay scales more in line with civilian or military salary and retirement guidelines.

 Federal income tax rate; To restructure our tax laws and achieve a federal income tax rate of between 7 and 9%.

Revoke search and seizure laws and enforce accountability and return of 100% funds and property to abuse victims.

Amend the Community Reinvestment Act, to allow employees to purchase businesses due to failed ownership or white collar
crime by ownership. Employees need not lose their jobs for the actions of management and owners. 

  Declare water a natural resource to be managed and develop infrastructure for farms and communities. To develop desaline
projects and pipelines to offset well water depletion.

 To reset our government system and streamline governmental operations. 

  In an uncertain future we need to evolve with the times, to raise the standard of living, to address infrastructure, to increase import tariffs, This will enable Americans to compete in foreign markets without loss of pay or company hardships.

 To demand justification of the costs of life saving drugs sold to Americans and to revoke FDA certificates if demand and compromise is refused.

To enforce immigration laws and stop holding Americans to a double standard. 

 We need a new plan to force ISIS to peace, or to set a strategy for it's destruction. To support and help defend Israel and to address Palestinian concerns for peace in the middle east.

 

  My intentions are true and we are between a rock and a hard place as far as leadership is concerned. We must show resolve and a willingness to break through those barriers and allow our nation to evolve towards the next level. Any funds not used will be donated to St. Jude Childrens Hospital.

  It is my intent to purchase a touring bus, hire a small staff and travel all 50 states and hopefully the US territories to get my message out, if not to win, then to show America that there is a better way if we use the tools available to force Washington to serve the people. To also develop PACs in states that require delegate recognition and file a suit in those states that do not honor write in candidates. 

  I hope you will join me in this journey towards a better America and world peace. Thank you and GOD bless you and yours.

story:
LOVE FOR AFRICA

South Africa & Swaziland 2015 

  • My name is Luke Allan Traub. I'm 19 years young from Edmonton, Ablerta. I have to tell you I'm a city boy representing the Northside of course. That doesn't mean however I don't love adventure and going all over the place!!! Roughing it out in nature doesn't bother me one bit.
  • Family, friends, and even strangers have shown me so much prayer, love and financial support. However some unexpected costs have popped up recently and I am reaching out for a need that I can't fulfill while I'm in Minnesota during my lecture phase. This is something I'm learning to work on. I come from a culture that you work for every penny you earn and I need to swallow my pride because I know my God. I know my Father is blessing me and that he wants to use people like you out there to fulfill his promise of providing for my needs so I can show love across the nations! So I would ask that you would pray about supporting me and being a part of this amazing adventure. 
  • I am passionate about making a difference in people's lives. I've worked a lot of jobs that pay well. I could go into trades or business and do really well. That however does't define success to me (Not that those things are bad at all). One of my prides and joys is my first ever tattoo. An hourglass with the world falling to the bottom has so much meaning and deep personal morals built into it. You get only one shot at living and I want to make it count, and I want to live everyday knowing that this world I'm living is in a little better shape then it was that morning. One person can make a difference and I want to connect with everyone so we all can achieve something that will be written in textbooks. Yeah I sound crazy, but if you don't dream big what's the point? I want to see people come to a personal relationship with God, I want to see children/orphans be saved from preventable disease and malnutrition, I want to reach teens who know the pain of self harm! I want to do so much, but at the end of the day it can be summed up in one word. LOVE! I want to love those who might not feel it, who might not know what that looks like. Those who feel forgotten and to let them know, NO YOU ARE LOVED!!! 

Where your money is going 

  • $1500-1800 Flights 
  • $375 monthly costs (food, local transport, communications 

 Organizations

  • Children's Cup (orphanage)
  • 10 000 Homes (Building homes for single parent households)

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this with your friends and family, Share my page on Facebook please and let's use the power of social Media.
  • You are my strongest support system

Need funds to cover Tuitional Fees

Greetings to Everyone. I did my Pre-U in Medical science. Unfortunately, I was not able to continue my Undergraduate degree due to financial problem. So, I would like to ask for financial help on this site. 

I wish to study Bsc Psychology (3 year course) via distance learning. The total course fee is 60600 USD. I also wish to enroll in a music course( 7 week session) which will be held in USA in June 2016. This short course will cost $2950 and the estimated travel & living cost is $9290.

story:
Hi there, Dota2 fans!

Last week, at the Shanghai Major, two South-East Asia teams, Fnatic and MVP.Phoenix, defied expectations and finished, respectively, 5th/6th and 4th at the main event.

This is an exciting time for SEA Dota, especially with ESL Manila and the Manila Major just around the corner!

While existing casting studios do provide commentary for a limited number of SEA tournaments, they cannot provide the South-East Asian scene with the same coverage given to EU or NA tournaments.

This is where Mango eSports comes in.

Our goal is to provide professional, English-language casts for most SEA and regional tournaments. In addition, we want to shine a spotlight on the SEA scene by doing player interviews, attend LANs and even organize our own South-East Asian Dota2 tournament.

My name is Nicolas, also some of you may know me better under the nickname GayFarang.

Being a Dota fan and currently living in Thailand, I love SEA Dota. It is the most unpredictable meta out there, which makes for extremely exciting games as we've seen at the last Major.

At 38 years old, I am ready to start this new journey, helped by my background in human resources and TV production.

I won't be alone though, as, should our goal be met, I will recruit a handful of hungry and talented creators that will help keep things running smoothly.

On the caster side, I have talked to several established SEA casters who have already expressed interest in working with the studio.

Our goal is simple: we want to shine a spotlight on the overall Dota2 scene in South-East Asia, Korea and Australia, both for SEA fans and Western ones.

To South-East Asian fans, we want to give the opportunity to watch tournaments from the region while experiencing the same kind of professionalism and quality they have come to expect from Western tournaments.


To Western fans, we want to showcase the whole SEA region. This is a scene which many Western fans still are not familiar with and we want to change that by doing player interviews at LAN events, casting the best games the region has to offer and even by shooting short documentaries showcasing the Dota scenes of various SEA (and even East Asian!) countries. For example, showing viewers what the DOTA scene is like in Japan or what the life of a typical Thai professional player is like.

We plan to achieve those goals by creating a network of freelance, English-speaking collaborators (casters, writers, interviewers,...) throughout the region, along with hiring a few full-time collaborators. As part of our core mission, we will actively recruit and train new talent in South-East Asia.

$25,000 goal reached:

  • I will move to Singapore and launch Mango eSports under Singaporean law. Singapore is, by far, the easiest country to start a new business in in the region and, in addition, it offers top-notch Internet connections.
  • Office space will be rented and a couple of full-time employees will be hired.
  • Freelance collaborators will also be contracted to provide tournament coverage, starting with the Manila Major qualifiers, where we will provide full coverage of every SEA game.
  • In the Fall, we will hold the first ever Captain's Draft tournament in South-East Asia, which we expect most major SEA teams to attend (Prize pool will come from sponsorship, ad sales and ticket sales).
$50,000 goal reached:
  • In addition to the items listed above, we will build our very own broadcast studio, complete with a set, cameras, lighting and sound equipment. This would allow us to provide better coverage in-between games as well as to do other types of shows, such as Dota-related talk shows.
This campaign uses flexible funding, which means that we will receive any contribution made even if the $25,000 goal is not reached. If we do indeed fail to reach that goal, all of the money collected from this campaign will be used to fund freelance casts in SEA, starting with a coverage of the Manila Major Qualifiers.

PayPal Asia-Pacific's rules regarding crowdfunding prohibits us from offering "intangible perks of non-assessable value," which is why we opted to offer real-life goodies for most of our perks.
From lanyards to t-shirts or even hoodies, you will be able to go to your next LAN in style with our range of Mango eSports goodies!
In addition, for corporate backers, we also offer a couple of ads-related perks.  Don't miss the chance to get an ad spot or even sponsor our first tournament at a fraction of the cost!
More importantly, any contribution is greatly appreciated, whether it's $1 or $10,000. And if you can't donate, you can still help us by sharing our campaign using social media (Facebook, Twitter, etc...).

The Dota 2 community is just plain awesome. Whether our goal is reached in the end or not, I really want to thank you for visiting this campaign, contributing to it or sharing it on social media.
If you have any questions about our campaign, feel free to drop us an email at contact (at) mangoesports.com.
story_txt:
Hi there, Dota2 fans!Last week, at the Shanghai Major, two South-East Asia teams, Fnatic and MVP.Phoenix, defied expectations and finished, respectively, 5th/6th and 4th at the main event.This is an exciting time for SEA Dota, especially with ESL Manila and the Manila Major just around the corner!While existing casting studios do provide commentary for a limited number of SEA tournaments, they cannot provide the South-East Asian scene with the same coverage given to EU or NA tournaments.This is where Mango eSports comes in.Our goal is to provide professional, English-language casts for most SEA and regional tournaments. In addition, we want to shine a spotlight on the SEA scene by doing player interviews, attend LANs and even organize our own South-East Asian Dota2 tournament.My name is Nicolas, also some of you may know me better under the nickname GayFarang.Being a Dota fan and currently living in Thailand, I love SEA Dota. It is the most unpredictable meta out there, which makes for extremely exciting games as we've seen at the last Major.At 38 years old, I am ready to start this new journey, helped by my background in human resources and TV production.I won't be alone though, as, should our goal be met, I will recruit a handful of hungry and talented creators that will help keep things running smoothly.On the caster side, I have talked to several established SEA casters who have already expressed interest in working with the studio.Our goal is simple: we want to shine a spotlight on the overall Dota2 scene in South-East Asia, Korea and Australia, both for SEA fans and Western ones.
To South-East Asian fans, we want to give the opportunity to watch tournaments from the region while experiencing the same kind of professionalism and quality they have come to expect from Western tournaments.

To Western fans, we want to showcase the whole SEA region. This is a scene which many Western fans still are not familiar with and we want to change that by doing player interviews at LAN events, casting the best games the region has to offer and even by shooting short documentaries showcasing the Dota scenes of various SEA (and even East Asian!) countries. For example, showing viewers what the DOTA scene is like in Japan or what the life of a typical Thai professional player is like.
We plan to achieve those goals by creating a network of freelance, English-speaking collaborators (casters, writers, interviewers,...) throughout the region, along with hiring a few full-time collaborators. As part of our core mission, we will actively recruit and train new talent in South-East Asia.


$25,000 goal reached:


I will move to Singapore and launch Mango eSports under Singaporean law. Singapore is, by far, the easiest country to start a new business in in the region and, in addition, it offers top-notch Internet connections.
Office space will be rented and a couple of full-time employees will be hired.
Freelance collaborators will also be contracted to provide tournament coverage, starting with the Manila Major qualifiers, where we will provide full coverage of every SEA game.
In the Fall, we will hold the first ever Captain's Draft tournament in South-East Asia, which we expect most major SEA teams to attend (Prize pool will come from sponsorship, ad sales and ticket sales).

$50,000 goal reached:

In addition to the items listed above, we will build our very own broadcast studio, complete with a set, cameras, lighting and sound equipment. This would allow us to provide better coverage in-between games as well as to do other types of shows, such as Dota-related talk shows.
This campaign uses flexible funding, which means that we will receive any contribution made even if the $25,000 goal is not reached. If we do indeed fail to reach that goal, all of the money collected from this campaign will be used to fund freelance casts in SEA, starting with a coverage of the Manila Major Qualifiers.


PayPal Asia-Pacific's rules regarding crowdfunding prohibits us from offering "intangible perks of non-assessable value," which is why we opted to offer real-life goodies for most of our perks.

From lanyards to t-shirts or even hoodies, you will be able to go to your next LAN in style with our range of Mango eSports goodies!
In addition, for corporate backers, we also offer a couple of ads-related perks.  Don't miss the chance to get an ad spot or even sponsor our first tournament at a fraction of the cost!
More importantly, any contribution is greatly appreciated, whether it's $1 or $10,000. And if you can't donate, you can still help us by sharing our campaign using social media (Facebook, Twitter, etc...).



The Dota 2 community is just plain awesome. Whether our goal is reached in the end or not, I really want to thank you for visiting this campaign, contributing to it or sharing it on social media.
If you have any questions about our campaign, feel free to drop us an email at contact (at) mangoesports.com.

story:
Dinner for Breakfast

Dinner for Breakfast is the first book published by Lisa Reid.

My name is Lisa Reid and I am a former teacher and I am currently a nanny/tutor, and a mother to a bubbly little two year old.  I have always written songs, poems and short stories for children.  Due to the fact that I have received many requests from parents, and students to write a stories for them, now I think it's about time for me to start.  My campaign is very important because my passion is  help families understand the importance of reading.

My mission is to impact the lives of children by donating, volunteering and giving back to the community and make reading fun and exciting for all!

What We Need & What You Get
In order to make our first book a success, we are seeking to raise $2,500. This will allow us to achieve our goal.

Details:

  • We need to raise a total of $2,500.  This will allow us to donate 50 books to 50 children.
  • Your donations will also help to pay for the promotion of the book
  • A donation of $20 or more will get you a copy of the book DINNER FOR BREAKFAST
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will still publish the book and we will still be able to donate books based on the amount of money that we raise.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • We need some people to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools from this site!

And that's all there is to it.

Thank you in advanced for your support.

story:
WHAT IS AUTOMATIC STUDIOS?

AUTOMATIC STUDIOS’ mission is to empower NYC children to realize their individual talents and foster professional and creative skills in the film and television industries. Our students learn important life skills such as navigating teamwork, task and project completion, organization and planning. Ultimately, the specialized technical and social skills learned at Automatic Studios helps lead interested young filmmakers into future employment in the film and television industry.

In our unique MOVIE ARTS© program, students learn the art of film making through hands-on experience, active collaboration and teamwork. Our students learn Script writing, Pre-production Planning, On-Set Job Roles, Studio & Location Production Shooting and Editing.  Further focused studies include aspects of film technology such as camera work, lighting and editing, as well as costume and prop design, and acting. 

AUTOMATIC STUDIOS, with supportive partnerships with The Made in NY Media Center, Tribeca Film Festival & BRIC Arts Media, has reached over 400 young filmmakers creating over 100 short films!

 

FOUNDERS

Founded in 2014 by Che Chisholm & Peter Vietro-Hannum, AUTOMATIC STUDIOS evolved out of a desire to share our love for the collaborative process of making movies. We, the founders, come from a family of directors, producers, actors and film technicians. Generations of educators, designers and storytellers make up the creative fabric of our unique teaching program designed to inspire kids to work together while learning to express themselves.  We each bring over 20 years of professional experience in film production, creative development in media and education and our mission is to continually hire qualified industry professionals who share our program vision.

 

OUR MISSION

Our goal is to provide ALL students throughout NYC access to movie arts education. AUTOMATIC STUDIOS / A.I.M. will address the need for more quality arts enrichment programs in public elementary and middle schools.  Many under-resourced public schools need assistance implementing this initiative.  In NYC, where media arts flourish, many children lack exposure to the community of film and television production.  Our unique movie arts programs will empower children to realize their individual talents and provide those who would otherwise not have the physical or financial opportunity to participate in education programs in the field of movie arts.

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

Your Tax Deductible Contribution will help bring free Educational Moviemaking Programs to ALL of NYC Kids.  Through free workshops, after school and summer camp programs you will help us build the next generation of engaged and knowledgeable film technicians and creatives in NYC.

 

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Can I make a contribution of a different amount without asking for a Perk?
Yes, you can make ANY contribution amount you like using the “BACK IT” button at the top of the page. 

Are you a nonprofit?  
Yes, A.I.M (Arts and Ideas in Motion, Inc.) is a registered 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization.  Our tax ID number is 47-3267611. 

Is my contribution tax-deductible​?
Yes. Donations to A.I.M (Arts and Ideas in Motion, Inc.) are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

How can I get a receipt for tax purposes​?
In the weeks following your contribution, you will receive an email receipt from A.I.M (Arts and Ideas in Motion, Inc.) that can be used for tax purposes.

 

VIMEO (Channel)

INSTAGRAM

story:
Is to create a healthier generation through food and technology! 

TuckrBox inspires kids to play, eat and learn both on the TuckrBox app and in every lunch.

TuckrBox is the first lunch delivery program designed to put kids at the center of choosing nutritious, delicious and convenient school lunch!

  • Kid Centric - TuckerBox is the first meal delivery service that puts kids in charge. We understand that a healthy lifestyle starts with the habits we develop in childhood.  By giving kids the power to choose their own lunches. TuckerBox empowers kids to discover new foods and develop their own tastes, giving them the skills to make healthy choices for the rest of their lives.

  • Nutritious and Delicious - TuckerBox makes lunch healthy and FUN! Every TuckrBox is hand-made by our team of chefs, who develop creative, tasty recipes to get kids excited about eating healthy and trying new things. Plus, all our lunches are co-designed by dieticians to ensure that every meal is nutritionally balanced for healthy growing kids!

  • Convenient - TuckrBox is farm-fresh school lunch delivered to your doorstep. Parenting today is difficult, and making good choices for a child’s health can be complicated and overwhelming. Parents spend hundreds of hours buying food and navigating nutritional needs and finicky food habits, all in the quest to pack healthy school lunches that their kids will eat. For grown ups, nutritious, easy lunch options already exist, now TuckrBox provides a convenient solution for kids!  Parents sign up, set their child’s preferences, then kids do the ordering and BOOM, healthy school lunch delivered to your doorstep.  

  • Farm fresh, local and sustainable - TuckerBox is healthy food for kids and the earth! We know you care about the planet, and we do too.  Each TuckrBox lunch is about something greater. It tells the story of the farmers who grew the ingredients, the biology of the land and local seasonality. Our partnerships with farmers we trust allow us to get the freshest, most nutritious produce possible. We always source with sustainable practices in mind, using the most seasonal and local produce to ensure the health of your child AND the health of the planet.  

  • Good Food for All - TuckrBox believes in health for a whole generation! At TuckrBox we believe that good food is for everyone, even though not everyone has an easy time accessing it! That's why we give back with every box. Every lunch you buy contributes to food education for kids -from cooking classes and nutrition education to hands on farming and gardening  - so all future generations can learn what to eat and where it comes from.

TuckrBox puts kids in charge of lunch by taking healthy, nutritionally balanced meals and imagining them as fun, exciting ways to encourage kids to try new foods! TuckrBox is a weekly subscription-based model where kids build their own weekly lunch menus on a kid oriented app. Parents sign up and frame their children’s choices by creating accounts for each child that specify dietary preferences and allergies - then the fun begins!

Kids get inspired choosing their delicious mains and two sides - they engage with new foods and the concept of seasonality all while learning about the nutritional value of their farm-fresh meals.  Once they’re done creating their weekly menu, parents get to approve their choices, ensuring that fun lunches meet family needs.

TuckrBox delivers twice a week, keeping lunch convenient and fresh!

We live in a society where:

  • 1 in 3 American children are obese

  • 1 in 5 will develop an obesity related disease

This leads to a $210B per year in U.S. healthcare costs, and these costs are based on habits and problems that develop in childhood!

Kids today have an increasingly hard time developing healthy eating habits, they:

  • Lack access to healthy foods or healthy kid-centric choices

  • Are faced with limited and unhealthy lunch options in their schools

  • Are increasingly bombarded with advertising for fast foods and unhealthy snacks

  • And often lack real, engaging nutrition education and many never learn to cook, and even most adults struggle to define and understand what constitutes a healthy balanced diet


Many kids today don’t come into contact with diverse foods and aren't offered many choices of their own when it comes to deciding on meals.  They develop preferences for unhealthy foods: sugary, salty and high fat, ( in fact, scientists now believe that sugar is as addictive as nicotine), and lack the diversity that's important in balanced, healthful diets. Over time they become less interest in trying new things. The habits and preference we develop in childhood last a lifetime, and we can see the harmful effects: staggering obesity, diabetes and diet related disease epidemics, beginning with younger and younger kids and continuing into adulthood. 


We are asking you to help us get TuckrBox lunch into kids’ hands, so they can discover for themselves how fun and delicious healthy eating can be!  

Your donations will allow us to:

• Hire a full-time chef to develop recipes and test food

• Partner with dietician to make sure all meals are nutritionally balanced

• Fund our use of an incubator kitchen space to develop and test our menu

• Throw taste testing parties with families 

• Fund our ongoing development of the TuckrBox app and web platform 
• Develop our food educational content and programing


TuckrBox is a small, yet mighty team obsessed with food education, healthy living and sustainable food systems. Most of all, we are passionate about kids! We want to excite future generations to develop healthy eating habits and to inspire them to change the future of food. 

We have come a long way since the inception of our idea 1 year ago. TuckrBox recently graduated Google’s incubator program, 30 Weeks, where we developed our business plan, formulated a terrific pitch, worked on branding and began to design and develop our app.

Our team is happy to announce that we recently won the New York App Idea Award -hosted by General Assembly, ROKO Labs, NY Harvard Angels and Columbia Venture Community. We are currently building our app with ROKO Labs development team here in NYC.

TuckrBox was also accepted into Brooklyn Foodworks kitchen incubator program for food entrepreneurs where we'll begin building our menu this fall! 

We cannot wait to get started and to execute our menu test, kids taste testing parties, as well as a beta of the delivery program!

TuckrBox creates a healthy change in children’s eating habits by giving them the power to choose their own fun, nutritious lunch!

TuckrBox aims to educate all children about local farm-fresh foods, not only by providing them with a healthier lunch, but also, by supporting food and health education through the TuckerBox Education Fund.  TuckrBox spreads food education with every box by partnering with trusted organizations to provide children cooking and nutrition education and hands on farming classes that target schools in low access areas.

We inspire children’s curiosity for healthy foods by teaching them full-circle where their food comes from, how it is grown and how to cook with healthy foods in a creative, fun recipes. 

The TuckrBox Team

  

FAQs

• Is TuckrBox currently in operation?  When will TuckrBox officially launch?

TuckerBox is not yet up and running.  We'll be running beta tests for the next year with a full product launch planned for Fall 2017.

• Where will TuckrBox be available?

In year 1 TuckrBox lunches will be available in select neighborhoods in New York City (Manhattan and Brooklyn).  We plan to expand into other NY metro areas and across the U.S. as we scale.

• How will TuckrBox delivery work?

TuckrBox will be delivered twice a week. Lunches will arrive fresh at the child's home in time for school each week. 

• How can I get involved?

TuckrBox is always looking for passionate partners who share our vision for a better food future for kids.  If you are interested in joining the team, have ideas for partnerships or are curious to know more about the company you can contact us on our website at TuckrBox.com
