story:
What does the Ending Illness campaign hope to achieve?

Hello.

My name is David Brown, I’m 45 years old and I am married to Sarah.  

My father, who is in his eighties, has developed a number of medical conditions that are normally attributed to growing older. In January of this year he was fitted with a pacemaker to resolve a problem with his heart beating irregularly. Whilst this condition nearly cost him his life, another had gradually eroded his lust for life.

 

Ageing does not cause any of the conditions or diseases associated with old age. Much like a sore throat is a symptom of a cold, an age related illness is a symptom of tiny changes that have taken place within a person's cells overtime. Regardless of when, where and how those changes occur, their effects do not always present gradually.

 

The onset of dad's eczema was aggressive. Almost overnight his entire skin turned scarlet in colour and became dry, with an itchiness that was unbearable. Eczema presents no threat to a person’s mortality. However, the reality of living with chronic eczema is that the skin is so sensitive that the slightest touch sets off irritation and itchiness that spreads. This poses a real problem for wearing clothes, for sitting in a chair, travelling by car or bus, for laying down to sleep, and many other routine activities. On average, he would get 20-30 minutes sleep followed by hours of being awake. The exhaustion he experienced from his inability to have any kind of sleep pattern, combined with the loneliness of his own thoughts and the ceaseless itching of his skin, took their toll. His usual resolve eventually gave way and a weariness of life set in. Watching him go through this was heart breaking. His doctor would tell him the condition is a part of getting older, there is no known cure and that he could only apply medication to ease it.

 

I was not prepared to accept this. This is the greatest age for scientific discovery that humans have ever known. We are accomplished at deriving solutions. I understand the mindset that underpins this achievement because this is the single most important thing that dad has tried to impress on me, all my life, a sense of self reliance and a confidence in my ability to learn that which is necessary for finding an answer or completing a project.

 

Whilst researching the condition I discovered that other age related illnesses are experiencing break throughs. I found that I was quickly becoming familiar with scientific language and developing an understanding of the inner workings of the human body. I started to formulate, what I thought as being then, and still do now, a grandiose idea. If no one else can cure him, may be I should try. Even as I write this, when I contemplate that statement, I’m aware of how arrogant it sounds. But the idea has taken hold of me and I can’t let it go.

 

I looked for universities that have research departments that specialise in age related illness and diseases, and then contacted them to get information about the direction I should be working towards. I eventually identified that the role I was looking to occupy was that of a Biogerontologist. There are many routes through science to this job, but I knew, from my research, that the answers for these illnesses exist at the genetic level, so biology and, more specifically, molecular and cellular biology, was my route of choice. However, in order to qualify for a position on a molecular and cellular biology degree, at Newcastle University, I would have to, not only, pass every part of an access diploma, I would have to get distinctions as well. Universities of great standing can take their pick of the best students, so competition for places is immense. In September 2015 I signed up for an Access to Higher Education Diploma in the sciences. 

 

I got the grades I needed and Newcastle University has accepted me.

 

And, this is why I have come to Indiegogo and to all of you.

 

My stalling point is this.

 

In order to progress with my study, at Newcastle University, I need a total of £31,900, which breaks down as follows.

Course fees…             £27,500

Travel costs…             £  1,500

Indiegogo fees…        £  2,900

 

 

Neither Sarah nor I have any personal wealth. We barely get by. Whilst deliberating how to keep moving forward with this, both Sarah and I have discussed selling our house, as a contingency plan should the full amount not be reached. Whilst we are fully prepared to do this, the idea of separating ourselves from the memories and attachments of our home weighs heavy on us. But more than this, in recent years our home has provided respite from the world, a place where I could hide.Throughout my life I have cycled through periods of depression and anxiety and I have always tried to not let this have an impact on my professional and personal life. It is a consequence of a capable mind.

 

I do not qualify for student funding because I already have an English degree, there are no scholarships available to me and banks do not provide finance for education programmes of this length. It is important to acknowledge that, whilst my english degree was stimulating and did open up some avenues into employment, it has not been so immersive as to task or occupy my mind. This is something of a problem for me because of the high functioning nature of my depression and anxiety. In terms of the science access diploma, and the work that stems from it, I've found that it is so immersive it almost leaves me with a sense of feeling normal, whatever normal is. Still, I have never had this before, in my entire life. I still have to be careful, as I still experience feelings of anxiety and panic, thoughts that I am failing, I'm a disappointment to my friends and family and that I'm letting everyone down. But it is knowing that what I'm doing is bigger than me, that one day some part I've played in a scientific process will ease or cure a person's suffering, that it will go unnoticed, people will never know of my involvement and never should because it is not of important. Performance of a thankless task, somehow, makes my mental illness bearable.

 

Three years ago I experienced a mental breakdown. Since then I have worked hard to get back to something resembling normality, whilst continuing to manage the depression and anxiety. More importantly, I have also faced up to something I have never really been truthful with myself before, the reality that this illness is part of who I am. From this experience I have had to re-evaluate who I am, what I do and what is necessary. I am not the only person in my family to be afflicted with mental illness, but I am one of the few who are still here, fighting everyday to survive it. 

 

On my best days, I find being around large groups of people, busy situations or loud environments intolerable. Sixth form/further education colleges have a large cohort of enthusiastic sixteen year olds, which guaranteed that at every turn I would find everything that would pose me difficulty. Now at university, the people are not as boisterous, but the number of people is much greater. During my time at college, and currently at university, no matter how depressed I am, how unworthy I feel for the opportunity to be on the course, how the paranoia has me believing that everyone is laughing at me, how the anxiety is sometimes so bad I feel like I cannot breath or how I secrete myself in empty classrooms to avoid the people and the noise, I think about dad’s eczema, how it grinds him down, how it maddens him, and I know I have to finish what I have started.

 

Very few things are achieved by the efforts of one person. Most things are collaborative and there are people I must thank. Lee Chapman, Phil Pritchard, Lucy Wood and Simon Kemp are members of Middlesbrough College’s science faculty who, whilst providing me with a first class education this year, have supported me during my lowest points. Adam Mendum and Lance Julian have been an amazing source of knowledge, experience and support for this campaign, as well as producing the film that accompanies it. I must thank my friends, Martin and Andrea Hirst, Craig and Dusty Reed, Francesca & David Fox-Holmes, Gavin & Faye Jasinek-Smith, Nick and Marie Scott, Martin & Claire Wright, Jackie Steven, Kirsty & Adam Clarke, and Steven Brown, who have all stood for me when I could not stand for myself. Throughout this my mum and dad have been willing me on, not for my dad’s sake but because they know it is better for me to not lock myself away from the world. Most importantly, the single most important person is my wife, Sarah, for whom there will never be enough words, not a sentence, a phrase, or dirty limerick to describe her. She is greater than the sum of her virtues and the person I aspire to be (only without the lady bits).

 

And then there are all of you.

 

Whilst my need is to discover how to make my dad better, we all have an ageing relative who requires treatment for something. So, whilst I want to make this happen I know such things are inspired by our collective need and achieved by our collaborative power. Billions of people I have never met and, most likely, never will, have the power to push forward with this wildly arrogant idea, that as we continue to live longer and longer we do so free from illnesses that are withering to our bodies and minds. Dad has always been an independent and industrious chap, doing things for himself, learning what he has needed along the way to get through life. I suppose I share his spirit. People should be the most productive and healthy versions of themselves, living with the utmost dignity. We must learn the science of what the human body is genetically programmed to do, so we can understand what causes its functions to shut down. The information that Biogerontologist obtain has potential for use in any field of medicine, which, potentially, should liberate millions of people from diseases and conditions, whether they be age related or not.

 

A recent consultation with a dermatologist has resulted in a change of medication that has brought dad some relief, he is not free of the condition because there is no known cure, and he still experiences flare ups.

Please help me to continue... No donation is too small! 

 

FAQs.

Why should I get something for nothing, when other students have to take out loans?

Ever since I first contemplated using crowd funding to further my education I have considered how I can make this a zero cost sum. I discussed this with Sarah and we both observed the following points.

·      Once I am qualified and get my first paying job, I intend to pay forward 9% of anything earned over £21,000 into this fund so that it may, one day, benefit someone else.

·      This is inline with the current repayment rates for student loans.

·      We considered the spirit of those who want to help and contribute to the health and prosperity of others, and understand that such contributions are not made on the proviso that they see their money returned. In fact, some people consider this improper, as it undermines the spirit in which the money was first proffered.

 

Have I tried to get a student loan?

Yes, I have applied for a student loan and have been notified by the student loan company that I am not eligible.

 

Why are you not eligible?

I have completed an English honours degree. Of itself it is a very interesting and mind expanding subject. Because I took out a student loan for this degree, for which I have paid back some of that existing loan, I cannot get another.

 

Have I considered applying for a position in a European university where tuition is free?

There are a few problems with this:

·      The main obstacle to this is that my parents are dependent on me for a number of their routines. If I did go, this is something that could be supported by other family members.

·      A few years ago my dad took a tumble and ended up in hospital. When I got to the hospital and found out he had broken his nose we all had a laugh about it. But on the way there I was a mess. In January this year dad was admitted to hospital for a heart problem, for which he was fitted with a pacemaker. If that call ever comes again, I don’t want to be six hundred miles away.

·      I suffer from chronic anxiety and depression. Sarah would support any ambition I have. But three years of intense study in a German university, without my family around me, would be a cost to my health that is difficult to predict. She has seen me in my lowest moments and knows how I react in situations of extended stress. This would only be compounded by the absence of my support network.

 

What is the extent of age related disease?

The following list is by no means exhaustive, but includes the most prolific conditions that affect morbidity and mortality as we age.

 

Histological Conditions:

Any condition that involves deterioration of cells, tissues, and by extension, organs.

Atherosclerosis and cardiovascular disease.

Cancer.

Arthritis.

Osteoporosis.

Cataracts.

Your digestive system:

Constipation.

Diabetes.

Your bladder and urinary tract:

Urinary incontinence is common with aging. Diabetes can contribute to, as can menopause (women) and an enlarged prostate (men).

Alzheimer's disease.

Respiratory Diseases:

Asthma.

Chronic Bronchitis.

Emphysema.

Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

Influenza and Pneumonia:

Although the flu and pneumonia aren’t chronic conditions, these infections are among the top eight causes of death in people over age 65.

Adult onset sporadic ataxias:There are several disease categories:

toxic causes.

immune-mediated ataxias.

vitamin deficiency.

infectious diseases.

degenerative disorders.

genetic conditions.

Depression.

Current studies suggest that depression can be affected by bacteria in the gut. With older people having less money, and consequently a poorer diet, it is possible that depression in the elderly could be improved by making gut bacteria more resilient.

Poverty

Poverty affects senior health if you're unable to afford doctor visits, medication for chronic conditions, and other essential senior healthcare needs.

The incidence of all of these diseases increases rapidly with aging (increases exponentially with age, in the case of cancer).

 

How will the funders be kept informed during and after the campaign?

We will be sending all of our supporters updates through our Indiegogo page and via email to the email address you have provided when signing up to the Indiegogo site. We will also post updates on our Facebook page: 

 

https://www.facebook.com/?stype=lo&amp;jlou......

 

If the project doesn't reach its funding goal, what will happen?

This is a Flexible Campaign which means that even if we don’t reach our goal, I will still receive all the funds raised. All money raised will go towards my tuition fees and travelling costs. If the fund does not achieve the final goal, we will use the money that has been donated to pay what we can and then achieve the rest of the goal by activating plan B. Plan B is to sell our house and my parents’ will also sell their home. We will buy a house to accommodate all of the family, with a percentage of the money from the sale of my parents’ house being used to pay the rest of my tuition fees.

 

If the project reaches it goal, what will happen to any extra donations?

Any extra money made above the target will go straight into research of age related diseases via SENs or CDRF.

 

When will the perks be delivered?

We start delivering perks and give more information and details on the delivery after the campaign.

 

Have you ever donated money to other people’s campaigns before considering funding for yourself?

Yes, we have. We have donated small amounts of money to a number of very select causes. We would love to give more and distribute it more broadly because there are many more causes we are touched by than our miniscule amount of disposable money can stretch to. We have also raised money for Mind, diabetes UK, cancer research, Daisy Chain and the NSPCC.

 

Risks and Challenges:

The challenge of full time education and the demands of higher education in relation to my mental illness.

 

The challenge of being in a much busier environment in relation to my mental illness.

 

Because part of my psychological make up includes Imposter Syndrome, I attribute little to no worth to anything I do. It is my hope that by studying this subject from the ground up I will be earning my place at the table with all those other people in the scientific sector. It is no guarantee that I will transcend my feelings of inadequacy, but I will have gained the knowledge and experience to prove it, and with the occasional nudge from Sarah I will be more inclined to recognise this status.

 

Other ways you can help:

Please,  spread the word.

All money raised will go towards my tuition fees and travelling costs. If the fund does not achieve the final goal, we will use the money that has been donated to pay what we can and then achieve the rest of the goal by activating plan B. Plan B is to sell our house and my parents’ will also sell their home. We will buy a house to accommodate all of the family, with a percentage of the money from the sale of my parents’ house being used to pay the rest of my tuition fees. If the project reaches it goal, what will happen to any extra donations?Any extra money made above the target will go straight into research of age related diseases via SENs or CDRF. When will the perks be delivered?We start delivering perks and give more information and details on the delivery after the campaign. Have you ever donated money to other people’s campaigns before considering funding for yourself?Yes, we have. We have donated small amounts of money to a number of very select causes. We would love to give more and distribute it more broadly because there are many more causes we are touched by than our miniscule amount of disposable money can stretch to. We have also raised money for Mind, diabetes UK, cancer research, Daisy Chain and the NSPCC. Risks and Challenges:The challenge of full time education and the demands of higher education in relation to my mental illness. The challenge of being in a much busier environment in relation to my mental illness. Because part of my psychological make up includes Imposter Syndrome, I attribute little to no worth to anything I do. It is my hope that by studying this subject from the ground up I will be earning my place at the table with all those other people in the scientific sector. It is no guarantee that I will transcend my feelings of inadequacy, but I will have gained the knowledge and experience to prove it, and with the occasional nudge from Sarah I will be more inclined to recognise this status. Other ways you can help:Please,  spread the word.

story:
"Trumpus Interruptus" is a FEC-registered media production Super PAC dedicated to producing anti-Trump media.

We'll bring together filmmakers, writers, artists and musicians to refute and undermine Trump's message. Our aim is to produce videos, music and memes that are pointed, clever, humorous and sharable. We will distribute through targeted social media, and if budget allows, through broadcast and cable TV.

We seek to:
    •    Persuade undecided voters of the con that Trump represents
    •    Remind progressives, whatever their skepticism of HRC, of the far greater danger of a Trump presidency
    •    Discourage Bernie Sanders supporters from throwing away their vote
    •    Undermine the notion among Trump's base (white working class voters), that he'll work for their interests
    •    Motivate all anti-Trump voters to Get Out and Vote


For example, we will:
    •    Crowdsource memes, videos, and music by offering cash prizes to the best of each month
    •    Engage our team of filmmakers, writers, and artists to develop our own videos and memes
    •    Seek out and vet people stiffed by Trump bankruptcies, or scammed by Trump University, interview them on camera, edit into short sound bite videos, which we will drop on many successive days

BY LAW ONLY US CITIZENS AND GREEN CARD HOLDERS ARE ELIGIBLE TO DONATE

story:
The Zero Project

Rare opportunity

How often do any of us get a real chance to foster World Peace?  Yes, World Peace, with caps!  We ourselves were overwhelmed by the opportunity offered by a major international organization that proposed to our non-profit ZerOrigIndia Foundation to help facilitate an Interfaith Dialogue of leaders of world religions.  Soon we will be able to announce full details.  But for now, the central theme of the international conference would revolve around the many ‘cohesive elements’ offered by the Zero Project, uniting India, the Arab and Persian world, North Africa and Europe in times of grave division. By all of us banding together we can make it happen and contribute to the cause! 


Objective

While the immediate objective of the ZerOrigIndia Foundation may sound as abstract as the Interfaith Dialogue is concrete, things will become clear once its full scope is realized: When, where and who exactly innovated the zero digit that was to unleash revolutions in mathematics, science and technology over the centuries and drastically impact all of our lives?  No zero digit, no Industrial or Scientific Revolution, no Information Age or Space Age.  Just imagine, no zero, no computers, no Internet, email, Facebook, smartphones, no Indiegogo.  And yet very little is known about what has been hailed as one of the greatest developments in human history alongside the domestication of fire and the invention of the wheel. 


Zero arose inexplicably at a rather late date in history even though advanced civilizations had done complex mathematics and astronomy for two millennia prior.  So there must have been something very special about the invention of zero.  But what could that be?  The zero digit may hold more secrets for us yet, more innovation, too, once we come to understand the nature of its origin.  In that sense this crowdfunding campaign is a unique opportunity like no other to embark on an exciting adventure together.

This is not about mathematics proper, so don’t be put off.  This is about exposing the origin of the zero digit as tangible treasure from a rich philosophical enlightenment tradition, whose central aim goes far beyond mathematics.  With your help, our Camp Zero 2016 Team led by the intrepid ‘Indiana Joan’ aka Dr Annette van der Hoek, will be charged with drawing up a roadmap to be travelled by specialist researchers over the next 4-5 years.  Tracing zero’s roots will be a tall order requiring the combined talents of a range of experts in their respective fields.  Serendipity discoveries are bound to show up along the way as well, adding yet extra spice to the mix. 

Who are we?

We are a group of close friends who after years of thorough preparation decided to pool resources in the ZerOrigIndia Foundation in order to facilitate academic research into one of the intriguing and unresolved mysteries in the world that has profound implications for us to this very day.  In addition, we enjoy the unstinting support of a team of volunteers and well-wishers, who are together multitasking for us on various fronts: in government, in business, in civil society.  Yet without the support of Indiegogo fans, we would get nowhere fast.  So please do join in and be part of this historic adventure!  We warmly welcome all new pioneer ‘Zeronauts’.  Don’t think of yourself as a ‘donor’, but claim ownership!  ZerOrigIndia belongs to us all.


What We Need & What You Get

Our level-headed Board of Trustees, all unpaid volunteers, have worked long and hard to arrive at a barebones, shoestring budget to finance the academic research required until 2020.  Depending on progress booked, the Board will take stock along the way to consider whether further research may be required at the end of that period.  The overall program has been broken down into manageable components with Camp Zero 2016 being our kick-start pilot project to be hosted at the Indian Institute of Technology in Bombay (IITB), one of the premier research institutions in the world.  Our first $40,000 crowdfunding target is required to defray costs incurred by the team of 10-20 PhD students and postdocs to draw up and publish the roadmap to be followed subsequently.  However, the academic researchers to do the subsequent in-depth research until 2020 are not volunteers and must be paid the going rate.  So our 'stretch goals' beyond the $40,000 target are $50,000-75,000 a year per qualified researcher (4-5).  It is highly specialized research that cannot be conducted in any other way or we would do it. 

ZerOrigIndia Foundation Chairperson Dr René Samson

Your perks

The ZerOrigIndia Foundation commissioned local Dutch artists to produce a number of special perks on the theme of the innovation of the zero digit in India, which include two original posters, a dance video based on our signature tune, composed and performed by a young virtuoso Indian-style violinist accompanied on tabla by a master musician -- apropos the Indian theme.  The perks as well as a number of introductory videos to the campaign may be sampled on our website: www.zerorigindia.org.  Dr Annette will also keep a regular blog to update you on latest developments while hot on zero's trail.  Follow the blow by blow account from Bombay.


What if?

Realistically speaking we cannot expect to raise all of the funds required until 2020 during the present crowdfunding campaign alone.  But we will go for the InDemand option on Indiegogo to get as far as we can.  We will see to it that we set the bar as high as reasonable and push the research program as far as possible with the resources available.  The results will be regularly reported to you, our loyal supporters, and publicized via the media and educational system for the benefit of posterity, as per our formal Foundation objectives.  The research program was especially designed to be conducted piecemeal, in a flexible and modular manner, whenever required.  Together we will set the stage and the pace, which can always be resumed at a later date, the tried and tested scientific method.  Nothing is lost but much is gained by fixing the intended horizon. 


The Impact

The precise long-term advantages of supporting the Zero Project are not easily quantified.  But look at the benefits numerous generations of our ancestors have derived from progress over the centuries from exploring the frontiers of science.  The zero digit has been instrumental in breakthroughs in mathematics, science and technology for reasons still not well-understood.  Why did the concept of emptiness play such a pivotal role in the mindset of modernity?  The Zero Project aims to tackle that and related issues with its novel working hypotheses, plural, combined with a systematic approach to the research required, which frankly has never been done to date, baffling as that may be.  But better late than never, as the old adage goes.  The ZerOrigIndia Foundation has sound reason to assume that this strategy will pay off in spades.  Some of the reasons are rather technical, but are related to cutting-edge research in the field of modern physics.  Lest this sound remote from our immediate personal lives, the very insight that has led to the proposed research program also holds the potential of paving the way to crossing new thresholds by questioning old paradigms that have outlived their usefulness. 

Emeritus Professor Johannes Bronkhorst, Indologist, University of Lausanne

  "Unfortunately little is known about the origin of this digit. Strong indicators point to India, but research so far has done little beyond giving us some rough idea as to the date when this digit came into use (or had come into use). It has not so far explained what intellectual context provided the background and/or context that made this momentous invention possible.

"If research sponsored by the ZerOrigIndia Foundation will shed light on this last question, not only Indologists and historians of mathematics will be grateful. Understanding how and why the great inventions were made that made modern science and technology possible, concerns all mankind. And the invention of zero certainly ranks among the greatest."

Our track record

The ZerOrigIndia Foundation is a newly established Dutch-based nonprofit.  However, all of our Trustees individually and together have decades of experience in various walks of life, including in the sciences, the humanities, the arts and business world, that insures balanced and pragmatic policies calculated to lead to the desired results.  In addition, we enjoy the unstinting support from our wider support network, our Committee of Recommendation and Advisory Committee comprising, former ambassadors and reputed academics, who have all endorsed the Zero Project over the past two years or longer.  At our formal launch in May of this year, the Ambassador of India in the Netherlands welcomed the initiative and considered it to be important (excerpts of his address in the video gallery on Indiegogo).  Full details may be found on the ‘About Us’ page of our website and Facebook.  We also have the stamp of approval from the very exacting Dutch Tax Office, which after a demanding application procedure granted the ZerOrigIndia Foundation nonprofit status under Dutch law and keeping a close tabs.


Risks & Challenges

As far as risks are concerned, perhaps an academic research program is not subject to risks faced in trade and commerce, and so may be less applicable to the Zero Project.  The ZerOrigIndia Foundation only facilitates the project.  We have very experienced academics on board, who are quite familiar with how such research projects are run.  The challenges would be more in the nature of tackling the central objective of finding fresh evidence of the origin of the zero digit in India.  But there, too, it bodes well that one of the few acknowledged authorities on ancient Indian mathematics and astronomy, Prof. K. Ramasubramaniam, associated with one of India’s most renowned research institutes IIT Bombay, has taken on this challenge.  Prof Ramasubramaniam recently participated in a meeting organized by a French think-tank, to inform the Dalai Lama in Dharmsala (India) about his subject.  There are numerous You Tube videos available of his popular lectures.

Risks have been kept to a minimum!  Dividing by zero is a no-no.


Other Ways You Can Help

As mentioned above, don’t think of yourself as a donor, but stakeholder!  This project belongs to everyone who opts to participate in whatever way deemed appropriate.  It would help a lot if you would sign the website petition free of charge (home page), but also if you would network on our behalf to recruit participants for the upcoming Camp Zero 2016 session in India this Fall.  The recruitment document is posted on the ‘Crowdsourcing’ page of the website. 


Indiegogo share tools!

Indiegogo makes life easy by providing its handy ‘share tool’, too.  Thanks for your support and we look forward to jointly rising to this historic challenge!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Garvin Reid and I would like to introduce you to LiveteachingTV.

As an Educator, one of my pet peeves is the unavailability of free public education to all. I understand some of the challenges that make this seem impossible. However, I noticed that despite the disparity in our global socioeconomic  lifestyles, "In 2014, nearly 60 percent of the population worldwide already owned a mobile phone," (Statista.com) For me, every one of those users should be literate, informed, and have some form of education, preferably to at least high school level. Unfortunately, that's not the case. But it can be!

"According to UNESCO, in the world today there are about 1 billion non-literate adults. This 1 billion is approximately 26 percent of the world's adult population. Women make up two-thirds of all non-literates. 98 percent of all non-literates live in developing countries." (Emphasis, mine). Source: SIL International.

Here are some other facts gathered from their website and UNESCO's:

  • 52 percent of all non-literates live in India,  sub-Saharan Africa and China.
  • In all developing countries, the percentage of children aged 6-11 not attending school is 15 percent
  • Of the world's non-literate population, an estimated 476 million are speakers of lesser-known languages. In other words, approximately 50 percent of all non-literates are minority language speakers.

UNESCO defines literacy as having the "ability to read and write with understanding a simple statement related to one’s daily life. It involves a continuum of reading and writing skills, and often includes basic arithmetic skills (numeracy)."

Here is another interesting fact gathered from the World Education website: In the United States of America (a developed country) over 30 million adults do not have a high school diploma. Need I say more?

The reality is that we cannot walk on the moon, build bridges, cure diseases, build platforms like Indiegogo and Facebook, without some form of education. Yet, only 6.7% of the world population have a college degree. And the higher the degree, the smaller the percentage gets.

My dream is to see an interactive, online learning platform where educators, passionate about spreading their knowledge, meet with equally passionate seekers of knowledge via live streaming. This can happen at any time, at any level, from anywhere in the world. There are no barriers to entry. This is a lofty idea, I know. But it is doable. We may not be able to reach everyone. But it won't stop us from trying.

Statistics also show there is a gender gap across generations. LiveteachingTV will level the playing field, making education available to ALL.

Presently, we have great institutions with websites such as Coursera, Udemy, and Lynda.com. However, many times students get stuck and don’t have an opportunity to raise their hands in the classroom to get immediate answers to problems they are facing. Not only that, these websites mostly caters to individuals who already have some form of education, which is usually a high school diploma.

This is where LiveteachingTV comes in. The LiveteachingTV platform will facilitate learning at every level, including those who simply want to learn how to read and write. LiveteachingTV will have instructors who have the patience and understanding necessary to teach beginners, yet the know-how to work with intermediates, and even share ideas among their peers.

LiveteachingTV will bring to the Internet what has been lacking from the other streaming platforms offering online courses: the excitement a teacher feels when he or she knows a student has finally grasped the material. LiveteachingTV will bring structure to the self-paced viewer who wants to solve the problem himself, but who is thankful you, the teacher, are there to help guide him along the right path. With LiveteachingTV, knowledge can easily flow in both directions, giving meaning to the interaction. For example, a teacher can have a Question and Answer session. This would truly connect both viewer and instructor.

I am excited about the new vistas we can reach through technology in education. I believe this website could be a potentially very valuable resource for all different levels of learners around the world. They say knowledge is power and that the Internet has connected the world, so if we connect the right teachers with willing students, we can empower a large population of the world.

With my dedicated team including Joan Gumbs, Chidi Osirike, and Christopher Murray, plus an ensemble of web developers and designers, we will put together a platform that is not only functional, but also aesthetically pleasing, giving UI/UX that equals and surpasses other players in the industry. We will market the idea to our target audience, which is basically everyone who has a passion for lifelong learning, and a passion to share knowledge. Once we have all the players in place, we will launch LiveteachingTV to the world, circa late November, early December.

We are open to investors and donors. By getting involved in our campaign, you are literally giving the endless gift of knowledge. Once we have the essential infrastructure that will facilitate teachers streaming their content live from anywhere in the world, the site will more or less run itself. Yes, there will be some required initial screening for “professionals” and the continual screening for potential inappropriate or incorrect material.

The vision is for LiveteachingTV to be like Twitch, in terms of its infrastructure, except, instead of gaming, streamers will be teaching subjects like Mathematics and English. On Liveteaching.tv viewers will be able to actively engage and ask their teachers questions as though they were sitting in a classroom. Students will be able to watch teachers solve Mathematical problems, enabling them to learn faster. Once done, the streams will be available as videos for download, where they can watch over and over again, until they have mastered the subject.

 

What We Need & What You Get

To get up and running—i.e. design and build the platform for streamers and viewers, Liveteaching’s budget is: $50,000. We are starting small. We believe in creeping, before we walk.

Our vision is to facilitate free education. Unfortunately, due to the maintenance of the site, and the fact teachers would want to receive some stipend for their service, we will have to charge  a subscription fee to access the site. However, initially the site will be FREE... But unlike Facebook, it won't always be.  As the site is new, we think it's only fair to make it available to you as we work out all kinks that will arise due to user engagement. We will gauge the stability of the site based on traffic, etc, and will monitor to ensure the site works as it should and our viewers and streamers are satisfied. We will try to keep it FREE for at least the first three months.

When we do start charging a subscription fee it won't be more than $20 per month. A $20/month subscription, is "doable," for most, if not all seekers of knowledge. This is significantly less than the cost of lunch and bus fare for one student in a developing country. We promise that the subscription fee will never increase. We will find other avenues for funding, if the need should ever arise for us to need additional funding. We will even offer a 30-day FREE trial!

As the user-base increases, the site is going to need to hire moderators. Other personnel that will initially be hired to get this project off the ground include graphic designers, website developers, marketers, public relations, an accountant, and an attorney for legalities.

This is an ideal time to make an investment in a website that could be world-changing, and could one day become a household name. By investing in LiveteachingTV, you are contributing to a website that will be beneficial to humanity, not to mention the added bonus of a potential return on your investment.

Here are some of the perks you will receive when you make a pledge:

a)      $5 - A BIG Thank you!!! In Jamaica they say, “one-one coco, full the basket.” Plus, we list your name on the Liveteaching sponsor page as a visionary.

b)     $10 - Everything in the $5 pkg, plus free subscription for a month.

c)      $20 - Everything in the $10 pkg, plus free subscription to the site for two months.

d)     $25 – Free subscription to the site for three months.

e)      $50 – Free subscription to the site for six months.

f)      $100 – Free subscription to the site for one year.

g)     $200 – Free subscription to the site for two years.

h)     $500 – Free subscription for three years, plus  a one-of-a-kind LiveteachingTV T-shirt with "Live education: The key to the future!" written on the back.

i)       $1000 - Everything in the $500 pkg, plus an evening with the founder(s) at a five-star hotel in Jamaica.

j)       $2,000 - Everything in the $1000 pkg, plus have your name immortalized in the storyline of Deborah, the latest book by Joan Gumbs, scheduled for release in 2017. Also receive an autographed copy of the book.

k)     $5,000 – Free subscription to the site for life, plus have the novel, Deborah dedicated to you. Release date 2017.

Note:

If we reach and exceed our target; hooray! A big thank you, to you! This will allow us to build a site comparable to all the other great learning institutions online, and hire a marketing team to help spread the word across the globe.

If we do not meet our target. It’s still okay. The domain name is bought and the website is already hosted with GoDaddy. We won’t have Amazon’s powerful server, nor will we be able to facilitate a huge traffic to the site, but the mission will be carried out, even if it is with only two subjects: Mathematics and English—at different levels. Already, we have teachers available for these subjects.

Here’s a link to our website, which is presently a WordPress site: http://liveteaching.tv

The Impact

This project will make a difference in the world because it will connect passionate educators with people from less-privileged, more isolated backgrounds. Think of the millions of people in developing nations who cannot read and write. And it’s not only a problem for developing nations. There is a prominent preacher who recently said on national television that he learned to read only a few years ago. He is from the United States of America--a developed country.

Education is very expensive in many parts of the world. Yet almost everyone has  mobile phone. Think of the possibilities. With the right technological know-how to set up the website, some marketing to make people aware of the new website, and some moderators to make sure the content is all legitimate, this could potentially be a ground-breaker in education. There is no other website offering free live education at all levels right now, at least, not that we are aware of, and this project could be a tipping point in the world of education. This website will have a huge economic and social impact on families the world over. We perish for lack of vision. Live education is the key to the future.

Risks & Challenges

One of the benefits to this venture is that it is very low-risk, as it can always be guaranteed that there will be a high demand online for educational videos. That is our worst-case scenario.

With no physical product to manufacture and drop ship, our greatest challenge is not being able to build the kind of website that could withstand an endless stream of traffic, and to pay the professionals, like web developers, who would be working to get Liveteaching up and running by late November, early December.

However, having a good marketing strategy would be key to involving the right kind of contributors and in informing the public of this new resource available to them on their phone. This is the most important aspect of the business currently: developing a successful and far-reaching marketing and advertising campaign.

With the appropriate funds, in addition to building the website, we hope to purchase the services of a marketing company with a well-established background in this sector to help us spread the word. We already have contacts, employees, students from all over the globe who are eager to see live teaching emerge as one of the new leaders in online education of the future. By utilizing our international contacts and focusing on our central goal to provide education to anyone, anywhere, I believe we are in a perfect time and place to launch this new venture.

Other Ways You Can Help

●       Please share our campaign link among your social media network (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and even your own website). You can also utilize Indiegogo's share tools.

●       Tweet this: You can help stem illiteracy around the world AND as a bonus, receive a free subscription when you pledge $10+ to help @LiveteachingTV

●       Please tell everyone in your circle of friends, family, and co-workers, and ask them to tell their circle of friends, family, and co-workers to make a pledge of even $5. When they pledge they are literally giving the gift of knowledge, without which we all would perish. 

●       Please let us know if there are any funding opportunities, or investors who you feel may be interested in new revolutions in technology.

Thank you for your love and support. Let's revolutionize education, and let's level the playing field so no child or adult gets left behind.

Please visit our website for additional information on LiveteachingTV.

With all our love,

LTTV team
story_txt:
Short Summary
My name is Garvin Reid and I would like to introduce you to LiveteachingTV.
As an Educator, one of my pet peeves is the unavailability of free public education to all. I understand some of the challenges that make this seem impossible. However, I noticed that despite the disparity in our global socioeconomic  lifestyles, "In 2014, nearly 60 percent of the population worldwide already owned a mobile phone," (Statista.com) For me, every one of those users should be literate, informed, and have some form of education, preferably to at least high school level. Unfortunately, that's not the case. But it can be!
"According to UNESCO, in the world today there are about 1 billion non-literate adults. This 1 billion is approximately 26 percent of the world's adult population. Women make up two-thirds of all non-literates. 98 percent of all non-literates live in developing countries." (Emphasis, mine). Source: SIL International.
Here are some other facts gathered from their website and UNESCO's:

52 percent of all non-literates live in India,  sub-Saharan Africa and China.
In all developing countries, the percentage of children aged 6-11 not attending school is 15 percent
Of the world's non-literate population, an estimated 476 million are speakers of lesser-known languages. In other words, approximately 50 percent of all non-literates are minority language speakers.

UNESCO defines literacy as having the "ability to read and write with understanding a simple statement related to one’s daily life. It involves a continuum of reading and writing skills, and often includes basic arithmetic skills (numeracy)."
Here is another interesting fact gathered from the World Education website: In the United States of America (a developed country) over 30 million adults do not have a high school diploma. Need I say more?
The reality is that we cannot walk on the moon, build bridges, cure diseases, build platforms like Indiegogo and Facebook, without some form of education. Yet, only 6.7% of the world population have a college degree. And the higher the degree, the smaller the percentage gets.

My dream is to see an interactive, online learning platform where educators, passionate about spreading their knowledge, meet with equally passionate seekers of knowledge via live streaming. This can happen at any time, at any level, from anywhere in the world. There are no barriers to entry. This is a lofty idea, I know. But it is doable. We may not be able to reach everyone. But it won't stop us from trying.
Statistics also show there is a gender gap across generations. LiveteachingTV will level the playing field, making education available to ALL.
Presently, we have great institutions with websites such as Coursera, Udemy, and Lynda.com. However, many times students get stuck and don’t have an opportunity to raise their hands in the classroom to get immediate answers to problems they are facing. Not only that, these websites mostly caters to individuals who already have some form of education, which is usually a high school diploma.

This is where LiveteachingTV comes in. The LiveteachingTV platform will facilitate learning at every level, including those who simply want to learn how to read and write. LiveteachingTV will have instructors who have the patience and understanding necessary to teach beginners, yet the know-how to work with intermediates, and even share ideas among their peers.
LiveteachingTV will bring to the Internet what has been lacking from the other streaming platforms offering online courses: the excitement a teacher feels when he or she knows a student has finally grasped the material. LiveteachingTV will bring structure to the self-paced viewer who wants to solve the problem himself, but who is thankful you, the teacher, are there to help guide him along the right path. With LiveteachingTV, knowledge can easily flow in both directions, giving meaning to the interaction. For example, a teacher can have a Question and Answer session. This would truly connect both viewer and instructor.

I am excited about the new vistas we can reach through technology in education. I believe this website could be a potentially very valuable resource for all different levels of learners around the world. They say knowledge is power and that the Internet has connected the world, so if we connect the right teachers with willing students, we can empower a large population of the world.
With my dedicated team including Joan Gumbs, Chidi Osirike, and Christopher Murray, plus an ensemble of web developers and designers, we will put together a platform that is not only functional, but also aesthetically pleasing, giving UI/UX that equals and surpasses other players in the industry. We will market the idea to our target audience, which is basically everyone who has a passion for lifelong learning, and a passion to share knowledge. Once we have all the players in place, we will launch LiveteachingTV to the world, circa late November, early December.
We are open to investors and donors. By getting involved in our campaign, you are literally giving the endless gift of knowledge. Once we have the essential infrastructure that will facilitate teachers streaming their content live from anywhere in the world, the site will more or less run itself. Yes, there will be some required initial screening for “professionals” and the continual screening for potential inappropriate or incorrect material.

The vision is for LiveteachingTV to be like Twitch, in terms of its infrastructure, except, instead of gaming, streamers will be teaching subjects like Mathematics and English. On Liveteaching.tv viewers will be able to actively engage and ask their teachers questions as though they were sitting in a classroom. Students will be able to watch teachers solve Mathematical problems, enabling them to learn faster. Once done, the streams will be available as videos for download, where they can watch over and over again, until they have mastered the subject.
 

What We Need & What You Get
To get up and running—i.e. design and build the platform for streamers and viewers, Liveteaching’s budget is: $50,000. We are starting small. We believe in creeping, before we walk.

Our vision is to facilitate free education. Unfortunately, due to the maintenance of the site, and the fact teachers would want to receive some stipend for their service, we will have to charge  a subscription fee to access the site. However, initially the site will be FREE... But unlike Facebook, it won't always be.  As the site is new, we think it's only fair to make it available to you as we work out all kinks that will arise due to user engagement. We will gauge the stability of the site based on traffic, etc, and will monitor to ensure the site works as it should and our viewers and streamers are satisfied. We will try to keep it FREE for at least the first three months.
When we do start charging a subscription fee it won't be more than $20 per month. A $20/month subscription, is "doable," for most, if not all seekers of knowledge. This is significantly less than the cost of lunch and bus fare for one student in a developing country. We promise that the subscription fee will never increase. We will find other avenues for funding, if the need should ever arise for us to need additional funding. We will even offer a 30-day FREE trial!
As the user-base increases, the site is going to need to hire moderators. Other personnel that will initially be hired to get this project off the ground include graphic designers, website developers, marketers, public relations, an accountant, and an attorney for legalities.
This is an ideal time to make an investment in a website that could be world-changing, and could one day become a household name. k)     $5,000 – Free subscription to the site for life, plus have the novel, Deborah dedicated to you. Release date 2017.

story:
I have been passionate about self-defense most of my life; it began in high school, in an unfortunate altercation with a classmate who was bullying me. Events like these led me to pursue college degrees in various fields such as Police Science, Criminal Justice and a Masters in Public Administration. Also, it led me to the study of several different martial arts to see what actually worked on the street and what didn’t.  

With this knowledge I wrote my first nationally published book on avoiding violence, How To Be Safe No Matter What.  In 2001, I founded DEFENSEWORKS, which provided women’s self-defense and self-defense seminars to Fortune 500 companies, non-profits and individuals.  I have received a number of awards and much praise from satisfied clients.  I have also been published in Black Belt Magazine and Self-Defense for Women Magazine as well as other national periodicals.  

Over five years ago, I became adjunct faculty at Mount Mary University, where I currently teach a course on women's self-defense.  After learning of the terrible epidemic of sexual assault on US college campuses, I decided to take action and create a DVD that can prepare a potential victim to deal with this issue. This DVD is the only one that I'm aware of, which combines non-physical, verbal, and psychological tactics with over 30 physical self-defense techniques. My campaign goal is to see this adopted by every college and university in the US; however, it also has global application because women of any age are able to apply these tactics.


BUDGET

We need $6,200.00

Equipment Purchase (camera, tripod, fluid head, microphone, SD cards, battery packs, SD card reader, etc): $2,180.00

Location Rental for 30 hours of filming: $300.00

Talent (actors and featured performers): $200.00

Duplication Fee (for 1,000 DVDs): $1,100.00

Video services (Shooting and editing): $858.00

Graphic Design (for DVD cover art and label): $250.00

Insurance: $460.00

Miscellaneous: $852.00

Total: $6,200.00


PERKS

1.  $20 One (1) download plus a copy of my book, How To Be Safe No Matter What.

2.  $40 One (1) copy of the women’s self-defense DVD.

3.  $80 One (1) autographed book, one (1) DVD and one (1) download. 

4.  $160 One (1) autographed book, one (1) DVD, one (1) download & a 30 minute self-defense Skype Q&A with me. 

5.  $320 Six (6) autographed books, six (6) DVDs and one (1) download.

6.  $640 Six (6) books, six (6) DVDs, one (1) download, and a one hour private lesson for up to six people with me in the Milwaukee, Wisconsin area.  Plus, the title of Associate Producer in the DVD credits. 

7.   $1,280 and higher, 12 autographed books, 12 DVDs, one (1) download, and a three-hour self-defense session of up to twelve people in the Milwaukee, Wisconsin area. Plus, the title of Executive Producer in the DVD credits. 

If we do not reach our goal, the funds will be put toward starting the project and other efforts to raise funds.  

Your life-saving contributions will help stem the tide of sexual violence against women.  


RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Potential setbacks include:

Selecting the right talent. Talent will be selected from established contacts. Talent will not be previously trained in these self-defense tactics, so I will instruct them prior to the taping. This may mean a slightly longer shooting schedule so we have allotted 30 hours of time and space rental to accommodate this. Actors will be instructed to wear neutral clothing (clothing without logos and/or any other copyrighted material) to avoid infringement or potential lawsuits.

Sick days and talent commitments may arise, but we have a substantial window of time at the chosen facility to accommodate such events if they should occur.

To make the DVD more understandable, we are shooting from multiple angles, which may increase production time, but we have allotted for this.

Finally, there may be potential price increases for the services listed prior to the end of the project.


Obstacles:

What qualifies me to overcome them?  I will be working with an experienced videographer who has done projects like these before.  I'm well-educated on the information I wish to convey so it’s just getting the camera in front of me and the talent I've trained.  Because these tactics are designed with the average woman in mind, there is a very rapid learning curve.

story:
Hi. I’m Tsvia Horesh, a music therapist from Israel.

Four years ago I traveled to Myanmar, in South East Asia. I was concerned to discover that the majority of  physically disabled people  there don’t receive sufficient care.  Their needs are overwhelming. I felt compelled to return to Yangon, Myanmar six months later. There I carried out a two week training, sharing  my  skills as a music therapist with local teachers, teaching them how to use music as a means of connecting and building relationships with children with special needs and disabilities.

 Two years ago I ran a very successful campaign in Indigogo, which succeeded in raising $6500. These donations enabled myself and two other Israeli music therapists to return  to Yangon and carry out a second, four week training.  

Please check out the  the campaign "Bringing Music Therapy to Myanmar" video we made two years ago. There you can learn more about Myanmar, the challenges the country faces in  caring for disabled children and the history of this project.


Since 2012 we have carried out two main trainings and two followups, reaching 40 teachers altogether,  from nine different schools,  and hundreds of the children in their care. We received clinical supervision from Music as Therapy International , and some financial support from the Israeli Embassy in Yangon and  TGH .

One of the interesting things that I have learned is that not only the students, but the teachers also benefit greatly from these workshops and training.  The majority of the  teachers  are young women  and men whose training has been on the job. Some of them have academic degrees in education, some don’t and started to work straight out of high school.  None of them have had any therapeutic education and most  have no musical background.  For them, this exposure to using music therapeutically is an opportunity to receive empowerment through specialized training.

The money raised from this campaign will enable me to go to Yangon in February  2016  for two weeks. During this time I will observe the experienced teachers in their work in their respective schools, meet with them in a group in order to hone their skills and conduct a skills sharing training for new teachers. What will be exciting this time is that the experienced teachers will participate in coaching the newcomers, joining me in teaching them the preliminaries of starting music sessions in their schools.

Any money raised above the amount specified will go towards buying musical instruments for the schools that need them. And anything above that  will be put aside for the next follow-up.  I am happy to pass on my  skills and my time for free. I  just need the funds to get to Myanmar.

Please check out our Facebook page  to see more pictures and videos of the past  trainings and  to get a feeling of what is going on there.

Sorry, but no perks! All the money raised, and energy invested will be devoted to the trainings.  But by liking our FB page, you will be getting on the spot updates of what is going on!

 Thanks so much for your time. Please help by donating and  sharing this campaign. Join us in  bringing  more Music Therapy to Myanmar !!

I  just need the funds to get to Myanmar.Please check out our Facebook page  to see more pictures and videos of the past  trainings and  to get a feeling of what is going on there.Sorry, but no perks! All the money raised, and energy invested will be devoted to the trainings.  But by liking our FB page, you will be getting on the spot updates of what is going on! Thanks so much for your time. Please help by donating and  sharing this campaign. Join us in  bringing  more Music Therapy to Myanmar !!

story:
A Connected Planet Foundation is starting an internship program in Haiti to teach college students and interested professionals how to develop software applications. The interns will assist ACP in the development of electronic book and education applications to run on Android mobile computing devices. 



We are raising funds to start the program by conducting a one month training Workshop in Port au Prince for 24 people followed by a 3 month paid internship for the 8 most qualified individuals who attend the Workshop. 


This program is being done in partnership with Ecole Supérieure d'Infotronique d'Haìti (ESIH) in Port-au-Prince, Haiti. ESIH is one of the leading universities in Haiti offering courses and advance degrees in Information Technology. We have also partnered with the Friends of Matènwa and the Matènwa Community Learning Center who will be providing educational content for our program.  

 

   

Example ACP Mobile Applications 

The workshop and our intern program is a direct extension of work already being performed by ACP in Haiti. We have over a dozen education applications available, free-of-charge, for Android devices on Google Play™ and in iTunes for Apple iOS devices. All of our applications are in Haitian Creole or a combination of Creole, French and English. Haitian teachers have helped design our apps. We are currently working on a series of applications which follow the Haitian National Curriculum standards. 

     

 Video Introduction to ACP Mobile Applications 

Workshop participants will earn an ACP Programming Certificate provided they attain standardized proficiency levels . The levels start at Novice, meaning the intern can develop an application with help using a template, and range to Expert, meaning the intern can develop an application from scratch (using open-source material if the wish). ACP will provide and manage all the computing and training resources required to execute the program in Haiti. Application code developed under the program will be made publicly available as open-source material. ACP will seek, facilitate and encourage the support of the international open-source development community. 

Program Impact 
Low cost computing devices are becoming commonplace in Haiti; however, very few software programs are written in the native Haitian Creole language. The full potential of the new technologies is not being realized, specifically in the areas of education. 

What We Need & Why 
ACP estimates the startup costs for the program will be $72,000. This includes development of the training curriculum, the cost of the one month workshop for 24 individuals, a three month paid internship for 8 interns, and the cost of the required equipment. ACP has committed $24,000 to this program. We have already started setting up the program so we need your help to keep going. Funds will be spent in the following areas: 
  1. Intern Training & Work Center with Internet Connectivity
  2. Tablets, Computers and Supplies
  3. Intern Monthly Stipends
  4. Program Staff
Long Term Sustainment Strategy 
The ACP Foundation's long term goal is to transition our entire training program to qualified institutions in Haiti for execution as a profit making enterprise. ACP's ongoing role would be to provide scholarships to deserving individuals to participate in the program and to provide guidance on education content to be developed by interns. 
Other Ways You Can Help 
Even if you can't contribute, please tell a friend about our program. Or tell a dozen friends. 
 Thanks !! 
Thank you for checking out our program. Thank you to James Kirsch (Generalfuzz) for allowing us to use his music in the video.

story:
SUPPORT GREEK CHILDREN
CARDS 4 CAUSE

The Team
Greek children are starving and fainting in Schools, We can all help!
The non-profit organization “Intermediate” is a group of young people in Greece that are compromised in creating new Ideas for social Cause and the increase of partnerships.

History of Crisis

As we all know Greece has been a victim of bad political decisions and within 6 years unemployment and hunger have been more than 60% increased.
This year we wanted to focus of the families and children that have been directly influenced by the economic crisis. The past years we have been reading about children fainting in schools from hunger since their parents are unable to feed them. We came in contact with different companies that are willing to help our cause.


What We Need


1. FIRST OF ALL SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN AT FACEBOOK, TWITTER, ETC.
WITH THIS YOU HELP US WITHOUT COST!

2. If you can support the childrens with few money to Help them.
We want to offer every child in need, school meals 6 months. We collaborated with the Greek spirit card company in Greece and they have positively accepted to give us their greetings cards.
The Greek spirit cards are translated in 3 languages and are based on ancient Greek sayings. 12 Different Sayings! We are offer them so we can feed the children in need.



The Impact

One Card will feeds 2 children a day. 
10000 cards can help them for 6 months.
We ask you to buy the card from us and help us, help the children in need in Greece.
Cards for a Cause!



GREEK MEDIA'S Reporters for the Problem.



GERMAN TRANSLATION

German Translation of Our Project.

SUPPORT GREEK KINDER
CARDS 4 Ursache
Das Team
Griechische Kinder hungern und Ohnmacht in der Schule, können wir alle helfen!
Die Non-Profit-Organisation "Intermediate" ist eine Gruppe von jungen Menschen in Griechenland, die bei der Schaffung von neuen Ideen für die soziale Ursache und die Zunahme der Partnerschaften beeinträchtigt werden.
Geschichte der Krise
Wie wir alle wissen Griechenland ein Opfer der schlechten politischen Entscheidungen war und innerhalb von 6 Jahren Arbeitslosigkeit und Hunger haben mehr als 60% erhöht.
In diesem Jahr wollten wir von den Familien und Kinder zu konzentrieren, die von der Wirtschaftskrise direkt beeinflusst wurden. In den letzten Jahren haben wir über Kinder lesen in Schulen vor Hunger in Ohnmacht, da ihre Eltern sind nicht in der Lage, sie zu füttern. Wir kamen in Kontakt mit verschiedenen Unternehmen, die bereit sind, unsere Sache zu helfen.
Was wir brauchen

1. Zunächst einmal teilen unsere Kampagne auf Facebook, Twitter, ETC.
MIT DIESER Sie helfen uns ohne zusätzliche Kosten!

2. Wenn Sie die Kinder mit wenig Geld unterstützen, ihnen zu helfen.
Wir wollen jedes Kind in Not, Schulmahlzeiten 6 Monate zu bieten. Wir arbeiteten mit dem griechischen Unternehmen Geist Karte in Griechenland, und sie haben positiv auf uns ihre Grüße Karten akzeptiert.
Die griechischen Geist Karten werden in drei Sprachen übersetzt und sind auf antiken griechischen Sprüche basieren. 12 verschiedene Sprüche! Wir sind ihnen bieten, damit wir die Kinder in Not zu ernähren.

Der Aufprall
Eine Karte wird Feeds 2 Kinder pro Tag.
10000 Karten können sie für 6 Monate zu helfen.
Wir bitten Sie, die Karte von uns zu kaufen und uns helfen, die Kinder in Not in Griechenland zu helfen.
Karten für eine gute Sache!

story:
Huntsville Christian Academy, located in Huntsville, Alabama,

is a K-12 preparatory school that provides quality, personalized, tailored education from a Christian perspective. Cultivated and established almost 23 years ago by founder/director Pastor Reggie, and his wife Cathy Whiddon, Huntsville Christian Academy was transpired on the belief that God gave the home and the church the responsibility to educate children, therefore, Huntsville Christian Academy's main philosophy is to teach children to view and live life through biblical principles and to expose each child to these character-building principles that will last a lifetime. The mission is to instill these biblical values and concepts that are the foundation for acquiring successful, interpersonal relationships and productive living.


Pastor Reggie and Cathy Whiddon in front of  HCA campus


When it comes to EDUCATION, Huntsville Christian Academy utilizes an exceptional technique, thus providing cutting-edge education with emphasis on teaching responsibility, integrity, and character to every child.

The learning curriculum specializes in the educational concept of A.C.E-- ACCELERATED CHRISTIAN EDUCATION--to produce academic excellence.
This unique method derives from five basic laws of learning that prepare, strengthen, and allow students to individually progress and excel--at their OWN performance level.



HCA's main building (the first expansion from a smaller facility) was built in 2001.



At Huntsville Christian Academy, each child has a lesson plan designed to meet his or her academic needs. Every new student is given a diagnostic test that allows us to custom fit each child with his/her curriculum. The student is then prescribed lessons around the particular subject needing mastery. In addition, each child is afforded personalized, one-on-one instruction from a highly-dedicated and trained staff. Lesson plans are not developed for an entire class to be lock-stepped together. Once again, EACH CHILD IS AN INDIVIDUAL. Because no two children are the same, they learn at different paces and are educated on different levels. Ultimately, there’s no pressure to be ahead, but no restraint from getting ahead!





In 1993, founder/director, Pastor Reggie Whiddon, was driving along Interstate 25 in Colorado Springs, CO, when God gave him a vision (now HCA) that inspired him to start a Christian preparatory school to instill character and integrity into the lives of as many children as he able to reach. Without any funds, Mr. & Mrs. Whiddon embarked on this mission, having to start with what they had---five children. For the first five months they proceeded to have "school" in their home and once people started hearing of this "vision", they began to contribute, turning HCA into the reality it is today. The Lord helped pave the way for HCA with a blessing of a $10,000 contribution, and it was off to new heights from there!


Article written in 1994 by Huntsville Times on HCA's first big expansion/relocation to West Park.


Huntsville Christian Academy has been a project of faith and obedience to God, and because HCA was birthed by God's vision through Pastor Reggie Whiddon, He has continued to bless the school for over 22 years now resulting in tremendous growth and an outstanding reputation throughout the Southeast.


The first class in 1994 on opening day at the original Old Madison Pike campus.


Huntsville Christian Academy's current campus, the main building facilitates 120 students (K-12) in seven classrooms. In addition, there is a full size high school gymnasium, playground, lunchroom and chapel for assemblies.

The playground is located between the main building and the gymnasium.


The gymnasium/auditorium was built in 2004.


As an accomplished result of previous expansion, Huntsville Christian Academy currently enrolls 110 students, 44 of which are in grades 9-12.

High school class of 2015.


ONCE AGAIN, our growth has been overwhelming but a blessing, indeed! We are limited in space and have reached our capacity. We MUST expand our facilities to educate more children!

In order to continue our mission we must acquire additional property and construct other buildings to accommodate the demanding need that only an Accelerated Christian Education can provide.

With your support, we can accomplish this miraculous but realistic vision. We already acquire the right philosophy of education, the right curriculum, and 23 years of experience. ALL WE NEED NOW IS A CONTRIBUTION FROM YOU!!

PLEASE, HELP PAVE THE WAY 4 HCA and make this EXTENDED vision of expansion become another SUCCESS!!! Our goal of $7M will build a first-class facility that will give us the capability to receive the anticipated growth of those families seeking a higher, more virtuous education for their children...maybe even yours. We must be prepared for this growth. WILL YOU HELP US??!!


Our vision is not limited to a set building or frame, but a belief that what God knows we need will be provided and our structures will be built from those provisions. In order for this to occur, we have set up a three phase plan to break down the use of expenses as goals are reached, as well as help update everyone on the building process.


A wide angle view of our current property and the property we desire to purchase.


In order for us to expand, purchasing land is our first priority. Currently there are three properties that we intend to acquire through this campaign. In phase one, our goal is to acquire one of the targeted pieces of land as well as start renovations on the current building. Our current campus is located in Research Park West in a prestigious business complex with three available adjoining properties.



Our current campus and the adjoining properties we desire to purchase. 


We believe that Biblical based education is something that our community needs. With your contributions, you are making it so that Huntsville Christian Academy can open the door to more students in our community, as well as provide better facilities for our current student body. Each student that comes into our school is afforded a curriculum designed to their needs and focused on Biblical and moral values. It is those values that present and future generations need. We want to make a change in the world and it starts with helping bring up the next generation in the right setting.

When goals are met, we will be able to accommodate more than 500 students. That will quadruple our current enrollment, allowing for more children to receive personalized Christian education.






Our fourth grade student, Paul, giving a prayer for our school.


Pops

February 4, 1920 - June 11, 2013

A World War II veteran hero who was an honorary graduate of our 2007 class.




Are my contributions tax deductible?

All donations to this campaign are fully tax-deductible through Vision Ministries Inc. Huntsville Christian Academy is a registered 501c3. Our EIN/Tax ID # is: 63-1133351.

I can't contribute financially, are there are other ways I can help?

If you cannot financially contribute, please spread the word. Talk to your friends, family, and coworkers and let them know what is going on. Also, feel free to use the Indiegogo share feature at the bottom of the campaign to notify everyone you know on your favorite social media. Also, if you would like to volunteer in any way please email us at hca1994@gmail.com for further information.

How can I find more information about the school?

Feel free to visit our website at gohca.com or email us at hca1994@gmail.com with any questions you may have.

story:
Hi Everyone, We need you!!

We realize there are limited transportation options and we want to be the low cost (like free to start and hope to continue, but in any case will be cheap) leader in getting kids to and from school, afterschool and last minutes. This is based on amazing technology and algorithms in the driver apps and reservation systems. To get this going, we are holding our first campaign.
For our 1st Annual Event, we would like to give:
(2) $2,500 scholarships for college
(4) $1,000 donations to schools in the Evergreen and Silver Creek Area.
(4) $250 donations to schools in the Evergreen and Silver Creek Area.
(4) free awards to take children to and from school for the 2015-2016 academic year.
(1) months of providing free school transportation for all, the more money raised, the longer we can provide a free service.

      KidsCoolRide, LLC was started based on a need to move our kids to and from school. There are always too few and too expensive options like taking a public bus or telling our bosses that we can't be in for that very important meeting because our kids come first only to see us get in trouble later.
That is no longer required. We must say that with a busy lifestyle, it is difficult to get everyone to the correct location and on time. Therefore, an extra pair of hands always comes in handy. We are working to help parents receive a helping hand and our goal is to offer free transportation for 3 months. Also, we intend to raise $2,500 for four schools in the district so that the can have some additional family events this year.
As a contributor, you are making an abundant difference in people's lives by taking the time to help. 
We want to be sure that everyone gets what they need.

How can you help?

Here is the breakdown of what you will receive for your contributions.

We need your help to give four schools in the Evergreen and Silver Creek area 2500 USD each. There are some that are in need of some additional earnings potential and are raising the money for the children's support. 

If we are unable to reach our goal, the funds will be split the funds 50/50 between the students transportation and the four schools.

If you help us, we'll return the favor:

$10 Contributor - Have your name posted on our contributors webpage.

$25 Level I - Have your name posted on our contributors webpage. Receive a company pen.

$50 Level II - Contributor t-shirt and your name posted on our contributors webpage. Receive a free ride.

$100 Level III - Earn a personal thank you letter from the CEO of KidsCoolRide, LLC for the contribution and have their name posted on the contributors website. Contributor t-shirt and their desired name posted on our contributors webpage. Receive a free ride.

$250 Sponsorship Circle - Take a picture with the CEO as well as receive a personal thank you letter. We will display your name, business name and logo reflected on the contributors website. Contributor t-shirt and their desired name posted on our contributors webpage. Receive a free ride.

$500 Silver Circle 

- Receive a personal thank you letter. 
- Specific display of your name, business name and logo reflected on the contributors website.
- Name and Company name printed and distributed on materials for the event.
- Special Silver Circle Polo Shirt Event shirt. 
- Contributor t-shirt and their desired name posted on our contributors webpage.
- Receive 5 free rides.

$1,000 Premier Circle 

- Receive a personal thank you letter. 
- Specific display of your name and logo reflected on the contributors website.
- 1/8 page Name and Company name printed and distributed in company marketing booklet.
- Special Premier Circle Premier Shirt Event shirt. 
- Receive 10 free rides.

$2,500 Gold Circle 

- Receive a personal thank you letter. 
- Specific mention by name and logo on our website as a contributor.
- 1/4 page Name and Company name printed and distributed in company marketing booklet.
- Children's birthday party planning service.
- Name or company name distributed on all marketing materials for six months.
