story:
The Problem

The United States Innovation, Entrepreneurship and Investment Economy lacks #authenticdiversity and inclusion resulting in a loss of economic value and GDP.

  • The Tech Sector Workforce consists of 96% White men. <2% are African or Latinx American.
  • By 2020, there will be one million more computing and coding jobs than computer science students. - Department of Labor
  • Because of past and current discrimination, America is for going 1.1 minority small businesses + 9 million new jobs. - Center for Global Policy Solutions
  • Less than 1% of angel & venture fund investments are invested in African American and Latinx companies. -Kauffman Foundation
  • The average average net worth of an African American and Latinx American family in America is $11,000 and $13,000, respectively. 
     

The Never Ending Challenge 

We’re exhausted from the continued lack of diversity, inclusion, and equity in tech, from start-ups to large tech companies to venture capital firms to the Fortune 500.
 
Breaking news after breaking news.
Blog post after blog post.
White paper after white paper.
False manifesto after manifesto.
Team member exit after exit.

    We're doing the work. You are doing the work. 

    For the most part, it's not getting better. Yet, we grind.
     
    So, to get the traction we desire, we've got to scale some strategic initiatives - together.
     
    Only then will we ensure that the brightest talent on the planet gets an authentic shot at the opportunities that are disrupting generational poverty and creating new multi-generational wealth for a few.


     

    The Plan

    Right now, we are engaged with 41 colleges and universities across America via the 100 students we brought to SXSW in 2017 - specifically because of your support. 90% of these students are working in summer internships or have been hired full time.

    This year, we want to reach our goal of bringing 500 technical and non-technical (go to market, operations, finance) students from at least 100 schools to #HBCUSXSW18.

    Our themes are #DiversitySXSW #AuthenticInclusion. To accomplish this, we're targeting students from Historically Black Colleges & Universities (HBCI's), Hispanic Serving Institutions (HSI's), Tribal Colleges (TC's) and Louis Stokes Alliance for Minority Participation (LSAMP) Predominantly White Institutions (PWI's).

    View our experience deck here.
     

    On The Ground

    HBCUSXSW18 promises to be larger and more engaging than ever. Over the course of one week, college administrators and students will attend official workshops and panels sponsored by partnering tech companies, as well as networking and curated culinary experiences promoting tech careers, startup entrepreneurship and wealth creation. They will also be exposed to highly-respected entrepreneurs, business leaders, technologists of color, and investors from around the world. Past speakers include Founder & CEO of Act-1 Group, Janice Bryant Howroyd, the first African American woman to own a billion-dollar staffing company, John Hope Bryant, Founder & CEO of Operation Hope, Van Jones, Founder & CEO of Dream Corps and #YesWeCode, billionaire Steve Case of AOL and Revolution Fund and techies from Google, MailChimp, Airbnb, Twitter and beyond. A #DiversifySXSW House and #YesWeCodeFund Fundraiser is planned.

     

    The Impact

    • Expose 500 high potential technical and non-technical students to the career opportunities in the innovation, entrepreneurship and investment ecosystem.
    • Educate these students on how to properly engage and 
      navigate the opportunities in these economies.
    • Create an experience that facilitates connections and relationships resulting in immediate summer internships, career opportunities or start-up acceleration.
    • Send the students back to their respective schools so they can create a hyperlocal technology and startup ecosystem on their campus from the ground up.
    • Position the students to work at the best companies to solve the toughest problems to maximize their career and company building potential.

     

    Then, We'll Build Local Campus Ecosystems Everywhere

    It doesn't stop after SXSW. From there, we are empowering these students to launch tech and startup entrepreneurship focused student ecosystems on their respective campus. 

    We call this OHUB@. Via this program, 500 will become 5,000.

    We're also launching the minimum viable product of our ecosystem building app by which students, start-ups, techies, employers, mentors, investors and beyond will be able to match, peer learn, educate themselves, connect with mentors and innovative work spaces, hack, invest and connect with opportunities to create generational wealth in the innovation, entrepreneurship and investment economy.

    Via the app and on the ground experiences, 5,000 will grow into the millions; and by this time next year, we will be rolling out our accredited college textbook & course on African American entrepreneurship, financial services and equity investing platform.

    Imagine these economics.

    When 5,000 students graduate to go to work at tech companies with average starting salaries of $75,000, that’s $375,000,000 annually in new economic value.
     

    Then, The Movement

    Imagine, if these same 5,000 students like Mariah Cowling and Matt Poole begin their journey of wealth creation on day one of their employment. Imagine if these same students set aside money to invest in the ideas and startups they love vetted financial services.

    Imagine if some of these students started companies like Looklive and were able to get investment capital from their colleagues via equity crowdfunding campaigns they launch on our platform.

    This is the future we envision and it starts with getting 500 of our best and brightest to SXSW.

    Ultimately, we're productizing this work for scale and utilizing SXSW, the largest tech festival on the planet, to launch from.

     

      The Economics

      The unit economics of sending one student to SXSW is $3,000. Our mission is to reward 500 students from across the country an opportunity to attend HBCU@SXSW 2018. To this end, we are raising $1,500,000.

       

        Media Exposure

        Click the following links to check out some of #HBCUSXSW17's national media coverage:  USA Today, NBC, Sports Illustrated, ThePlug Daily, LinkedIn, Campus Lately and more. 

         

        Our Ask Of You

        We believe everyone that looks at this campaign can do something. Do what you can and please share this campaign on all of your social media platforms. Your support will shift the direction of these deserving student's careers and lives.

        - Donate something. We've got some amazing perks.
        - Join our influencer host committee
        - Join our student host committee
        - Amplify this campaign to your social networks, alumni groups and employee resource groups
        - Stand in agreement that we will reach our goals

        Thank you in advance for your generosity and support!
story_txt:
The Problem
The United States Innovation, Entrepreneurship and Investment Economy lacks #authenticdiversity and inclusion resulting in a loss of economic value and GDP.

The Tech Sector Workforce consists of 96% White men. <2% are African or Latinx American.
By 2020, there will be one million more computing and coding jobs than computer science students. - Department of Labor

Because of past and current discrimination, America is for going 1.1 minority small businesses + 9 million new jobs. - Center for Global Policy Solutions

Less than 1% of angel & venture fund investments are invested in African American and Latinx companies. -Kauffman Foundation

The average average net worth of an African American and Latinx American family in America is $11,000 and $13,000, respectively.  

The Never Ending Challenge 
We’re exhausted from the continued lack of diversity, inclusion, and equity in tech, from start-ups to large tech companies to venture capital firms to the Fortune 500. Breaking news after breaking news.Blog post after blog post.White paper after white paper.False manifesto after manifesto.Team member exit after exit.

We're doing the work. You are doing the work. For the most part, it's not getting better. Yet, we grind. So, to get the traction we desire, we've got to scale some strategic initiatives - together. Only then will we ensure that the brightest talent on the planet gets an authentic shot at the opportunities that are disrupting generational poverty and creating new multi-generational wealth for a few.
 
The Plan
Right now, we are engaged with 41 colleges and universities across America via the 100 students we brought to SXSW in 2017 - specifically because of your support. 90% of these students are working in summer internships or have been hired full time.
This year, we want to reach our goal of bringing 500 technical and non-technical (go to market, operations, finance) students from at least 100 schools to #HBCUSXSW18.
Our themes are #DiversitySXSW #AuthenticInclusion. To accomplish this, we're targeting students from Historically Black Colleges & Universities (HBCI's), Hispanic Serving Institutions (HSI's), Tribal Colleges (TC's) and Louis Stokes Alliance for Minority Participation (LSAMP) Predominantly White Institutions (PWI's).View our experience deck here. 

On The Ground
HBCUSXSW18 promises to be larger and more engaging than ever. Over the course of one week, college administrators and students will attend official workshops and panels sponsored by partnering tech companies, as well as networking and curated culinary experiences promoting tech careers, startup entrepreneurship and wealth creation. They will also be exposed to highly-respected entrepreneurs, business leaders, technologists of color, and investors from around the world. Past speakers include Founder & CEO of Act-1 Group, Janice Bryant Howroyd, the first African American woman to own a billion-dollar staffing company, John Hope Bryant, Founder & CEO of Operation Hope, Van Jones, Founder & CEO of Dream Corps and #YesWeCode, billionaire Steve Case of AOL and Revolution Fund and techies from Google, MailChimp, Airbnb, Twitter and beyond. A #DiversifySXSW House and #YesWeCodeFund Fundraiser is planned.
 

The Impact


Expose 500 high potential technical and non-technical students to the career opportunities in the innovation, entrepreneurship and investment ecosystem.

Educate these students on how to properly engage and navigate the opportunities in these economies.

Create an experience that facilitates connections and relationships resulting in immediate summer internships, career opportunities or start-up acceleration.

Send the students back to their respective schools so they can create a hyperlocal technology and startup ecosystem on their campus from the ground up.

Position the students to work at the best companies to solve the toughest problems to maximize their career and company building potential.

 
 
Then, We'll Build Local Campus Ecosystems Everywhere
It doesn't stop after SXSW. From there, we are empowering these students to launch tech and startup entrepreneurship focused student ecosystems on their respective campus. 
We call this OHUB@. Via this program, 500 will become 5,000.
We're also launching the minimum viable product of our ecosystem building app by which students, start-ups, techies, employers, mentors, investors and beyond will be able to match, peer learn, educate themselves, connect with mentors and innovative work spaces, hack, invest and connect with opportunities to create generational wealth in the innovation, entrepreneurship and investment economy.
Via the app and on the ground experiences, 5,000 will grow into the millions; and by this time next year, we will be rolling out our accredited college textbook & course on African American entrepreneurship, financial services and equity investing platform.
Imagine these economics.
When 5,000 students graduate to go to work at tech companies with average starting salaries of $75,000, that’s $375,000,000 annually in new economic value. 

Then, The Movement
Imagine, if these same 5,000 students like Mariah Cowling and Matt Poole begin their journey of wealth creation on day one of their employment. Imagine if these same students set aside money to invest in the ideas and startups they love vetted financial services.
Imagine if some of these students started companies like Looklive and were able to get investment capital from their colleagues via equity crowdfunding campaigns they launch on our platform.
This is the future we envision and it starts with getting 500 of our best and brightest to SXSW.
Ultimately, we're productizing this work for scale and utilizing SXSW, the largest tech festival on the planet, to launch from.
 


The Economics
The unit economics of sending one student to SXSW is $3,000. Our mission is to reward 500 students from across the country an opportunity to attend HBCU@SXSW 2018. To this end, we are raising $1,500,000.
 



Media Exposure
Click the following links to check out some of #HBCUSXSW17's national media coverage:  USA Today, NBC, Sports Illustrated, ThePlug Daily, LinkedIn, Campus Lately and more. 
 

Our Ask Of You
We believe everyone that looks at this campaign can do something. Do what you can and please share this campaign on all of your social media platforms. Your support will shift the direction of these deserving student's careers and lives.
- Donate something. We've got some amazing perks.- Join our influencer host committee- Join our student host committee- Amplify this campaign to your social networks, alumni groups and employee resource groups- Stand in agreement that we will reach our goals
Thank you in advance for your generosity and support!

story:
Where does our team see NITWIT Project going?

What is NITWIT Project all about?
NITWIT Project consists of a physical portion and an internet portion. The physical portion is a kit containing a recording journal, six pens, a one-minute sand timer, twenty-one topic/subtopic cards, a member log-in code, an introduction paragraph, instructions and guidelines. Individuals are encouraged to gather for at least one hour per week with a recommended group of 2-6 people using this kit to brainstorm some really great potential business ideas.

The next step would be for the group to utilize the internet portion of NITWIT Project. The unique member log in code provided in the kit allows your group to create a profile on NITWIT Project’s website. Once your profile is created, your group will have access to our efficient 10 question rating scale to rate your product.


When your group has decided on their favorite business idea, they can move on to our resources page, which provides organization and structure with step by step instructions on how to build your business in a time and cost-efficient manner. We also provide preparation on launching an effective crowdfunding campaign.

Where does NITWIT Project fit in to your life and how can it help you?



Why are we here?

We brought NITWIT Project to Indiegogo and the crowdfunding world in hopes to raise money for our product needs, increase awareness, and to test the demand of our product. As a team, we are asking for your financial support to help improve and promote our product. Your money will go towards the structure of the kits, marketing the product more broadly, and providing the ability to open our online store. If we are able to exceed our campaign goal, it will help propel NITWIT Project further towards being marketed internationally, which is our hope.  If you would like to check out our website and sign up for our newsletter please visit www.nitwitproject.com ! Also, feel free to subscribe to our Youtube channel and follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. Thank you so much for taking the time visit our campaign page and consider backing NITWIT Project, we hope that you will believe in the potential of our product as much as we do!

Who is behind this product full of possibilities and how did they get there?



Where did our team begin? How did we get here? Where are we going?

Who loves perks?!


Where do you see NITWIT Project going?

story:
About the project

The PauseFirst Project is a community effort intended to fund meditation and mindfulness training for first responders. We're launching in Metro Kansas City, then taking it on the road. 

 

Where your donations will go:

Your contributions will help underwrite 1) a meditation and mindfulness course and 2) a teacher training certification program, all at no cost to the individuals or their agencies.

If we meet our campaign goal of $32,000, we estimate in 2018 we can provide:

  • 20  4-hour Meditation and Mindfulness Courses
  • 3 Teacher Training Certification Programs

​We can potentially train thousands of first responders in our first year!

 

The PauseFirst curriculum will be overseen by The PauseFirst Team (Advisory Board) and is based on Kim Colegrove's PAUSE15 Meditation and Learn to Pause℠ Meditation & Mindfulness Training.

 

Kim Colegrove

My mission is to demystify meditation and encourage people to use it as a practical, natural way to reduce stress and improve health. I view meditation as a brain training exercise, rooted in common sense and backed by science. I focus on evidence-based benefits, such as:

  • Stress reduction
  • Better brain health
  • Lower blood pressure, and more.

I was trained in Transcendental Meditation in 1976 at the age of 10. Over the years, I developed my own methodologies and created a logical, mainstream approach to meditation, which I began teaching to others. Since 2011, I've taught meditation and mindfulness full-time, primarily in corporate settings. Now, I’m turning my full attention to first responders.

Why am I committed to working with first responders?

Thanksgiving weekend, 2014

I had just finished hanging Christmas lights. Dinner was on the stove. Someone knocked, and as I walked toward the door, I could see a uniformed officer standing on my front porch. 

It's impossible to explain the feelings that engulf you when you get that kind of news. Less than three months after retiring from a 30-year law enforcement career, my husband, Special Agent David Colegrove, had driven to the back of our neighborhood and shot himself. That single shot impacted everyone who knew David, and the waves of impact will echo forever.

David M. Colegrove, Special Agent, Retired (1963-2014)

The distance, time and space between me and that life-altering day have given rise to a realization about the people who responded to that call.

Looking back, I realize how horrible it must have been for the officer who came to my house, and the detective who accompanied him, and the off-duty firefighter who found my husband in his truck, and all the others who responded to the call — the first responders. 

I realize this because my husband did that work. Prior to becoming a federal investigator, he was a cop for eight years. He went on horrific calls, he processed crime scenes, and he witnessed things so heinous he wouldn't speak of them. They all do.  And it takes a toll.

Did the job kill my husband? No. Was it a contributor? Absolutely.

So, if there's something I can do to help first responders manage their stress and find a bit of relief from this taxing and traumatic way of life, I want to do it. I have to do it. As a tribute to my husband and a thank you to these great people, I want to help. 

David and Kim Colegrove

____________________________________________________________________

How Meditation & Mindfulness

Can Help First Responders

 

Evidence-Based Health Benefits of Meditation and Mindfulness

By Jennifer Sweeton, Psy.D.

Mindfulness practices, including meditation, have been shown to produce dramatic improvements in well-being and brain functioning. These practices have also been associated with reduced mental illness-related conditions such as anxiety, depression, post-trauma sequelae, and substance abuse. Here are just a few findings from scientific studies on mindfulness: 

  • Reduced "stress response" in the body (called sympathetic nervous system activation), resulting in less inflammation, immune system suppression, chronic muscle tension, gastrointestinal issues (such as ulcers), cardiovascular reactivity, and blood pressure. Mindfulness even reduces common colds :). 
  • Improved memory, due to activation of the "memory center" of the brain (called the hippocampus). Some evidence even suggests that meditation leads to the development of brand new neurons in this area of the brain, referred to as "neurogenesis"!
  • Better sleep.
  • Less compulsive self-soothing behaviors such as alcohol or drug use. Those skilled in mindfulness are able to regulate their emotions, thus, there is less of a need to turn to substances to cope. 
  • Improved self-awareness and compassion for themselves and others, as well as a strengthened sense of connectedness to loved ones.
  • Less burnout as a result of chronic stress. 
  • Reduced activity in the "fear center" of the brain (called the amygdala), which allows for more clear thinking and good decision making through activation of the "thinking and self-regulation centers" of the brain (including multiple areas of the prefrontal cortex, and the dorsal anterior cingulate cortex).
  • Improved intuition and connection to "gut feelings" through activation of key brain areas such as the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (which helps you stay aware of things and people outside of yourself) and the insula (which helps you connect to subtle internal cues signaling danger or a sense that something is not right). 
  • Reduced hyper-reactivity and increased presence of mind during stressful situations. When those who engage in a regular mindfulness practice feel stressed, they don't become overwhelmed or "hijacked" by the stress. Instead, these individuals are able to think clearly and use their stress response  adaptively, to help them make the best decision possible, even when split-second decisions are required.

Dr. Jennifer Sweeton is a licensed clinical psychologist and internationally-recognized expert on anxiety, trauma, and the neuroscience of mental health, and a member of the PauseFirst Advisory Board. Read more about Dr. Sweeton in the PauseFirst Team Section.

 

The PauseFirst Team

A Meditation Expert

A Veteran First Responder

Seasoned Mental Health Professionals

 

Kim Colegrove, Organizer

Creator of Learn to Pause℠ Mindfulness Training and PAUSE15 Meditation,

40-Year Meditation Veteran

 

Major Darren Ivey, KCPD

Major Darren Ivey was appointed to the Kansas City, Missouri Police Department in September 1992.  He was promoted to Sergeant in October 2000, Captain in September 2012 and Major in April 2017. Prior to becoming a Police Officer, Major Ivey was a proud member of the United States Air Force (1983-1992). He has a Bachelor’s of Science Degree in Criminal Justice Administration from Park University where he graduated Summa Cum Laude.

Major Ivey has been the Department’s Crisis Intervention Team (CIT) Commander since 2012.  It was in this assignment that Captain Ivey began seeing just how many first responders and military members (active/retired) are affected by trauma/secondary trauma and stress. To this end, in partnership with Truman Medical Center’s Behavioral Health, Ivey led a team that developed and teaches a four hour block of training called “Building Resilience:  Surviving Secondary Trauma.”  This training helps address the occupational risks for secondary trauma and acute stress in first responders (as well as military) and allied civilian support staff. 

He also holds a Basic, Advanced, Youth, and Veteran CIT Certification as well as a Basic and Advanced Certification in Advanced Behavioral Studies. Additionally, he is the Co-Chair of the Mid-America CIT Council, Co-Chair of the Justice Committee of the Resilient KC Initiative; is a team member of the Code 9 Project and sits on the Board of Directors for the Campaign for Trauma Informed Policy and Practice (CTIPP), CIT International, Yoga for First Responders, and Healing Pathways.

 

Dr. Jennifer Sweeton

Dr. Jennifer Sweeton is a licensed clinical psychologist and internationally-recognized expert on anxiety, trauma, and the neuroscience of mental health. She completed her doctoral training at the Stanford University School of Medicine, the Pacific Graduate School of Psychology, and the National Center for PTSD. Additionally, she holds a master's degree in affective neuroscience from Stanford University, and studied behavioral genetics at Harvard University. Before starting her own practice, Dr. Sweeton worked as a clinical psychologist and combat stress recovery expert at the Oklahoma City VA Medical Center, and also as the director of behavioral health at Indian Health Service in Clinton, OK. 

Dr. Sweeton currently resides in the greater Kansas City area, where she owns a group private practice, Kansas City Mental Health Associates. She formerly served as the President of the Oklahoma Psychological Association, and holds adjunct faculty appointments at the University of Kansas School of Medicine and the University of Oklahoma Health Sciences Center. Dr. Sweeton offers psychological services services to clients in Oklahoma, Kansas, and internationally, and is a sought-after trauma and neuroscience expert who has trained thousands of mental health professionals in her workshops.

 

Susan Rome, LSCSW

Susan Rome is the Deputy Director at Johnson County Mental Health Center (Johnson County, KS - Greater Kanas City area) where she has worked for 24 years.  She is an advocate for persons with mental illness and works to reduce stigma, while emphasizing community needs for behavioral health treatment. Susan has a special interest in self-care and reducing secondary trauma for those in the helping professions, which she promotes through training with law enforcement and other emergency responders. She is a founding member of the Kansas Law Enforcement CIT Council and the Coordinator for Johnson County Critical Incident Stress Management Team.  She graduated with a BA in Psychology from Wichita State University and a Masters in Social Work from the University of Kansas. 

_______________________________

From all of us at The PauseFirst Project:

Thank you for your support.

You are making a difference in the lives of first responders.

story:
Brian grew up in martial arts since he was 4 years old. While growing up in martial arts, he was taught that Kindness was the ultimate form of self-defense, that if you are nice to every single person you meet, you should never have to use your martial arts. Fast forward 22 years, at the age of 26, Brian founded Think Kindness, a non-profit organization dedicated to inspire kindness in schools around the world.

Brian now travels the country and has spoken to over 400,000 students, sparking massive tidal waves of kindness within each school he visits. In order to be successful, Brian had to find a creative way to ‘Make Kindness Cool’ and to inspire every student to choose kindness . . . on their own!

That’s when the Kindness Ninja was born.

Every child LOVES to be the hero of their dreams. Its impossible to fly like superman, shoot webs like Spiderman, but every child can assume the identity of a KINDNESS NINJA. One that seeks out ways to carry-out kind deeds for their siblings, family, friends, teachers and complete strangers.

A Kindness Ninja is an elite ninja warrior that carries out acts of kindness in broad daylight without getting caught.

Kindness Ninja boxes is a box that get shipped quarterly to your door. It is packed with creative, engaging and fun kindness challenges for kids to carry out at home, school or throughout the community.

Each box contains 4 challenges that must be carried out ‘ninja-style’. . . aka, without getting caught. 

 

 

EXAMPLE BOX ITEMS

CHECK US OUT ON THE NEWS!

To make kindness fun, we thought of strategies that tap into their creativity and imagination. Every child has a passion to make a difference in the world. That's why they want to be super heroes, doctors, or firefighters. Kindness Ninja Boxes let them use their imagination and then take action. Each Kindness Ninja gets to witness the impact of their kind deeds. They witness the smiles, laughter and the ripple they create. By seeing their acts of kindness go full circle, they are inspired to do more. They are inspired to impact more people and spread more kindness.

 

When will the boxes ship?
Boxes will ship in June, Sept, December & March respectively. 

What is inside each box?
Each box contains 4 kindness challenges plus an awesome gift for your child. 

Are there only 4 boxes?
No. There will be 8 boxes total. Each box represents 1 belt rank of their Kindness Ninja status. Once they complete all 8 boxes, they will become an official Kindness Ninja. 

What happens if you don't reach your goal?
No matter what, we promise Kindness Ninja boxes will ship. We have already produced box #1 and box #2 is on its way. So even if we fall short of our goal, your child can still become a Kindness Ninja!!

We have two kids, do we need to order two boxes?
They can share a box, however, within each box there is only 1 gift. (i.e. t-shirt). In the future we plan on rolling out sibling edition boxes, but that is not something we have available at this time. 

I'm a teacher in a school, can I do this in my class? 
Yes, 100%. We actually have classroom edition boxes and book sets. 

Do you ship to Canada? 
Yes, of course! We can't leave our Canadian Kindness Ninja's out!!!
story_txt:
Brian grew up in martial arts since he was 4 years old. While growing up in martial arts, he was taught that Kindness was the ultimate form of self-defense, that if you are nice to every single person you meet, you should never have to use your martial arts. Fast forward 22 years, at the age of 26, Brian founded Think Kindness, a non-profit organization dedicated to inspire kindness in schools around the world.Brian now travels the country and has spoken to over 400,000 students, sparking massive tidal waves of kindness within each school he visits. In order to be successful, Brian had to find a creative way to ‘Make Kindness Cool’ and to inspire every student to choose kindness . . . on their own!That’s when the Kindness Ninja was born.Every child LOVES to be the hero of their dreams. Its impossible to fly like superman, shoot webs like Spiderman, but every child can assume the identity of a KINDNESS NINJA. One that seeks out ways to carry-out kind deeds for their siblings, family, friends, teachers and complete strangers.A Kindness Ninja is an elite ninja warrior that carries out acts of kindness in broad daylight without getting caught.Kindness Ninja boxes is a box that get shipped quarterly to your door. It is packed with creative, engaging and fun kindness challenges for kids to carry out at home, school or throughout the community.Each box contains 4 challenges that must be carried out ‘ninja-style’. . . aka, without getting caught. 
 
 
EXAMPLE BOX ITEMSCHECK US OUT ON THE NEWS!To make kindness fun, we thought of strategies that tap into their creativity and imagination. Every child has a passion to make a difference in the world. That's why they want to be super heroes, doctors, or firefighters. Kindness Ninja Boxes let them use their imagination and then take action. Each Kindness Ninja gets to witness the impact of their kind deeds. They witness the smiles, laughter and the ripple they create. By seeing their acts of kindness go full circle, they are inspired to do more. They are inspired to impact more people and spread more kindness. When will the boxes ship?Boxes will ship in June, Sept, December & March respectively. What is inside each box?Each box contains 4 kindness challenges plus an awesome gift for your child. Are there only 4 boxes?No. There will be 8 boxes total. Each box represents 1 belt rank of their Kindness Ninja status. Once they complete all 8 boxes, they will become an official Kindness Ninja. What happens if you don't reach your goal?No matter what, we promise Kindness Ninja boxes will ship. We have already produced box #1 and box #2 is on its way. So even if we fall short of our goal, your child can still become a Kindness Ninja!!We have two kids, do we need to order two boxes?They can share a box, however, within each box there is only 1 gift. (i.e. t-shirt). In the future we plan on rolling out sibling edition boxes, but that is not something we have available at this time. I'm a teacher in a school, can I do this in my class? Yes, 100%. We actually have classroom edition boxes and book sets. Do you ship to Canada? Yes, of course! We can't leave our Canadian Kindness Ninja's out!!!

story:
Purpose

If you want better relationships, Relate Theatre uses audience participation, interuption and intervention, with a couple-therapist‘s advice, which gives you a rainbow of options for approaching tricky situations in new ways. You get to stay grounded, whole, creative and resourceful.

Not only that but watching with your partner will help you see and listen to each other better. Imagine the dinner conversation afterwards, spiced with insights and daring new flavours.

Plus, did we mention this is theatre?  It’s a great piece of entertainment too!

The team 

We are a multidisciplinary company of great actors, a director, social media and stage technicians, plus couples-therapists to "keep it real".

Skilled in staging improvised drama, working with audience interventions, sometimes with members of the audience (“spectactors”) on stage and taking direction in the moment from the therapists, we look forwards to meeting you at Relate Theatre.

See us here on one of our training days:

.

One relationship situation, many ways to play it

Each Relate Theatre performance focuses on a difficult relationship situation, which forms the theme of the show. The actors play it out and it can get messy.

The scene is then replayed but differently. Then it is replayed again and again with different words, actions, attititudes. The audience or the therapist can “STOP” the action at any point and make a change. When the differences come from an audience member, perhaps they will show what they mean by coming onto the stage.

In Relate Theatre all interventions are useful and welcome. The results surprise, entertain and equip the audience in ways never expected.

Here are some sample scenes for you to enjoy:

 

 

Relate Hub, our exciting new offering

 

Becoming a member in this hub is a one time payment, that gives you 

  1. Possibiliy to choose direction of shows - what to focus on next.
  2. Choice of themes to be play out
  3. Access to expert intervjus like how to deal with step-familiy situations, sexual issues, shame etc. 
  4. Forum to connect with other people who want to deepen their understanding of how to deal with life difficulties. 

 

What you will gain - perks

Any donation will help us help. We aim to show our performance to as many as possible to empower you to make better life decisions.  If you want to make a contribution we offer you the following perks:

EUR 5                Good karma 

EUR 25              Your personal picture from stage signed by a member of the cast

EUR 50              Free entrance to a show 

EUR 75               Free entrance to a show and ability to vote for a case

EUR 100             Meet and greet with any one of the cast (online)

EUR 150              Membership in Relate Hub (the price will go up)

EUR 200             You provide your story and we will act it out anonymously (only 20 cases available)

 

Relate Theatre will play out your story and get insight from the audience and our relationship therapist on how this can be approached. This will be done anonymously so you get a unique insight  without you  being present. 

 

How we will use the money

Relate Theatre will invest in live-streaming and recording for social media, which means gear and staff. Also we shall turn Relate Hub from a concept to a thriving online community. Thirdly operating costs will be met partly from your contributions and performance sales.

 

Other ways you can help

 
  1. Share this campaign on your social media platform with great friends
  2. Leave your e-mail address on www.relatetheatre.com to receive updates on themes   being played out next.
  3. Like our facebook page Relate Theatre.

story:
Alternative perks

  • Upskilling (Online) + VIP is the online version of our upskilling program + a ticket to an exclusive event near you, where you can be first to hear leading tech vendors showcase their use-cases for Data Analytics and RPA being successfully used in business today
  • Digital Audit for small business and corporate management wanting to understand how Data Analytics and RPA are high-ROI opportunities to drive growth, efficiency and innovation in their business today
  • Merchandise available for those wishing to support development of digital skills in the workforce today
 

WHY THE DATA ANALYTICS & RPA SKILLSETS ARE SO IMPORTANT TODAY

Over the past 18 months, we have validated key technical skills from employers that are in high-demand today, with Data Analytics and Robotic Process Automation on top of that list.  As a backer, you will be upskilled in both these areas, so you can work confidently with data for and automate the non-value adding parts of your job.

 

  

         

 

HOW WILL THE UPSKILLING PROGRAM WORK?

Unlike a training course, our Digital Upskilling Program will be tailored towards individuals or teams to accelerate learning, will be experiential by design and will largely focus on experimenting with new technology and infrastructure in a controlled environment.  We do all this through a 3-stage Learning model that provides an accelerated and efficient learning experience.

 

Learn more about what experience you can expect from the Digital Upskilling Program below [4mins]

 

 
 

HOW WE PLAN TO ALLOCATE THE FUNDS RAISED

 

 

WHEN YOU WILL RECEIVE YOUR PERKS

  • Digital Upskilling Programs - 4 to 6 months from the campaign ending
  • Digital Audits - Available to schedule from 30 days after the campaign ends
  • Merchandise - 30 to 90 days from the campaign ending

 

WHAT OTHERS HAVE TO SAY

An engineering manager from the Mining industry discusses the challenges he faces around lead times for roles requiring new technical skills.  Learn more...

Graduates discuss their experiences participating in the earlier versions of a Data Engineering Digital Upskilling Program and challenges finding a job.  Learn more...

A career coaching consultant shares the technical trends he is seeing in the labour market today.  Learn more...

A recruiter shares his experience around the competitiveness of the labour market for data analytics and process automation skillsets.  Learn more...

 

ABOUT US

We're two Australian innovators looking to make a difference.

Data Engineering was founded in 2016 by Aaron and Kelechi, friends from university.  Based in Perth, Western Australia, we provide consulting and professional services to small business and corporate management.  Our solutions are tailored towards business operations and asset management where we provide data analytics, RPA and software development services to drive growth, efficiency and innovation in business today.

Over the past 2.5 years in business, we have provided consulting and professional services to clients in the Mining, Healthcare and Education industries.  We consider ourselves one of the few to actually understand what digital transformation means for business and have witnessed first hand how the workforce of today is lacking the digital skills to deliver the demands of business today.  We're now playing our part to bridge this digital skills gap through our Digital Upskilling Program.

story:
We have a problem:

The Diagnosis of ADHD and the medication of our children is at epidemic proportions - not just in the U.S., but increasingly around the world.

But the push to diagnose and medicate has not been matched with the need for caution. There are fundamental flaws in the way ADHD is often diagnosed and, as licensed mental health clinicians, we see the consequences over and over again: children labelled as ADHD and medicated incorrectly - permanently impacting their childhood. 

Because it's not about whether you can be diagnosed with ADHD - it's whether you should be: There are many issues that look like ADHD, but have very different underlying causes. 

 And while most people go to their family doctor for answers, family doctors often don't have time to ask the questions that need to be asked - and most parents don't know what to ask them. 

Even more extraordinary: In the age of the Internet (and Indiegogo), most psychological testing is still done with paper and pencil tests!

The Solution

COAST: the collaboration of licensed mental health providers, family doctors and other clinicians to produce a screening test to help identify the issues often mistaken for ADHD. 

The product of years of clinical experience, and the latest in database design, COAST is a radically new tool: The true collaboration of experts to produce a test that links issues dynamically, just as they are in real life, and which evolves and improves as more people take it. 

The result is real feedback that identifies issues, not diagnoses; that shows how different factors, often overlooked, interact in the real world to affect performance and behavior. 

The result is feedback that broadens the conversation, educates and empowers, and offers practical guidelines for improvement. 

The goal of COAST is not to diagnose, but to prevent misdiagnosis: To push back against the tidal wave of diagnosis and medication by sharing our knowledge, empowering people to better help their children, and themselves. 

COAST is available in 3 versions: Child 5 to 12, Adolescent 13 to 16, and Adult 

We Need Your Support 

Unlike traditional tests that work from a fixed database, the COAST database is intelligent and organic, growing in statistical validity with each test taker. 

We need you to take the test about yourself, your children, and to give the test to others so they can do the same. 

The more data we have from people around the world, the more intelligent and predictive COAST becomes - giving people unparalleled feedback, whoever they are, and wherever they live. (Importantly, we've designed the database so that all data is anonymous, with personal information stored separately and test results de-identified for you protection.)

We need you to help build COAST by collaborating with us and taking the test. 

To fight a tidal wave takes resources, and we know who we're up against. We plan on translating COAST and offering it all over the world, with a global marketing campaign. 

We've been working on COAST in our free time for years, while spending our days in clinical practice. As COAST grows, we'll need to hire programmers, full time psychologists, researchers and statisticians. We hope to have our hands full managing the data we receive and making COAST a truly extraordinary resource.

Help us turn to back the tide: Support COAST.  

Risks and challenges

We believe that the greatest risk is doing nothing. There is a real and urgent need for this product - for information to be shared, not protected.

We understand that the marketing and medication of ADHD is big business - we know what we're up against. But we're not trying to fight the diagnosis and treatment of ADHD, but rather its misdiagnosis.

Hopefully we've created a screening test that everyone will agree is timely and important.

Lastly, we'd like to reiterate the design and intention behind COAST:

COAST is not intended as a diagnostic tool for the diagnosis of ADHD. Rather, it's a screening tool to help avoid the misdiagnosis of ADHD - a data resource to analyze and inform.

Common Questions:

Q: When can I take the screening test?

A: As soon as the IndieGOGO funding period is over, we will begin the process of emailing links for the test (or packages of tests). Obviously this timing will depend on the response we receive. We're hoping for a spectacular response, so please bear with us.

Q: When will I get the test results?

A: We expect to release results within a few weeks of you taking the test (sooner if we can).

In the future, the results of COAST will be available as soon as the test is completed. At this stage however, we’re doing something different. We’re looking to the IndieGOGO community because we’re looking to build an unprecedented database of human behavior, and to raise the funds necessary for a project of this size.

We’re hoping your response will provide us with a significant amount of information from around the world, so we’ll need time to analyze the data according to the differences that make this project so unique and important.

story:
I will be running on September 27th 2015 - I'm hoping to raise enough money to fund the flights and accommodation for this trip in January 2016, as well as raising money to support the local Thai community that I will be staying in. I wish to raise extra money to buy gifts and useful resources for the children too!

Half of the donations will also be going towards a cancer charity so that your support will make a difference in two ways; firstly by helping me to personally make a difference to these children's lives and secondly by helping a larger organisation to aid people all around the world who are affected by cancer.

Your donations and your support will make a huge difference to me and more importantly to the charity and the children. Any donation, small or large, will be extremely appreciated. 

Thanks

Dylan

story:
When Megs' son went through speech therapy, he got support from many people but it was disconnected and lead to inconsistencies in care for her son causing to him not make much progress. 

Meg's son isn't alone, nearly 10 million children in the US (90 million children globally) who have special health needs don't get the adequate and consistent support they need to achieve their goals due to limited visibility and collaboration between the adults in their lives. 

Even with the current advances in technology NOT A SINGLE APPLICATION EXISTS to help these adults. 

We are changing this! Our app gets everyone on the same page so they can all provide consistent support to the child.

So, Grab this chance to make a difference... and pick from some of our perks! (have suggestion on perks? post it in the comments)

The contributions will go into:

1. Execute marketing campaigns to increase users

2. Customer Research for features to test usability to ensure we are making things that are easy to use.

See product images in 'Gallery' section of this campaign. Also, if you are interested in the beta - sign up here: http://bit.ly/1D17CXq

story:
Our company was founded in October of 2014 when Co-Founders Coach Tony Brace and Deryl “Bam” Brown where talking about how Hip-Hop culture has influenced their lives and the impact it’s now having on the youth. Tony and Deryl set a goal to create a media company that emphasizes positivity and success, especially in the areas of business, entrepreneurship, sales, and technology. Tony, Deryl,  Philippe "Masta Phi" Tondereau, and Audi aka "Millz" see an abundance of Hip-Hop media that only gossips about celebrity lifestyles. Fed up with the repetitive and weak content, they did something different and started to execute what ideas they had in their minds and created hiphopsuccess.tv.

Help Build a Media Network that shares Honest, Positive, and Authentic Content from a Hip-Hop State of Mind.

Hiphopsuccess.tv’s mission is to motivate and encourage the Hip-Hop community with positive content.

We are growing a media network that showcases diverse content and voices that are in the process of doing something great!


GOAL: Preserve the Culture…

Hip-Hop culture formed during the early 1970's when block parties were more popular in New York City, predominantly among the African-American and Latino youth residing in the Bronx.

Hip-Hop Culture consists of 5 main elements: Rapping, DJing, Break Dancing, Graffiti Writing, and Knowledge Attainment. There were other elements as well such as beat boxing, rap battling, music sampling, and street fashion.


Since the globalization of Hip-Hop music, the culture continues to grow, and represent an energy of empowerment and dream achievement.

But some powerful companies in Hip-Hop push a negative agenda to hurt the culture and the people who are the originators of the culture.

These forces want to push a violent lifestyle that reflects stereotypical images of a thug, drug dealer, and stripper.

The agenda pushes a mad, turn-up, out of control people that are criminal and dumb.

Media powers even promote kingpin “pretend rappers” who copy movie characters or actual real life gangsters to portray. These rappers are selected to be the poster children for selling the lifestyle of death and destruction.

But hiphopsuccess.tv is here to change things - and you can help…

Hiphopsuccess.tv’s vision is to be the number #1 source for positive and informative content within the Hip-Hop community. We plan to help launch independent artists, filmmakers, and content creators that want to make a positive difference in the culture and the world.

We need to keep the movement and company growing, so we need your help. 

You can help by spreading the word.

You can help out by sharing our Indiegogo campaign all over social media, email, and text messaging with your friends and family that you believe will be happy to help YOU build this community!

With the money that we raise – we plan on hiring two part time social media specialists, paying for promotions on our Facebook page, spending funds on internet PR, covering the 2016 political campaign, and donating 10% of the funds to Executive Prep Academy of Finance - they are a public charter high school in Los Angeles, CA —founded in 2013 and servicing low-income and minority students.

Hiphopsuccess.tv is more than a media platform– we are a global movement. We know you believe in the power of independent minds and voices to change our world and this is your opportunity to get involved NOW!

Here's what we need & what you get:

Our goal is to raise $50,000 to cover the cost of business growth for the next 12 months.

Up until this point, the founders of hiphopsuccess.tv have spent thousands of hours and thousands of dollars to bring the company to where it is now. The funds we raise crowdfunding will continue our growth plan.

For those of you that support. We’ll be sending you thank you’s and shout outs on our website and social media platforms. You will also get individual perks and gifts for your special investment contributions to the company.
story_txt:
Our company
was founded in October of 2014 when Co-Founders Coach Tony Brace and Deryl
“Bam” Brown where talking about how Hip-Hop culture has influenced their lives
and the impact it’s now having on the youth. Tony and Deryl set a goal to
create a media company that emphasizes positivity and success, especially in the areas
of business, entrepreneurship, sales, and technology. Tony, Deryl,  Philippe "Masta Phi" Tondereau, and Audi aka "Millz" see an
abundance of Hip-Hop media that only gossips about celebrity lifestyles. Fed up with
the repetitive and weak content, they did something different and started to
execute what ideas they had in their minds and created hiphopsuccess.tv. 
Help Build a
Media Network that shares Honest, Positive, and Authentic Content from a Hip-Hop State of Mind.
Hiphopsuccess.tv’s
mission is to motivate and encourage the Hip-Hop community with positive
content. 
We are growing
a media network that showcases diverse content and voices that are in the
process of doing something great!




GOAL: Preserve
the Culture…
Hip-Hop culture formed during the early 1970's when block parties were more popular in
New York City, predominantly among the African-American and Latino youth residing
in the Bronx.
Hip-Hop Culture consists of 5 main elements: Rapping, DJing, Break Dancing, Graffiti
Writing, and Knowledge Attainment. There were other elements as well such as
beat boxing, rap battling, music sampling, and street fashion. 



Since the
globalization of Hip-Hop music, the culture continues to grow, and represent an
energy of empowerment and dream achievement.
But some
powerful companies in Hip-Hop push a negative agenda to hurt the culture and
the people who are the originators of the culture.
These forces
want to push a violent lifestyle that reflects stereotypical images of a thug,
drug dealer, and stripper.
The agenda
pushes a mad, turn-up, out of control people that are criminal and dumb.
Media powers
even promote kingpin “pretend rappers” who copy movie characters or actual real
life gangsters to portray. These rappers are selected to be the poster children
for selling the lifestyle of death and destruction.
But
hiphopsuccess.tv is here to change things - and you can help…
Hiphopsuccess.tv’s
vision is to be the number #1 source for positive and informative content
within the Hip-Hop community. We plan to help launch independent artists,
filmmakers, and content creators that want to make a positive difference in the culture
and the world.
We need to
keep the movement and company growing, so we need your help.  
You can help
by spreading the word. 
You can help
out by sharing our Indiegogo campaign all over social media, email, and text messaging with your friends and family that you believe will be happy to help YOU build this community!
With the money
that we raise – we plan on hiring two part time social media specialists, paying for promotions on our Facebook page, spending funds on internet PR,
covering the 2016 political campaign, and donating 10% of the funds to
Executive Prep Academy of Finance - they are a public charter high school in
Los Angeles, CA —founded in 2013 and servicing low-income and minority
students.
Hiphopsuccess.tv
is more than a media platform– we are a global movement. We know you believe in the
power of independent minds and voices to change our world and this is your
opportunity to get involved NOW!
Here's what we need & what you get:
Our goal is to raise $50,000 to cover the cost of business growth for the
next 12 months. 
Up until this point, the founders of hiphopsuccess.tv have spent thousands
of hours and thousands of dollars to bring the company to where it is now. The
funds we raise crowdfunding will continue our growth plan.
For those of you that support. We’ll be sending you thank you’s and shout
outs on our website and social media platforms. You will also get individual perks and
gifts for your special investment contributions to the company.

story:
MISSION

Under the musical direction of Richard Dye and Alexander Anderson, the AfroXchange plans to perform, teach, study, and learn on a cultural exchange trip in Eastern Africa. The group will be leaving from Boston, MA traveling to Kenya, Uganda, and Rwanda from 7/2/2016-7/27/2016. The AfroXchange is comprised of Dokun Oke, Alex Gasser, Richard Dye, Alexander Anderson, VanDarrel Woods, and Ayinde Webb.  All of the members have studied, or are currently studying at Berklee College of Music in Boston, MA. We come from United States, Puerto Rico, the Caribbean, and Nigeria. These musicians represent different cultural aspects of the African diaspora. This trip is important to the members of the AfroXchange because it allows us to reconnect lost ties to Africa, and research the influences of African cultures and music on American music. In addition to studying and learning from various cultures in Eastern Africa, we will also be performing, teaching clinics/workshops, and documenting our experience. 

BUDGET

In order to make this trip possible, the AfroXchange requires:

  • Five round trip tickets from Boston, MA to Nairobi, Kenya ~ $7,000
  • Six visas covering Eastern Africa ~ $900 ($150 per person)
  • Lodging in Kenya, Uganda, and Rwanda for three weeks ~ $3,000
  • Transportation throughout Eastern Africa ~ $TBD
For this fundraising campaign, we are primarily concerned with raising the cost of the plane tickets ($7,000) to ensure that all the members of the AfroXchange are able to be there for the trip. 

The Impact

We have an amazing opportunity to work with the organization Global Youth Groove (http://globalyouthgroove.org), which is a non-profit organization that provides music education to the youth in Kenya. We will be joined by a team of music therapists from Berklee College of Music, and will be also assisting them at hospitals and wherever needed in Kenya. We also hope to perform at the U.S. Embassy in Nairobi, Kenya and at the Kigali Up music festival in Rwanda on the 24th  of July. 

Risks & Challenges

We are connected to an amazing team of artists, musicians, and organizers in Kenya, Uganda and Rwanda, so our challenge is not in finding opportunity. Our main challenge, is meeting the finances required to have the trip go successfully. The expenses are high, and we as college students are unable to meet all the costs of the trip. This is why we need support from our school, government, and community. 

How You Can Help?

We understand that not everyone is able to support us with monetary donations, but there may be other ways you can help us meet our goal. 

  • SHARE with friends!! Use information on our website: www.afroxchangemusic.com
  • Tell your friends and family about our research trip.
  • Buy our music: https://afroxchange.bandcamp.com/releases Proceeds will all go toward the AfroxChange campaign 

Thanks for your time, and your interest in our project!

story:
Bon Zanmi!

Thank you for visiting our page! My name is Kenel Pierre and I am the founder of Jaden PepLa, "the people's garden." A couple years ago, after the generous contribution of my friends I was able to purchase 3 acres of land in Mirebalais, which will produce nutritious products, including moringa peanut butter, and eventually become a farm and learning center for Hatians in the Central Plateau and visitors. 

Jaden PepLa has made a lot of progress the past two years. This summer, we harvested over 500lbs, of which ¾ of the products were given to people around Mirebalais to feed their family, with ¼ saved for seeds for next year. We also were able to harvest peanuts and have taken the next steps to bring our organization to the next level by launching an online presence and formalizing ourself as a 501(c)3 in the state of Oregon. 

In the future, we are planning to mix peanuts with Moringa(Doliv) to make a nutritious peanut butter that can help a lot with pregnant women and babies.

But we need your help to take the next steps!

Our campaign: 

For those of you who know me, I started the farmhouse last September and was not able to finish it just yet because I had to come to USA to help my wife with our son Calvin. I have been here around Bend, Oregon for last 7 months.

I am planning to go back to Haiti mid-November this year to work on the farm and do more training in the community.

We are raising funds for two primary reasons.

1)  To complete the farmhouse. By doing so, we will have a place to store leftovers of produce and have a place to stay when we are working. This will also be the future home to host farmers that we will teach. 

2) We would like to help some poor farmers get some seeds to start their own garden spot after being training at Jaden PèpLa. In Haiti, many people want to have their own vegetables garden but can’t afford the seeds or and may can't even find a place that offers them.  We can address this problem! 

The Impact 

We are raising $12,000 to 

1) put a roof on the farmhouse 

2) install the floor, a toilet, and the kitchen 

3) to buy seed for the local farmers

4) payment + food and drinks for workers

And finally, for other infrastructure needs to begin processing and harvesting crops, including the moringa trees. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate right now, there are many other ways you and support us, including sending seeds or sharing our information with your social network. 

Mesi zanmi!

story:
Who are we?

We are a group of technical startups, makerspaces and coworking spaces, who have worked closely with Zone makerspace for the past 3 years.

What is this campaign for?

Because Zone "one of the most important makerspaces in Egypt" caught on fire and had total loss of all its equipments and tools, and due to the part Zone played in the last three and a half years in the life of engineering students and startups in Cairo, we have decided to payback the debt by starting this crowdfunding campaign.

What do we want?

We want to help Zone to start over again and continue playing its role as before.

What is Zone Makerspace?

Zone is an inspiring coworking space and makerspace for engineering students in downtown Cairo, where lots of engineering events and workshops are held to enhance and shape the practical experience of the students, and moreover startups which works in digital fabrication and more.

What are Zone services?

  • Advanced Electronic Lab
  • High-tech and conventional tools equipment
  • Prototyping Services
  • 3D printing
  • Laser cutting
  • Co-working
  • Technical Workshops and events
  • Design and technical support services
  • Hosting Projects & Graduation projects

What are they needing to get back on their feet?

Why should you contribute?

Zone has works directly with students so they have a practical experience aside from theoretical one the have at collage. Zone has been working for more than 3 years now back to back with engineering students and the results are as follows:

All rewards are offered by :

 

*FabLab Egypt
FB page: https://www.facebook.com/fablab.egypt/

*Integreight
FB page:https://www.facebook.com/Integreight

*Qafeer Makerspace
FB page: https://www.facebook.com/qafeermakerspace

*Karakeeb
FB page: https://www.facebook.com/karakeeb.co/

*Fapreca
FB page:https://www.facebook.com/Fapreca/

*Flinc
FB page: https://www.facebook.com/fablabnewcairo

You can choose one of the above spaces to use your voucher

 

If you can't BACK IT, you still can support the campaign through one of the following options:

  • Share the campaign video and encourage other people to support.
  • Post on any social media site you are part of about the space and this effort.  The more people talking about it the better.
  • Tell a friend who might be interested in contributing. Tell them why you feel the space is important.

Thank you!

story:
1 in 2 women living in rural areas have been physically abused by their spouses 


20% of elderly women are abandoned by their families and lack access to proper sanitation and medical care 


We hope to give these marginalised women in Phetchabun, Thailand a place to receive counselling and rehabilitative care. These ladies live on the fringes of society and fall through the cracks of the welfare system. 

Without proper care and support, they're forced to bear their burdens alone and likely to remain confined in a toxic routine of fear and abuse. Battered women inevitably return to their abusive spouses in fear of social stigma and neglected elderly eventually die unattended. 

We want to build a future where every woman, especially the ones living in the outskirts, can come to this safe haven to seek assistance and support. Ultimately, we yearn to effect lasting change, where violence and discrimination against women is a thing of the past.


The Big Picture #199daystochange 


We plan to build a 17,000-ft community space that will serve as a platform to empower a community of 14,000 villagers to break out of poverty and oppression. We need your help to realise our plans in the next 199 days. 


Here's the plan:

As illustrated above, the community space will be constructed in 3 phases:
1) Building 3 rooms for rehabilitative care
2) Auditorium for training and engagement initiatives
3) Outdoor amphitheatre and indoor kitchen

We need USD60,000 to complete the first phase—the 3 training rooms that will be used for rehabilitation programmes and counselling sessions for these abused women. 


Every dollar you donate will be used to expand access to care and rehabilitation for women who need it the most. 


Dollar-for-dollar match for every donation

* All donations up to USD30,000 will be matched.


We need your voice too.

It's not all about giving, we need you to spread the word about our cause. Our #199daystochange campaign is part of a larger movement dedicated to eradicating poverty and violence that plague at-risk social groups. If you share our heartbeat, make history with us by helping us raise awareness about the plight of these women. 


Get clicking! 

Here's how else you can help:
  • Spread the word about #199daystochange on Facebook or Twitter
  • Stay plugged in. Follow RADION International on Facebook and Twitter to receive updates about the #199daystochange movement.

  • Keep a lookout for more news on the second and third phases of our building plans.  


Let's change lives together.

#199daystochange represents a momentous step towards helping thousands of marginalised women break out of the vicious cycle of poverty and violence. Together, we can help women like Mee have a more hopeful tomorrow. 


_____________________________________________________________________________

RADION International believes that every life matters. 

We assist and empower needy communities so that they can in turn be agents of change themselves. We work primarily with marginalised communities in Phetchabun and some of our major programmes include sheltering and mentoring children at risk, hosting regular food distribution outreaches, medical relief projects, awareness exhibitions and mass donation drives. 

http://www.radion-international.org
