story:
SUMMARY

Verse Capital has developed a frictionless way to integrate technology into schools, while generating amplified recession-proof, early-stage returns, without early-stage risk. 

Verse Capital leverages a team with over 55-years of combined Education and EdTech expertise, ranging from a former White House Presidential Staffer in the Department of Education, former Sales Executives from Pearson, the global Education leader, a Director of Business Development from School Improvement Network, one of Utah's fastest growing companies for many consecutive years and much more.

Think of starting an early-stage EdTech company as a journey. If you know where the destination you need to reach is, but you don't know precisely how to get there, you're likely going to run into costly obstacles and detours, while trying to reach the destination. Public Education is an unknown territory that is very different and more challenging landscape than any other industry. Therefore, while navigating to the destination you're going to run into more obstacles and detours than you would've if the journey was in another industry. That's why most early-stage EdTech companies run out of capital, ambition, time and other resources before reaching the destination. That's why the return on investment (ROI) in this industry is not high enough to draw in the type of capital that can sweep innovation across the industry overnight like it has in other industries. That's why this is NOT an appetizing journey to those who want to solve Education's problems or to those who provide the capital.

But, imagine how different it would be if you have a "guide" or a "bridge", a team who has been to the destination you need to reach many times. Imagine a bridge that took you over the top of the obstacles and detours. You'd be able to reach the destination frictionlessly. You'd reach the destination faster, bigger because you wouldn't have wasted capital, time or other resources on obstacles and detours along the way, and you'd reach the destination more frequently, if not every time. Plus, you'd be better equipped to do what you needed when you got to the destination. 

Now, imagine if you were also provided a rocket booster to hyper-accelerate you to the destination. Verse Capital is the guide or the bridge, the rocket booster is our expertise in Public Education Sales. So few understand Sales and fewer understand Sales in this industry. There is no investor, consultant, advisor or anyone else who is going to knock on doors with you and you can forget about finding someone who knows precisely which doors to knock on. We believe it's crazy because Sales solves all problems.

  • Sales generates Revenue.
  • Revenue offsets the amount of capital a company will need from an investor.
    • Therefore, it reduces initial dilution of your ownership of your company and reduces the risk of needing to dilute your ownership later.
  • Revenue increases the value or valuation of your company.
    • Therefore, if you do need capital, it's less expensive, easier to obtain and you'll have more options.
    • Revenue is also the key to profit, profitability and therefore your own return on investment and your investors return on investment.
  • Revenue provides the capital needed to hire the best talent, increase marketing, etc.
  • Revenue reduces all Risk. 

So, why aren't more Investors, who invest in early-stage companies, providing capital and Sales Expertise to ensure they invest in successful companies? We think it's a no-brainer, but in Education, there's no other way to produce the type of returns that capital requires. We are the 1st company/investor that will supply capital and Sales expertise to early-stage EdTech companies, because we have to solve the problems in Education or America will not be able to compete and we can't imagine the losses each of us will endure as America slips into the 3rd world. 

We need your help with the initial capital. Once we prove that this is how EdTech investing needs to look, then we'll be able to raise all the capital we need. But if you don't give us a chance, we'll never know and this is a risk America cannot take.

Verse Capital will partner with Educators who have developed promising EdTech solutions and provide them with business, sales and capital resources to amplify their success. Verse Capita. With over 55-years combined expertise, Verse Capital strategically addresses each challenge that has made penetrating education for new companies with innovative solutions virtually impassable, the key to amplifying each company's success that has never been done before. The companies Verse Capital works with will reach faster success, bigger success and more frequent success.

After 5-yrs. of research, learning that America is deteriorating much faster than most can imagine and accepting that if something doesn't change, the future is going to change in America for the worse, the solution materialized. Public Education is a wildly different industry, for 35-yrs. business people have tried to apply old business models to Public Education with no success. They keep doing it, it's insane. If Public Education is different and we want different results, WE MUST THINK DIFFERENTLY.

Early-stage companies are the bottleneck to innovation. Innovation creates efficiency, aligns an Industry to the Global Economy's Needs. In this, Education is the Industry and because the industry is different, full of barriers that slow early-stage companies down or cause total failure, the only way for them to succeed and increase the innovation that reaches our students, there has to be a new and "different" type of company, that acts like a bridge, accelerating early-stage companies across the barriers to entry, penetrating Education and reaching every classroom, no matter the zip code or amount of wealth in the zip code. 

Education is the primary driver of Economic Productivity, our ability to compete as a nation. It has fallen to #36 and if we don't fix it, our Economic Productivity, our Living Standards and much more will fall to #36. For perspective, Mexico's Economic Productivity is #35. This new business model is the solution.

Educators are closest to and most qualified to solve pervasive problems in America's Public Schools. They're also the least likely to succeed if attempt to create a commercial solution and roll it out to the 51 million students in America whose future depends on the education they receive.  Typically, they lack business/sales acumen and access to capital that's required to break through the socialized barriers of public education. 

This may be the greatest tragedy of our time. Tragic for Educators who take the blame for education's under-performance, even-though they're under-paid, overworked, equipped with 14th century tools and when trying to solve pervasive problems, they're punished further by a viscous industry to succeed in on the business-front. It's tragic for our children who will enter an economy in decline with fewer tools and skills than generations that graduated before them. It's tragic for the rest of us who don't know the cost of neglect. We owe it to our children and to those who serve and who have served on the frontlines, protecting our freedom, to do whatever is necessary to create and maintain alignment between education and the global economy's demands.

Verse Capital was created to amplify success for Educators who create solutions for public schools. Verse Capital supplies Educators with the required Business and Sales Acumen, Capital and accelerates them through Education's Socialized Barriers to Entry. Educators that partner with Verse Capital, will reach success faster, bigger and more frequently. Without these critical pieces, it is nearly impossible to commercialize scalable Education Technology (EdTech) solutions, capable of providing each of our children with personalized skills and knowledge that they must have to compete in the modern economy. Verse Capital has a solution that’s needed to align America’s Public Schools to the 21st century global economy.​

What happened? The Digital Revolution reshaped the world, but our school systems were unable to adapt while countries we compete against were able to adapt and sail right past us. Our children are digital natives, but our schools use a 14th century classical education model, designed for a different time, world and people -- designed to support a wildly different, less global economy – yet, we’re still using it in the 21st century! The more successful Educators are when introducing technology solutions into classrooms, the more successful student outcomes will be and the sooner America will be positioned for prosperity again, rather than continuing as a nation in decline.

THE PROCESS

First, recognize that this is a special time for solving this problem. Before, the cost of deploying over 50 million devices, IT staff, etc. was insurmountable. Today, the Cost Barrier to Entry has dropped: 1. Computing Devices: Dropped by over 30% YoY. Devices are used pervasively. 2. Cloud: Eliminated the need for the bulk of the cost such as servers, etc. The cloud is used pervasively. 3. Broadband: 94% of public schools have sufficient bandwidth, it too is pervasive and allows the devices to connect to the Cloud. Once all three aligned, there was an influx of capital and entrepreneurs, which has died off because they learned the impossibilities of penetrating Public Education, which we have solved and we know of nobody else who has. This process is capable of generating returns that will drive the market to EdTech, increasing capital investments and Educator/Entrepreneur interest, the right way. In addition, while in the trenches doing research, building a team with over 55-years of combined EdTech Expertise, our very own backyard, Utah, gained the reputation as being "EdTech's Home."

  1. Align Product to Federal/State Education Budgets: If the product doesn't fit, you have to go through legislation to get it approved. We won't work with these companies because it's a 5-years process. Plus, once we know where within the budgets we need to reach, it is much faster and easier to reach for it. We leverage Christina here, she has been Presidential Staff in the White House under the Department of Education. Few people on the planet can navigate budgets like she can. 
  2. Sales: The most difficult thing for a new company to navigate through is generating sales and therefore Revenue, the key to all businesses and key to generating returns. Selling to public schools is like no other industry, plus since the space has been dominated by just a few multibillion company, there just aren't many people who know how to sell. Anne worked for Pearson, the world's biggest, for 17-years and where she perfected the sales process. We leverage Anne and her network to hyper-accelerate sales, which puts more capital in their accounts, boosts the valuation and therefore the return, minimizes our need to invest, reduces their dilution and ours, plus it gives us a runway, incase we make a mistake. There is no better way to do this, most companies could never get this type of a sales team.
  3. Implementation with Fidelity: This is where it all fits together and that almost nobody even thinks about. The few companies that do get a 1st sell done, they rapidly race off to get another, not thinking about how to effectively and responsibly do an implementation to ensure the product gets used. Most companies won't get a 2nd contract or renewal because the usage is always too low. Which means the product isn't making a positive impact, if it isn't getting used. The renewal is where the profit comes too, because the first sell is expensive. So most companies don't get the usage or the profit, therefore they don't generate returns either. We help the companies develop an implementation strategy that has fidelity. 

Examples of Educator founded EdTech companies that Verse is working with:

Red Apple Reading – Provides early learner reading intervention. Reading is the foundation of all learning and, if a student gets off track early, they will forever be behind. Red Apple Reading identifies when a child falls behind and intervenes, concentrating on their weaknesses. As a digital reading tool, it simultaneously works on writing and spelling skills.

Tiered Systems Support – Supports a tiered system for academic, behavior, and attendance intervention, to ensure ALL students succeed. For example: Teachers needed technology assistance to effectively track mastery learning of each module, prior to falling behind, intervention is scheduled before students go home, where learning situations aren’t ideal.

Schola – Provides families with the tools they need to find the school and educational programming that best aligns with the needs of their child.

Stand for Kind – Believes every child deserves a non-threatening environment, and to feel like they belong. They provide tech solutions for bullying and suicide prevention, intervention and post trauma.

And More – Hundreds of EdTech companies, each capable of solving a unique problem in America's Public Schools with an innovative solution, have contacted Verse Capital, needing to be amplified through Verse's proprietary process. The hold up is capital, which is why Verse is crowdfunding. The more capital donated, the sooner America's biggest threat, a threat to each American's future, gets neutralized. 

PERKS

$5.00 + Shipping: Pen/Phone Stand

$10.00 + Shipping: Pen/Phone Stand + Glow in the Dark Bracelet

$25.00 + Shipping: Pen/Phone Stand + Glow in the Dark Bracelet + Sun Glasses

$50.00 + Shipping: Pen/Phone Stand + Glow in the Dark Bracelet + Sun Glasses + Water Bottle

$100.00 + Shipping: Pen/Phone Stand + Glow in the Dark Bracelet + Sun Glasses + Water Bottle + T-Shirt

$250.00+: Verse Advocates for Innovation & Improvement in Public Education. On our https://verse.education/ website, we will have an "Advocates" page, where each donor who commits over $250.00 will be memorialized forever. 

 

USE OF FUNDS

Funds from this campaign will be used to do the following:

  1. Equity-based Crowdfunding: This problem is America's problem, the people's problem. If Verse is going to generate recession-proof, early-stage returns without early-stage risk, while solving the people's problem, then the people should realize the financial gains. Depending on how much capital is raised, a portion will be used to launch a large scale, mass reach Equity-based Crowdfunding Campaign, giving each donor an opportunity to own part of Verse Capital. 
  2. Existing Companies: A portion will be used to amplify the four companies above, getting them closer to success, benefitting more children and de-risking the opportunity for the proper equity investment that will come from the Equity-based Crowdfunding Campaign.

TEAM

Caleb Eliason, Co-Founder/Managing Partner

Caleb is responsible for all aspects of Verse Capital. He’s been a founder or an early investor in 13 startups with 10 gains, 8 via exit and 2 still operating. He cut his teeth in Goldman Sachs & Co.'s Investment Management Division, in 2003 and in 2007 recognized the housing market bubble and left before the collapse started. During the collapse Caleb and his partner, Scott, invested in early-stage company and helped it through the recession, exiting it at 3x their investment basis. Afterwards, he managed and wrote the playbook for a technology accelerator, BoomStartup, which was ranked #14 nationally the following year. At BoomStartup, he discovered Education Technology (EdTech) and learned that America's future is at risk because U.S. Education had fallen to 36th. He also saw a massive opportunity and has been immersed ever since. To gain expertise he joined a hyper-growth EdTech company, School Improvement Network, as the Director of Business Development. Coincidentally, two years later Utah became "EdTech's Home" and BoomStartup launched an EdTech focused accelerator. He did his undergrad in Finance at the University of Utah and has an MBA with honors, emphasis in Entrepreneurship, from Westminster’s Gore School of Business.

 

Christina Culver, Managing Director

Christina shares responsibilities of the fund’s sourcing, revenue amplification and owns all political and legislative affairs. Christina is a globally recognized leader in U.S. Education Policy, Regulatory, and Strategic Advisory Services. She has driven federal and state sales and implementation strategies for EdTech startups, middle market, and multinational publicly traded EdTech clients. She has lobbied Congress on Elementary, Secondary and Higher Education issues, including the most recent, Every Student Succeeds Act (ESSA). Christina gained her expertise working in senior positions at the White House in Presidential Personnel, U.S. Department of Education, including Acting Assistant Secretary and Deputy Assistant Secretary of Intergovernmental and Interagency Affairs. Christina is a graduate of the U.S. Naval War College, Newport, Rhode Island, with a Master’s degree in National Security and Strategic Studies, and has a B.A. in Political Science from the University of Kansas.

 

Scott Gustafson, Co-Founder/Managing Partner

Scott is responsible for Verse Capital's investment activities which include sourcing, negotiating and underwriting. Scott and Caleb have worked together for over a decade prior to co-founding Verse Capital. Scott has held several executive roles from leading global sales and marketing for Sorenson Medical to various roles in family office asset management. Scott has taken businesses from simple concepts and managed them through exit. As a serial entrepreneur and investor, he has represented both sides of the table and has been the lead in several successful portfolio asset turnarounds. He has participated in acquiring, exiting and building valuations for portfolio assets worth hundreds of millions. Scott has a bachelor’s degree from Westminster and an MBA from the Thunderbird School of Global Management.

Anne Brown, Managing Director

Anne is responsible for sourcing, accelerating revenue and executing implementation strategies with targeted companies Verse works with. Anne has spent nearly two decades pioneering and advancing the implementation of high-impact, digital, Personalized Learning with leading education giant, Pearson PLC (NYSE: PSO), Waterford Research Institute LLC, and School Improvement Network, by driving revenue and market penetration. Anne is a nationally recognized industry leader in K-12 Education and a driver of the nationwide transformation of classical schools to digital schools through facilitating strong partnerships with national and state level politicians, education industry competitors, educators, advocates, and the media. Anne has a rich educational background with experience as both as an inner-city educator and a diverse EdTech industry leader. She developed Pearson’s grants and funding support model for schools and was also a business development and government relations manager. While at Pearson, she was a leader in creating and supporting legislation to allow K-12 schools to use their budget for educational technology solutions, K-12 EdTech.

 

OUR ASK

If we can get you to donate even $5, the price of a McDonald's Happy Meal, we can create the momentum we need if we can get enough people to help. This isn't a huge ask but the reward we're offering is everything. We've invested years of our lives, risked everything, invested hundreds of thousands of dollars and this is it, we are ready to execute but we need your help, A FEW BUCKS AND TO SHARE THIS WITH EVERYONE IS ALL WE'RE ASKING. 

Imagine you're standing there with a hose. You're house is on fire, your children are in it, but you're neighbors lawn in dying. What are you going to do? That's how simple this thought process should be, yet investors plow billions of dollars into other countries, other peoples problems, we fight other peoples wars, when our very own home is on fire and the resources we use to invest in other countries will be lost when our home has burn't to the ground. We won't be able to help others if we let this continue. Right now, we need to help ourselves or it'll be too late.

There is nothing more important than fixing our education system right now.

We have to stop throwing hundreds of millions into things like video games that use similar crowdfunding campaigns. We have to give NEW, creative projects like ours a chance to solve this problem, because clearly after nearly four decades of the same, what has been done before isn't doing the trick. To repeat it would be insanity. 

Education/Public Schools is not the most sexy problem to solve, product to build or campaign to donate to, but it is the most important and this is the most effective way to solve the problems in Education. Trust us, we know.  

Education touches everything, the value of our real estate to our healthcare costs.  Better educated Americans will experience less poverty, lower welfare and healthcare costs, they are more sensitive to their environment and will have better skills to solve every other issue we become passionate about solving. Education is "THE" solution, if we get it right, the other issue will be more efficiently solved.

  Please join with us and invest in America’s future.

 

                   The Information Below is Supporting Data                        

 

SUPPORTING INFORMATION, POSSIBLY INTERESTING FOR SOME

EDUCATION'S IMPORTANCE

Q: How does America's Education performance impact each of our future?

A: According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS image below), Education's performance is the PRIMARY DRIVER of our economy and our living standards. A country's economy becomes more productive as the ratio of educated workers increases. America's future depends on all children. If your children did amazing in school but every other child didn't, there wouldn't be much of an economy to grow from. 

We Have Been Warned...

A Nation at Risk

President Reagan warned us 35-years ago:  "Our once unchallenged preeminence in commerce, industry, science, and technological innovation is being overtaken by competitors throughout the world…. If an unfriendly foreign power had attempted to impose on America the mediocre educational performance that exists today, we might well have viewed it as an act of war.”

Educate to Innovate

President Obama warned us in 2008:"Make no mistake, the future is on the line. At a time when good jobs can be located anywhere, OUR MOST VALUABLE SKILL IS KNOWLEDGE. EDUCATION IS THE CURRENCY OF THE INFORMATION AGE. COUNTRIES WHO OUT-EDUCATE US TODAY WILL OUT-COMPETE US TOMORROW. 

The National Assessment of Educational Progress (NAEP)

In April of 2018, the NAEP released 2017's assessment results, 35-years since Reagan's warning. NAEP 2017: America's "Lost Decade" for Educational Progress." 

Statistics

Here are a few statistics from American Revolution 2.o by GSV Asset Management, to provide perspective on how America's public schools are performing:

  • In Math, when comparing 12th grade students in 46 countries, American students only outscored South Africa and Cyprus.
  • 4 out of 100 kindergarteners entering KIPP Ascend in Chicago in 2010 were able to recognize numbers or letters.
  • In 2012, only 1 of 4 graduating seniors were prepared for college coursework.
  • 75% of high school seniors were unfamiliar with basic facts about American government.
  • A U.S. high school student drops out every 26 seconds.
  • Each dropout class costs the nation $325 billion in lost contributions, which is equal to the combined GDP of Kansas, Utah, Nebraska, and Alaska every year.
  • The average graduation rate of the 7 schools that make up the City Colleges of Chicago is 10%.
  • 70% of students who enter community colleges in the US do not graduate.
  • 75% of US citizens ages of 17 to 24 are not qualified to join the military because they are physically unfit, have criminal records, or don’t have a high enough level of education.
  • There are more honors students in India than there are students in the United States.
  • Americans spend 33% of their money on housing and 2% on supplemental education. In Asia, families spend 10% on housing and 15% on supplemental education.
  • 72% of Indian immigrants to the US returned home to start their own businesses. That number was 81% for Chinese immigrants.

American Education has fallen from #1 to #36 and is DEAD LAST in MATH improvement, 2nd to LAST in LITERACY improvement.

 

EDUCATION'S IMPACT ON OUR ECONOMY

When America's Education was #1, it fueled the economy and lifestyle we've become accustomed to. Since, falling to #36 our economy and living standards have slowly eroded. Per the BLS (image below), our labor productivity has reached a historic low. 

You probably haven't noticed America's lost productivity or living standards because, we've been subsidizing the losses with debt. Here are a few points that should help you see the actual health of the U.S. Economy.

  • Government debt is at a record high, over $20 trillion.
  • Household debt has reached an all-time record.
  • Household savings has reached a record low.
  • America has almost reached full employment, yet we're still operating in a deficit.
  • The current expansion is 106-months old making it the longest expansion in history. Yet, both fiscal and monetary policy  is being leveraged as if we were still in a recession.
    • Leaving us with no tools to stimulate a recovery if we go into a recession.
    • We're still pumping near-free capital into the market, to keep it afloat, absorbing more debt that we will have to repay and artificially inflating market values with an unsustainable source of capital.

This isn't sustainable!


   For more information, learn about our team, etc. please visit: https://verse.education/

SUMMARYVerse Capital has developed a frictionless way to integrate technology into schools, while generating amplified recession-proof, early-stage returns, without early-stage risk. Verse Capital leverages a team with over 55-years of combined Education and EdTech expertise, ranging from a former White House Presidential Staffer in the Department of Education, former Sales Executives from Pearson, the global Education leader, a Director of Business Development from School Improvement Network, one of Utah's fastest growing companies for many consecutive years and much more.Think of starting an early-stage EdTech company as a journey. If you know where the destination you need to reach is, but you don't know precisely how to get there, you're likely going to run into costly obstacles and detours, while trying to reach the destination. Public Education is an unknown territory that is very different and more challenging landscape than any other industry. Therefore, while navigating to the destination you're going to run into more obstacles and detours than you would've if the journey was in another industry. That's why most early-stage EdTech companies run out of capital, ambition, time and other resources before reaching the destination. That's why the return on investment (ROI) in this industry is not high enough to draw in the type of capital that can sweep innovation across the industry overnight like it has in other industries. That's why this is NOT an appetizing journey to those who want to solve Education's problems or to those who provide the capital.But, imagine how different it would be if you have a "guide" or a "bridge", a team who has been to the destination you need to reach many times. Imagine a bridge that took you over the top of the obstacles and detours. You'd be able to reach the destination frictionlessly. You'd reach the destination faster, bigger because you wouldn't have wasted capital, time or other resources on obstacles and detours along the way, and you'd reach the destination more frequently, if not every time. Plus, you'd be better equipped to do what you needed when you got to the destination. Now, imagine if you were also provided a rocket booster to hyper-accelerate you to the destination. Verse Capital is the guide or the bridge, the rocket booster is our expertise in Public Education Sales. So few understand Sales and fewer understand Sales in this industry. There is no investor, consultant, advisor or anyone else who is going to knock on doors with you and you can forget about finding someone who knows precisely which doors to knock on. We believe it's crazy because Sales solves all problems.
Sales generates Revenue.
Revenue offsets the amount of capital a company will need from an investor.Therefore, it reduces initial dilution of your ownership of your company and reduces the risk of needing to dilute your ownership later.

Revenue increases the value or valuation of your company.
Therefore, if you do need capital, it's less expensive, easier to obtain and you'll have more options.
Revenue is also the key to profit, profitability and therefore your own return on investment and your investors return on investment.


Revenue provides the capital needed to hire the best talent, increase marketing, etc.
Revenue reduces all Risk. 
So, why aren't more Investors, who invest in early-stage companies, providing capital and Sales Expertise to ensure they invest in successful companies? We think it's a no-brainer, but in Education, there's no other way to produce the type of returns that capital requires. We are the 1st company/investor that will supply capital and Sales expertise to early-stage EdTech companies, because we have to solve the problems in Education or America will not be able to compete and we can't imagine the losses each of us will endure as America slips into the 3rd world. We need your help with the initial capital. Once we prove that this is how EdTech investing needs to look, then we'll be able to raise all the capital we need. Coincidentally, two years later Utah became "EdTech's Home" and BoomStartup launched an EdTech focused accelerator. He did his undergrad in Finance at the University of Utah and has an MBA with honors, emphasis in Entrepreneurship, from Westminster’s Gore School of Business. Christina Culver, Managing DirectorChristina shares responsibilities of the fund’s sourcing, revenue amplification and owns all political and legislative affairs. Christina is a globally recognized leader in U.S. Education Policy, Regulatory, and Strategic Advisory Services. She has driven federal and state sales and implementation strategies for EdTech startups, middle market, and multinational publicly traded EdTech clients. She has lobbied Congress on Elementary, Secondary and Higher Education issues, including the most recent, Every Student Succeeds Act (ESSA). Christina gained her expertise working in senior positions at the White House in Presidential Personnel, U.S. Department of Education, including Acting Assistant Secretary and Deputy Assistant Secretary of Intergovernmental and Interagency Affairs. Christina is a graduate of the U.S. Naval War College, Newport, Rhode Island, with a Master’s degree in National Security and Strategic Studies, and has a B.A. in Political Science from the University of Kansas. Scott Gustafson, Co-Founder/Managing PartnerScott is responsible for Verse Capital's investment activities which include sourcing, negotiating and underwriting. Scott and Caleb have worked together for over a decade prior to co-founding Verse Capital. Scott has held several executive roles from leading global sales and marketing for Sorenson Medical to various roles in family office asset management. Scott has taken businesses from simple concepts and managed them through exit. As a serial entrepreneur and investor, he has represented both sides of the table and has been the lead in several successful portfolio asset turnarounds. He has participated in acquiring, exiting and building valuations for portfolio assets worth hundreds of millions. Scott has a bachelor’s degree from Westminster and an MBA from the Thunderbird School of Global Management.Anne Brown, Managing DirectorAnne is responsible for sourcing, accelerating revenue and executing implementation strategies with targeted companies Verse works with. Anne has spent nearly two decades pioneering and advancing the implementation of high-impact, digital, Personalized Learning with leading education giant, Pearson PLC (NYSE: PSO), Waterford Research Institute LLC, and School Improvement Network, by driving revenue and market penetration. Anne is a nationally recognized industry leader in K-12 Education and a driver of the nationwide transformation of classical schools to digital schools through facilitating strong partnerships with national and state level politicians, education industry competitors, educators, advocates, and the media. Anne has a rich educational background with experience as both as an inner-city educator and a diverse EdTech industry leader. She developed Pearson’s grants and funding support model for schools and was also a business development and government relations manager. While at Pearson, she was a leader in creating and supporting legislation to allow K-12 schools to use their budget for educational technology solutions, K-12 EdTech. OUR ASKIf we can get you to donate even $5, the price of a McDonald's Happy Meal, we can create the momentum we need if we can get enough people to help. This isn't a huge ask but the reward we're offering is everything. We've invested years of our lives, risked everything, invested hundreds of thousands of dollars and this is it, we are ready to execute but we need your help, A FEW BUCKS AND TO SHARE THIS WITH EVERYONE IS ALL WE'RE ASKING. Imagine you're standing there with a hose. You're house is on fire, your children are in it, but you're neighbors lawn in dying. What are you going to do? That's how simple this thought process should be, yet investors plow billions of dollars into other countries, other peoples problems, we fight other peoples wars, when our very own home is on fire and the resources we use to invest in other countries will be lost when our home has burn't to the ground. We won't be able to help others if we let this continue. Right now, we need to help ourselves or it'll be too late. There is nothing more important than fixing our education system right now.We have to stop throwing hundreds of millions into things like video games that use similar crowdfunding campaigns. We have to give NEW, creative projects like ours a chance to solve this problem, because clearly after nearly four decades of the same, what has been done before isn't doing the trick. To repeat it would be insanity. Education/Public Schools is not the most sexy problem to solve, product to build or campaign to donate to, but it is the most important and this is the most effective way to solve the problems in Education. Trust us, we know.  Education touches everything, the value of our real estate to our healthcare costs.  Better educated Americans will experience less poverty, lower welfare and healthcare costs, they are more sensitive to their environment and will have better skills to solve every other issue we become passionate about solving. Education is "THE" solution, if we get it right, the other issue will be more efficiently solved.  Please join with us and invest in America’s future.                    The Information Below is Supporting Data                         SUPPORTING INFORMATION, POSSIBLY INTERESTING FOR SOMEEDUCATION'S IMPORTANCEQ: How does America's Education performance impact each of our future?A: According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS image below), Education's performance is the PRIMARY DRIVER of our economy and our living standards. A country's economy becomes more productive as the ratio of educated workers increases. America's future depends on all children. If your children did amazing in school but every other child didn't, there wouldn't be much of an economy to grow from. We Have Been Warned...A Nation at RiskPresident Reagan warned us 35-years ago:  "Our once unchallenged preeminence in commerce, industry, science, and technological innovation is being overtaken by competitors throughout the world…. If an unfriendly foreign power had attempted to impose on America the mediocre educational performance that exists today, we might well have viewed it as an act of war.”Educate to InnovatePresident Obama warned us in 2008:"Make no mistake, the future is on the line. At a time when good jobs can be located anywhere, OUR MOST VALUABLE SKILL IS KNOWLEDGE. EDUCATION IS THE CURRENCY OF THE INFORMATION AGE. COUNTRIES WHO OUT-EDUCATE US TODAY WILL OUT-COMPETE US TOMORROW. The National Assessment of Educational Progress (NAEP)In April of 2018, the NAEP released 2017's assessment results, 35-years since Reagan's warning. NAEP 2017: America's "Lost Decade" for Educational Progress." StatisticsHere are a few statistics from American Revolution 2.o by GSV Asset Management, to provide perspective on how America's public schools are performing:
In Math, when comparing 12th grade students in 46 countries, American students only outscored South Africa and Cyprus.
4 out of 100 kindergarteners entering KIPP Ascend in Chicago in 2010 were able to recognize numbers or letters.
In 2012, only 1 of 4 graduating seniors were prepared for college coursework.
75% of high school seniors were unfamiliar with basic facts about American government.
A U.S. high school student drops out every 26 seconds.
Each dropout class costs the nation $325 billion in lost contributions, which is equal to the combined GDP of Kansas, Utah, Nebraska, and Alaska every year.
The average graduation rate of the 7 schools that make up the City Colleges of Chicago is 10%.
70% of students who enter community colleges in the US do not graduate.
75% of US citizens ages of 17 to 24 are not qualified to join the military because they are physically unfit, have criminal records, or don’t have a high enough level of education.
There are more honors students in India than there are students in the United States.
Americans spend 33% of their money on housing and 2% on supplemental education. In Asia, families spend 10% on housing and 15% on supplemental education.
72% of Indian immigrants to the US returned home to start their own businesses. That number was 81% for Chinese immigrants.
American Education has fallen from #1 to #36 and is DEAD LAST in MATH improvement, 2nd to LAST in LITERACY improvement. EDUCATION'S IMPACT ON OUR ECONOMYWhen America's Education was #1, it fueled the economy and lifestyle we've become accustomed to. Since, falling to #36 our economy and living standards have slowly eroded. Per the BLS (image below), our labor productivity has reached a historic low. You probably haven't noticed America's lost productivity or living standards because, we've been subsidizing the losses with debt. Here are a few points that should help you see the actual health of the U.S. Economy.
Government debt is at a record high, over $20 trillion.
Household debt has reached an all-time record.
Household savings has reached a record low.
America has almost reached full employment, yet we're still operating in a deficit.
The current expansion is 106-months old making it the longest expansion in history. Yet, both fiscal and monetary policy  is being leveraged as if we were still in a recession.
Leaving us with no tools to stimulate a recovery if we go into a recession.
We're still pumping near-free capital into the market, to keep it afloat, absorbing more debt that we will have to repay and artificially inflating market values with an unsustainable source of capital.


This isn't sustainable!   For more information, learn about our team, etc. please visit: https://verse.education/

story:
"Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world"

By Nelson Mandela

"Every Child has the Right to get better Education"​​

Frank Swai and Rev. Joshua laiser are the founders of Pambazuka Naisinyai School. The idea of starting Pambazuka Naisinyai School came to the mind of Frank and Joshua after seeing the challenges facing Maasai communities in Tanzania. Rev. Joshua is a Maasai by tribe and he was born and raised in the Maasai communities so he knows much about the challenges facing his communities.He says "Education has been severe challenge in the Maasai communities as most of families don't know the importance of education for future life of their children. So we are working hard to educate parents and community in general so that they can know the importance of education. So the Pambazuka Naisinyai School is for Maasai children and nearby communities. Please join us and donate something to support this project!!

Our School Started under the tree

Our school started under the tree as we do not have resources to help us for building classes for the Maasai children. Education should start with their parents to educate them so that they can know the importance of education to their children. Some of the parents are now aware about education to their children so they are allowing them to attend school. We are still talking to the parents so that they can give us a good cooperation.

Students and their teacher having class session under the tree

 

Early Marriage and circumcision for the young Maasai girls.

Imagine a world where every child is educated and can contribute to the development process!!

So many times parents in Maasai  areas tend to give away their young girls for marriage in exchange for just a kilogram of sugar, a goat, a cow , some tea leaves and sometimes for salt. These young girls are then subjected to domestic violence, torture, early child birth and many times girls have died while giving birth because their bodies are never ready to experience child birth.

Many times the parents to these girls need to be empowered with information about the benefits of keeping their children in school until they complete their education. Once these girls have acquired the education, they can provide all the above mentioned items to their parents for the rest of their lives. All that parents need to to practice some bit of patience and sacrifice a little in order to enjoy the fruits of their children.

Circumcision for the women is prohibited but Maasai societies they still circumcise their young girls. We are working hard to educate them so that they can stop this.

Its time to reach out to the parents in the Maasai land settings and sensitize them if we want a better future for girls. A future where they can participate in leadership positions. A future where they can make informed choices and start up families the the men of their choice.

The time is now. Lets teach the Parents because they need this knowledge.

Maasai girls

 

Young Boys:  Young boys normally are send to keep cows and goats far away from home and come back evening everyday. Others they like to go to school but not allowed to go!!

Young Maasai Kids in the bush keeping cows

Education: Most of Maasai children don't go to school due to the environment they are living. Their parent don't understand the importance of their children to get better education. So we are trying our level best to educate these Maasai societies so that they can allow their children to go to school. Also there are scarcity of nearest school in their areas so we are working hard to build school near them to attract and convince their parent to allow them to attend school.

Our effort made us to start building Pambazuka Naisinyai School http://www.pambazuka.sc.tz  for which this school started under the tree but with our own effort we have managed to build some two classes and bought some desks so we need to work hard to make it happen!!

WHY THIS CAMPAIGN IS IMPORTANT

We decided to start a school in Maasai society so as to convince the Maasai on Education. Maasai society is leaving a life with no permanent settlement, thus not getting a chance for schooling. Also the society lives a life of animal husbandry which is difficult for parents to allow their children in distant schools due to they depend of them for rearing animals. Therefore starting a school within Maasai society will convince parents allowing their children to attend school near by them. That is the school I started within Maasai society is purposely to help the Maasai children. It is called PAMBAZUKA NAISINYAI PRE & PRIMARY SCHOOL         http://www.pambazuka.sc.tz   . Already our school has grade one (1) with 65 pupils , grade two with 55 and grade three with 35  pupils and 4 teachers who use most of their time teaching the children for most of them can’t speak neither Swahili nor English, but Maasai language.

Student doing class work on the ground

 

 NEW TWO CLASSES

Through our own efforts we have managed to build two classes where grade one and two are using for studying. We have more 10 acres where we want to build more classes as we have more students coming soon. We want to build more classes up to seven classes, we also need to build kitchen, toilet as the one we have is not enough, computers and computer lab, well for keeping water as there is scarcity of water, desks, books, office for teachers, salaries for teachers.

Our two New Classes

Our future plans are to have secondary school up to university among Maasai society in order to have education nearby so as to fight poverty by getting good education.

  The importance of this campaign is to construct a school within Maasai society, also helping Maasai society withdraw from ignorance and illiteracy so a t cope with the changes of the world.

Under Construction please help a bit

What We Need 

We need to do the following so that we can get our school off the ground; Seven more classes, computer room, Library, computers, Office for the staff, Kitchen, Good toilet, Reading books, tank for water storage and bin maize and beans storage, lunch for the teachers and students, salaries for teachers, Scholarship and to build fence around the school. The estimation costs is $30,000.  "Every bit will help"

 

Desks: We have managed to buy some desks for one class so class one will not sit on the ground again. Please support us so that we can buy more desks and build more classes!!

Classroom

THE FOLLOWING ARE THE REASONS AS TO WHY MY PROJECT IS VALUABLE TO DONORS AND THE WORLD

  This project is very important to donors and world at large for it will connect us with Maasai society for they shall be able to communicate with different people of different nations of the world. Also this will give chance for donors to come and visit Maasai society and learn the real life and culture of Maasai. Apart from that it also helps to eradicate the number of illiterates in the world.

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

1. Due to studying environment being of low standard life, it is difficult to get skilled teachers and faithful constructors.

2. Another challenge is teacher's salaries, where by in order to get good trainers you also have to pay them well.

3. Another challenge is that , the pupils are fluently speaking Maasai native language, while their teachers don’t know the language and thus difficult to teach them

4. Due to that parents couldn’t get education, and then they find no importance to take their children to school.

Men at work bringing  clean water at Pambazuka School, Please help

 

 HOW TO OVERCOME THE CHALLENGES

1. Improving the teaching environment so as to encourage trained teachers to come and teach in our school. Also getting enough trusted constructors for constructing the building.

2. Increasing teacher's salaries so as to motivate the coming of more teachers.

3. Educating parents’ house by house on the importance of taking their children to school.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell friends and family about our campaign and our socially-good mission!

Please share our campaign page through the IndieGoGo share buttons on our campaign page!

Please share our campaign on your social networks such as facebook, twitter e.t.c

Thank you very much for your support! Every bit is greatly appreciated!

What you get once you support us (The Perks!!)

T- Shirt (Will send your size and different color with different images)

Maasai Children Photo or post card!!

 

Big 5 Photo!! ( We will send you one photo of Big 5)

Maasai Shuka ( There are of different types for men and women) will send two pairs.

Hat with Kilimanjaro word or any other photo of wildlife in Tanzania

School website: www.pambazuka.sc.tz

Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/Pambazuka-Naisinyai-Sc...

Twitter:   https://twitter.com/PambazukaSchool

story:
Meet CESaRE

 

The world is moving at a rapid pace and our Caribbean institutions are failing to inspire our youth to keep abreast. Often we turn to international universities and academic publications to write stories about the soil that we stand on, the weather that we experience, and the energy fueling our growth.

 

 

When industry leaders want consultation, we at CESaRE believe that they should turn to the people who understand the region the best. When policymakers need to update our aged and outdated environmental laws, we at CESaRE know that the expertise they need is only a stone's throw away. 

We need to lead our change and CESaRE embodies the hopes of many in the region. Revamping academic publication, engaging our leaders through open-access research, and educating our public through innovative media and technology. 

The world does not need to leave us behind! Support CESaRE today to help our region

 

Your Funds, Our Growth

 

The challenge is real and not an easy one! Creating open-access information for a broad audience will push a lot of costs onto CESaRE.

 

 

USD $40,000 to be exact to fund two years of our operations! Building trust and branding for our authors, readers, and sponsors will take time and we need your support to get us off the ground running. 

 

 

Publication fees and printing alone will cost us USD $12,000 each year!

Conferencing, Podcast Series, and our CESaRE Edu App are just some of the innovative ways that we are bringing open-access science to the Caribbean. But innovation isn't cheap!

Your Perks will allow you to join CESaRE's Journey with reward. We removed any shipping to ensure that we are as carbon neutral in our Campaign as possible. So we got more creative! Featured interviews, paid flights to conferences of your choice, freeing up access to Journals are all included in our Perks for you to back! 

 

Putting Research into Motion

 

 

Very often, we aren't all at the same meetings. We don't always get the information we need. And we don't extend dialogue outside of our spheres. 

CESaRE recognizes the importance of collaboration, open-access, and pushing beyond the conventional. Traditional Journals are failing our researchers, NGOs and Policymakers. Building trust will take time and CESaRE will need your support to get us off to a great start!

With USD $2,000 previously raised, a supportive Associate Network, and a comprehensive Inaugural Issue featuring leading researchers in the Caribbean, you know you can trust in us. Our drive knows no bound, and our Vision is pushed further every year!

 

New Journals often Fail

 

You weren't expecting us to say that! But it is a fact we must learn from.

Many new Journals that claim to be open-access simply cannot live up to their name, and often prey on invited authors who are left covering outrageous costs.

CESaRE's business model is different!

We place research first and all of our strategies focus on this model. We will let authors value their work, providing a minimum cost, but one that is fair, transparent, and flexible.

Through quality publications, innovative media, and strong relationships with our authors and readers, CESaRE will push the boundaries of conventional Journals, ensuring our mark in today's rapidly changing world! 

 

Backing CESaRE is more than a Donation 

 

 

We understand that you may not be able to contribute at this time.

Sadly, many of you will not even make it to the end of this page as time is of the essence. But if you made it and still want to help, share our Campaign! Visit our Website and subscribe to our newsletters as well. We want to stay in touch, and your feedback is always welcome :) 

Thank You for Joining Our Journey!

Backing CESaRE is more than a Donation 
 


 
We understand that you may not be able to contribute at this time.
Sadly, many of you will not even make it to the end of this page as time is of the essence. But if you made it and still want to help, share our Campaign! Visit our Website and subscribe to our newsletters as well. We want to stay in touch, and your feedback is always welcome :) 
Thank You for Joining Our Journey!

story:
Our Mission: African American History Textbooks in Our Schools

At Black History 365, our goal is to equip our nation’s inhabitants, and the world at large, with a more thorough, candid, and interwoven understanding of African American history and realities within the American and world historical contexts.  

To accomplish this ambitious goal, we have created an independently produced textbook on African American history that encompasses the history of African Americans starting in Africa until today.  Our game-changing textbook, Black History 365: An Inclusive Account of American History, and its corresponding K-12 curriculum are designed to not only reveal the hidden, undertold, and misconceived portions of African American history but also to cultivate an atmosphere of being authentic with each other about our nation’s past with the intention to heal, not hurt.

To fully complete and deliver a project of this magnitude to the school systems in Texas and beyond, we are humbly asking our IndieGogo community of collaborators for donations to fulfill this project.  With these funds, we will judiciously use them for a successful launch of the curriculum for our country’s schools. 

A donation from you gets us steps closer to providing our students a guide to navigating through American history and a special scholastic source from which they may draw inspiration.  This is our American story.  Let’s make history through the making history.

 

Funding Incentives

Please know that we are immensely grateful for any donation that we receive for our project to bring our African American history textbook into our schools.  Below is a list of the incentives for your gracious donations.

  • >$50
  • Reward: 
    • Receive our popular Black History postcard set in the mail.
  • >$75 donation.
  • Reward: 
    • Receive a museum-quality reproduction of a 1927 Poro College diploma, signed by Annie Malone (gold seal hand embossed with Poro College Corporate Seal…dated 1900) (16” x 20”).
  • >$150 donation.
  • Reward: 
    • Receive an autographed First Edition copy of the 9-12 textbook (exclusive offer…not available to the general public)
  • >$1,000 donation.
  • Rewards: 
    • Your name will be placed forever at the Black History Legacy Level in the 9-12 Black History 365 textbook and on the BH365 website.
    • Receive 2 autographed First Edition copies of the 9-12 textbook (exclusive offer…not available to the general public)
    • Receive a museum-quality reproduction of a 1927 Poro College diploma, signed by Annie Malone (gold seal hand embossed with Poro College Corporate Seal…dated 1900) (16” x 20”).

 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

School Sponsorship

“Adopt” A School District in America -- $2,500 donation

  • Some school districts in America will want the BH365 curriculum, but will not have the budget for it. Your gift will allow us to donate – in your name and at this level – the curriculum necessary for the needs of that school district.
  • Rewards: 
    • Your name will be placed forever at the Bronze Legacy Level in the 9-12 Black History 365 textbook and on the BH365 website.
    • Receive 3 autographed First Edition copies of the 9-12 textbook (exclusive offer…not available to the general public)
    • Receive a museum-quality reproduction of a 1927 Poro College diploma, signed by Annie Malone (gold seal hand embossed with Poro College Corporate Seal…dated 1900) (16” x 20”).

 

 “Adopt” A School District in America -- $5,000 donation

  • Some school districts in America will want the BH365 curriculum, but will not have the budget for it. Your gift will allow us to donate – in your name and at this level – the curriculum necessary for the needs of that school district.
  • Rewards:
    • Your name will be placed forever at the Silver Legacy Level in the 9-12 Black History 365 textbook and on the BH365 website.
    • Receive 10 autographed First Edition copies of 9-12 textbook (exclusive offer…not available to the general public).
    • Receive a museum-quality reproduction of a 1927 Poro College diploma, signed by Annie Malone (gold seal hand embossed with Poro College Corporate Seal…dated 1900) (16” x 20”).

“Adopt” A School District in America -- $10,000 donation

  • Some school districts in America will want this curriculum, but will not have the budget for it. Your gift will allow us to donate – in your name and at this level – the curriculum necessary for the needs of that school district.
  • Rewards:
    • Your name will be placed forever at the Gold Legacy Level in the 9-12 Black History 365 textbook and on the BH365 website.
    • Receive 15 autographed First Edition copies of 9-12 textbook (exclusive offer…not available to the general public).
    • Receive a museum-quality reproduction of a 1927 Poro College diploma, signed by Annie Malone (gold seal hand embossed with Poro College Corporate Seal…dated 1900) (16” x 20”).
    • Hand crafted Classic, Jr., 3D replica of the famous Rosetta Stone (2/3 size, numbered, highly valued work of art, shipping included, retail value $5,000). A stunning work of art.

 

“Adopt” A School District in America -- $20,000 donation

  • Some school districts in America will want this curriculum, but will not have the budget for it. Your gift will allow us to donate – in your name and at this level – the curriculum necessary for the needs of that school district.
  • Rewards: 
    • Your name will be placed forever at the Platinum Legacy Level in the 9-12 Black History 365 textbook and on the BH365 website.
    • Receive 25 autographed First Edition copies of textbook (exclusive offer…not available to the general public).
    • Receive a museum-quality reproduction of a 1927 Poro College diploma, signed by Annie Malone (gold seal hand embossed with Poro College Corporate Seal…dated 1900) (16” x 20”).
    • Hand crafted full size, 1:1, 3D replica of the famous Rosetta Stone (numbered, shipping included, retail value $15,000). A stunning work of art – highly prized by museums, libraries and private collections. One of these replicas was on the movie set of “Night At The Museum 3”.

story:
About Our Campaign

Hello Everyone! We are thrilled and excited that you are viewing our campaign page to raise our first round of funding to develop our career coaching and recruiting mobile app concept, Prestige by The Corporate Pimp!

Before we get into the details, we'd like to share information about us, the team behind it all:

Joshua Caleb Jackson, the visionary professional behind it all, is the author of How to Pimp Corporate America , the founder of The Corporate Pimp, a career counseling agency and most importantly, the co-founder of Prestige by The Corporate Pimp. Joshua graduated from the University of South Florida with his Bachelors in Business Administration and concentrations in Finance and Marketing and earned his Master of Business Administration degree from Keller Graduate School of Management of DeVry University. Coupled with 13+ years of experience in corporate America with a successful career track trajectory, Joshua believes that his idea to bridge the gap between career coaching and recruiting can be solved with Prestige.

Mathew Thomas Pintauro, the creative and technical genius met Joshua in the spring of 2019 and since then, has been instrumental in developing the branding, UX designing, and videography for Prestige. Mathew joined as a co-founder of Prestige in the fall of 2019. Mathew is a graduate of Colorado State University with a Bachelors in Fine Arts and a concentration in Graphic Design. Mathew wholeheartedly believes in the concept of Prestige and the importance on quality in development.

Now that you know who we are, we would love to share with you more about our campaign and what it means to us. Our campaign is tailored to raise funds to develop the first phase of app development for our app concept, Prestige by The Corporate Pimp.

Our campaign is important to us because we plan to develop our app to achieve the following:

  • Provide confidence for individuals to succeed in corporate America through career advice and tutorials via enhanced video presentations
  • Job candidate matching with prospective employers by way of video résumés
  • Collaborative networking with corporate professionals within member network

 

With your help, more people will be equipped to take charge of their careers by earning the salaries they deserve, receiving the benefits they desire, and being able to spend more time with their friends and loved ones.

 

What We Need

Everyone knows its expensive to build an app but for our first phase, we're only in need of $100,000. The breakdown of where this is going is as follows:

  • $65,000 for Mobile App Development
    • Custom UI Features, Professional UX Design, Highly Enhanced Videos, Payment Features, API Integration, Real-Time Features, Employer Web Portal
  • $35,000 for Advertising and Marketing
    • Social Media Advertising, Career Fair Booths & Marketing

 

The Impact

Our campaign is geared toward solving the following current problems in the workplace:

  • 22% of employees leaving their jobs is due to lack of career development
    • We plan to offer advice via video presentations that will assist an individual's career path
  • 69% of executives rated diversity and inclusion as an important issue
    • We plan to gather a high pool of diverse individuals and match them with employers/recruiters who are searching for diverse talent 
  • 83% of employers believe attracting and retaining talent is a growing hiring challenge
    • We plan to offer our highlighted feature, video résumés as an avenue to streamline the hiring process

 

What You Get

When donating to our campaign, we created donation levels with perks for you to select from:

  • Tier 1: Appreciation
    • Contribution: $100 - $249
      • How to Pimp Corporate America manuscript
      • Contributor Card
  • Tier 2: Admiration
    • Contribution: $250 - $499
      • Tier 1
      • Embossed Portfolio (with notepad, pen, card)
      • Customized Office Name Plates 
  • Tier 3: Recognition
    • Contribution: $500 - $999
      • Tier 1 & 2
      • Custom Phone Case
      • Corporate Pimp Swag Apparel
  • Tier 4: Respect
    • Contribution: $1,000 - $2,999
      • Tier 1, 2 & 3
      • Dinner for Two
  • Tier 5: Prestigious
    • Contribution: $3,000+
      • Tier 1, 2, 3 & 4
      • Grooming Package
      • Spa Day

 

Risks & Challenges

We understand that this project is of a massive scope and that we will have more work to complete after this initial round of funding. However, we have scheduled development phases in the future to complete as our app progresses. Our main tasks to combat this challenge are as follows:

  • Kicking off development to see proof of concept
  • Creating milestones to achieve with a dedicated timeline
  • Test the market of the app with universities

 

To learn more, take a look at our pitch deck when you click here.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that times are hard and that you may not be able to contribute at this time, however, tell a friend or loved one about our campaign. We'd greatly appreciate it!

story:
Bullying is an epidemic affecting more than three million students every year: Nearly 160,000 students reported skipping school each day to avoid being bullied and face long-term mental and physical health problems as a result.  Every year, 70% of students witness bullying in their schools, and recent studies indicate that these bystanders suffer the same negative effects as bullied students. Those who bully are at greater risk of academic issues and criminal behavior than their peers.

 

At Urban Tech, we are committed to bringing an end to bullying and violence in schools.  

Over the past three years, we have worked to develop Dignity for All (DFA) to address bullying at its core with storytelling, discussion groups, journaling, role-playing, and games to engage students, train teachers and support parents.

The impact of the DFA pilot program will astound you:  In 2018, we implemented DFA into its first pilot school in Brooklyn, NY.  At the start of the school year, 63% of students indicated that they had been teased, lied about or socially isolated. After completing the first phase of DFA, in only ten weeks time, reports of the same behavior had decreased to 29%! Overall victimization rates fell from 23% to 17.9%, a rate lower than the national bullying average for middle school students, and prevalence rates among female students dropped by nearly 50%.  

Urban Tech is changing the game in education by confronting bullying at its source.  CLICK "BACK IT" to make a donation of any amount to fund our efforts to bring this game-changing program into 1000 schools across the country!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

It’s OK if you can't contribute. Here's a way you can help: Using the hashtag #EmpathyNow, make a quick video sharing your experience with bullying and invite your friends to make a donation in support of our continuing work to shape a new generation of kinder, empathetic and civic-minded children.

 

What They're Saying About Dignity For All

Ms. Keisha R., Teacher, MS 354, Brooklyn, NY​​

"Urban Tech’s Dignity for All program is giving us and our students a voice. It provides a platform for character development that will support our students’ empowerment as agents of change and effective leaders in our school community, in their neighborhood, and perhaps even on the world stage."

thatchictraceyb

Thank you for the information! It is sooo sad how "our" children are taking their lives over bullying! It has to stop!! #EmpathyNow 

jay_1447

What a great cause. Wish that something like this could be done in the UK. But I’ll still gladly support @urbantechcenter even if I’m not in US #DignityForAll

kimacheek

Got my support and definitely need this in DC!!!!!!

jlothelovely

I’m a school counselor— I need that in my school!!

Queenie Spencer

Great cause. So many kids are being bullied. I feel they are the most vulnerable in middle school during their transitional preadolescent years. I have a friend who has a son who is in high school now and is still dealing with the effects of prior bullying in middle school. Thankfully he's in a better place emotionally now. It really takes the love, compassion and support of everyone within the community. 

 

Press 

Positively Black: Urban Tech: Pat Bransford talks to Tracie Strahan about the anti-bullying curriculum called Dignity for All by Urban Tech. 

How One Woman Has Been Working To Create Social Change Through Tech For Two Decades–And Why She Has much More Planned

This Woman Is Out To Eliminate Bullying Through Urban Tech

 

About The National Urban Technology Center, Inc. 

For 25 years, Urban Tech has been dedicated to bridging the digital divide and creating opportunities for success in disadvantaged communities. With its SEEDTECH Program, founded in 1995, Urban Tech focused on providing minority populations living in poverty with the technology and leadership skills they needed to build better futures for themselves and their families.

In 2000, Urban Tech launched the Youth Leadership Academy (YLA) to provide students in those same communities with social and emotional skills to improve personal growth and leadership. YLA has trained 600,000 students in 500 schools across the country, increased attendance, and raised math and reading scores in participating schools by over 40%.  Click here to visit our website.

story:
Hey Superstar!

I'm Aly! I'm a full time single Mum, Illustrator, Psychology & Neuroscience Nerd, INFJ, and of course, a fellow ADHDer.

[Image Description: Aly holding a book and flipping through the pages as she smiles at the camera.] Photo by: Alexandra Conway 

I've spent the majority of my life consistently underachieving in a multitude of ways, despite my ambition, intelligence, creativity and tenacity, all because I was living with un-diagnosed (and therefore untreated) ADHD.
It wasn't until just over 2 years ago that I finally received a proper and correct diagnosis of ADHD, but not before spending 14 years collecting a cornucopia of mental health diagnoses, including Generalized Anxiety, eating disorders, addiction and PTSD.

I have always felt called to make a meaningful impact on the world around me, and use my lived experience and outspoken nature to help other adult ADHDers learn the tools and strategies they need to truly thrive in this world.

But I need your help: becoming an accredited ADHD coach comes with costs that I am not in a position to be able to afford. The success of this campaign and my ability to spark change here in Atlantic Canada relies on your support- in all forms.
I've been working hard to create a campaign full of valuable perks for you and/or your business and if you're not in a position to contribute financially, it would mean the world if you would share with your community.

WHY ADHD COACHING?

Have you heard of the Japanese concept, Ikigai? It’s this beautiful, practical concept that loosely translates to “A Reason For Being”, illustrated using a venn diagram (like the one below!). At the center, where all four circles meet, you find “Ikigai”; your purpose.

ADHD Coaching utilizes all of my expertise, education, skills, talents, experience and more . And it perfectly fills out each segment of the venn diagram.
Simply put: this is my Ikigai.

You can hear me talk more about why ADHD Coaching is the right path for me here.

WHAT EVEN IS AN ADHD COACH?

Great question! An ADHD Coach is someone specifically trained to help individuals (in any age group) with ADHD to better manage their lives. ADHD Coaching can help with things like:

  • -Time Management Skills
  • -Planning & Project Management
  • -Healthier Self Esteem and Relationships
  • -Household Management Skills
  • -Understanding ADHD
  • -Building a better sense of self efficacy
  • -Navigating challenges at work
  • -And so much more

ADHD coaches are not the same as a licensed therapist: ADHD coaches help you to reach specific goals and work proactively to help you build the skills and systems that neurodivergent brains need to thrive in a neurotypical world.

However, ADHD coaches do you not address psychological issues and concerns.
Therapy is often focused on past history and how it relates to the client's individual development. An ADHD coach helps their client address practical goals as they relate to the future.
While some licensed therapists have specialized education to help with some of the same skills, this is often not the case.

The two fields compliment one another perfectly, but are not the same. 
You can hear me talk more about what an ADHD coach does here.

HOW DO YOU BECOME AN ACCREDITED ADHD COACH?

While there is currently no regulating body for ADHD coaching, there are several reputable institutions that have laid out very robust criteria for who can be considered and recommended as an ADHD coach, and a handful of reputable educational programs that certify coaches.
The Centre for ADHD Awareness recommends the ADHD Coaching certification through iACT Centre . Their program is a 12 month program and is accredited through the International Coaching Federation. The other program I am looking into is through Coach Approach For Organizers .
Both programs begin this coming May.

WHY INVEST IN ME BECOMING AN ADHD COACH?

My background in leadership, psychology and illustration, combined with my unique lived experience give me a really important outlook and advantage when it comes to creating successful and sustainable outcomes for my future ADHD Coaching clients:
Education and Empowerment are at the foundation of my future practice, helping my future clients really understand their ADHD brain while teaching them sustainable strategies and solutions to thrive and flourish in this neurotypical world. 
I'll be using my expertise in illustration as a vehicle for education while providing high-value workbooks, worksheets and illustrations to help them metabolize and engage with the materials.

Finding the right ADHD Coach for you is a little like dating in the sense that it is not a one-size-fits-all relationship and my experience up until this point has indicated clearly that there is still a need for more accessible education and coaching here in Atlantic Canada (and beyond). 

WHO WILL I BE WORKING WITH?

While I haven't yet determined my niche, and which area of expertise I'd like to focus on, I am especially driven towards serving and coaching women and nonbinary folks who were diagnosed with ADHD as adults; who often do not have access to the supports and treatments they so desperately require to thrive and manage their everyday lives and responsibilities.

Oftentimes, these individuals have a history of eating disorders, anxiety, depression, addition, alcoholism and more- and end up being both targeted by the system.

Sometimes through income assistance, somethings through the department of community services and sometimes through our justice system. These systems make it nearly impossible to get out or obtain the treatment and supports they actually need and these ADHD'ers get caught in a hamster wheel.

I plan to dedicate a portion of my practice to working with organizations within the community to offer services tailored to at-risk and marginalized communities. This may look like hosting workshops that teach hands on, practical skills and strategies for managing everyday struggles, and even ADHD Advocacy services.
story_txt:
Hey Superstar!I'm Aly! I'm a full time single Mum, Illustrator, Psychology & Neuroscience Nerd, INFJ, and of course, a fellow ADHDer.[Image Description: Aly holding a book and flipping through the pages as she smiles at the camera.] Photo by: Alexandra Conway I've spent the majority of my life consistently underachieving in a multitude of ways, despite my ambition, intelligence, creativity and tenacity, all because I was living with un-diagnosed (and therefore untreated) ADHD.It wasn't until just over 2 years ago that I finally received a proper and correct diagnosis of ADHD, but not before spending 14 years collecting a cornucopia of mental health diagnoses, including Generalized Anxiety, eating disorders, addiction and PTSD.I have always felt called to make a meaningful impact on the world around me, and use my lived experience and outspoken nature to help other adult ADHDers learn the tools and strategies they need to truly thrive in this world.But I need your help: becoming an accredited ADHD coach comes with costs that I am not in a position to be able to afford. The success of this campaign and my ability to spark change here in Atlantic Canada relies on your support- in all forms.I've been working hard to create a campaign full of valuable perks for you and/or your business and if you're not in a position to contribute financially, it would mean the world if you would share with your community.WHY ADHD COACHING?Have you heard of the Japanese concept, Ikigai? It’s this beautiful, practical concept that loosely translates to “A Reason For Being”, illustrated using a venn diagram (like the one below!). At the center, where all four circles meet, you find “Ikigai”; your purpose.ADHD Coaching utilizes all of my expertise, education, skills, talents, experience and more . And it perfectly fills out each segment of the venn diagram.Simply put: this is my Ikigai.You can hear me talk more about why ADHD Coaching is the right path for me here.WHAT EVEN IS AN ADHD COACH?Great question! An ADHD Coach is someone specifically trained to help individuals (in any age group) with ADHD to better manage their lives. ADHD Coaching can help with things like:
-Time Management Skills
-Planning & Project Management
-Healthier Self Esteem and Relationships
-Household Management Skills
-Understanding ADHD
-Building a better sense of self efficacy
-Navigating challenges at work
-And so much more
ADHD coaches are not the same as a licensed therapist: ADHD coaches help you to reach specific goals and work proactively to help you build the skills and systems that neurodivergent brains need to thrive in a neurotypical world.However, ADHD coaches do you not address psychological issues and concerns.Therapy is often focused on past history and how it relates to the client's individual development. An ADHD coach helps their client address practical goals as they relate to the future.While some licensed therapists have specialized education to help with some of the same skills, this is often not the case.The two fields compliment one another perfectly, but are not the same. You can hear me talk more about what an ADHD coach does here.HOW DO YOU BECOME AN ACCREDITED ADHD COACH?While there is currently no regulating body for ADHD coaching, there are several reputable institutions that have laid out very robust criteria for who can be considered and recommended as an ADHD coach, and a handful of reputable educational programs that certify coaches.The Centre for ADHD Awareness recommends the ADHD Coaching certification through iACT Centre . Their program is a 12 month program and is accredited through the International Coaching Federation.
