story:
Our Mission

The mission of the Creative Flow Arts Center is to encourage artistic development and the overall positive growth of our community as a whole.  Our intention is to nourish and engage the mind, body, and spirit of this population.  We will do this by providing a variety of creative and inspirational classes of all forms of art and help address the economic need of the citizens of Hamilton and the surrounding area. The Creative Flow Arts Center will focus on community enrichment by working with the community to design and create public sculptures, murals, and community gardens to beautify the city of Hamilton and provide mobile art classes that reach out to people in need in the Butler County area.  

Goals:  The Creative Flow Arts Center’s goal is to utilize art education as a catalyst for inducing joy, interconnectedness, and community involvement within the community of Butler County. 

  • To provide a space for local emerging artists to teach classes that are open to the community. The focus of these classes is solely community enrichment through knowledge and self empowerment.  These classes will be open to all areas of the arts: dance, yoga, spiritual arts, performing arts, flow arts, music, creative writing, and all forms of visual art including but not limited to: painting, ceramics, glass fusing, glass blowing, printmaking, silversmithing, fiber arts, paper arts, and sculpture techniques. We will also offer classes based on the needs of the public: financial planning, tutoring, resume assistance and more. 

  • To provide scholarships for children, adolescents, and women of low income families to receive free art classes. This work will encourage positive growth and change by helping the children and women of our city who are in need find hope and empowerment in creating and learning new life skills that will help them better succeed in life. 

  • The Creative Flow Arts Center will also branch out into the community to help people in need who are in long term care facilities and terminal hospital wards. The Creative Flow Arts Center teachers will go to local nursing homes, hospitals, and group homes to teach free art classes to those in need of creative activity. This will brighten their lives and open them up to activities that were previously not available. Social interaction and creativity encourages the healing process on many levels. 

  • To provide a Center for community collaboration in order to create public sculptures, murals, community gardens and other projects that focus on community enrichment. These community projects will focus on bringing the community together in a positive, constructive, and creative atmosphere with the goal of forming life long community bonds. We will start off with projects to add more trash cans in the parks of our city and to beautify these and existing trash can by painting them with beautiful designs that the students of The Creative Flow Arts Center create. We will then focus on large public sculptures, murals, and community gardens. Every community mural and sculpture team will go out into the community and ask the citizens what they would like to see in their city. We will take the community’s ideas and create something that everyone is a part of and can enjoy.  The outcome will be a stronger Hamilton with a community who respects and takes pride in their city and works together to make it better.

What We Need & What You Get

We are running this campaign to raise money and community support. In order to receive grant funding, we need to show that we have the support of our community. We need to show them what we can do with the help of the community so that they see that we are going to succeed. We are also running this campaign to raise community awareness of The Creative Flow Arts Center and build a larger following on  The Creative Flow Arts Center Facebook Page

  • We will use the funding we receive for the creation of an official website, for graphic design and marketing tools, and for things we will need in order to operate once we have moved into our building in October including construction materials, an iPad register, and a desktop computer for the office.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • If we do not reach our goal the funds will first go to the website and marketing materials, then to construction materials and last to the electronics. 
  • If we exceed our goal, we will definitely use it wisely toward class materials, tables, and storage compartments to make our classrooms organized.

The Impact

  • Enrichment of all aspects of the community
  • We will offer classes on all aspects of the arts: visual arts, spiritual arts, flow arts, karate, creative writing
  • We will work in conjunction with Miami University Hamilton and Middletown Campuses to offer free tutoring and financial planning classes
  • We will offer classes on sustainability and create DIY projects using household materials that would normally be thrown away.
  • We will have teams who go out into the community and ask our citizens what they would like to see in their city. These teams will then work together to design and create public sculptures, murals, and community gardens.

Risks & Challenges

There are risks in any business venture, but we are confident that we will succeed because our mission will greatly benefit the community and improve the quality of life of our citizens. We are blessed with a team of artists who also have excellent business management skills. We all know this is a rare thing. Jen Siegrist is an entrepreneur who has her own business where she makes her works available to the public and has also managed many other businesses in the area. Check out Jen Siegrist's amazingly intricate art works at Mystic Earth Studios. Crystal Summers is also an entrepreneur who has her own glass business where she teaches the art of glass blowing and fusing and makes her art works available to the public as well. Check out the art works of Crystal Summers at Rising Phoenix Glass. 

  • We have an excellent, hard-working and highly motivated team that is focused on a unified goal of community enrichment. 
  • We have the support of the community who is inspired by our vision and understands the immense support this will provide for our area's youths.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, there are other ways you can help:

  • Like us on Facebook! We will post activities and events that you can participate in!
  • Donate any old art materials that have been laying around your home.
  • Help us spread the word by sharing links to this campaign and inviting your friends to like our Creative Flow Arts Center Facebook page!

story:
I am founding here for my third book Gardening Class, it is serial of five Children stories. I am writing ,working on many many projects and all by my self. If we can raise the founds here, more of my works will see the daylight. Thanks in advance  for support! Damir


The money will be used as follow:

Design, lay out

ILLUSTRATIONS 10-15,

Edit 1,2,3,

Preview- blue print,

BOOK PRINT,

International mailing and local postage

Translation to Chinese, German

What is Gardening Class story about!?? It is very interesting detective style story that unfolds at the very last page, pages. It is also very up to date and educative.

The Gardening Class is the story of a boy who accepts the responsibility for growing plants during the summer vacation. As time goes on he encounters small difficulties and one mystery that he must solve. Like a simple detective story it unfolds at the very last page but it does not end there. His grandmother, who plays a major role in helping a boy who spends too much time on his computer open his mind to the world, reveals a secret.

Here is the list of my writing works only

Children books serial:

1.Pizza King, 2006

2.Gardening Class = found raising book

3.Piglet Rosa,

4.History of Croatian Grape Juice,

5.My fathers neck tie

Additional writing:

6.Simple Classroom Games 2014 (classroom or family activity book for any second language learners)

Short Stories:

7.Pizza King,                         2006- available on AMAZON !!!

http://www.amazon.com/Pizza-King-Damir-Petricev...

8.Five Concubines

9. Empress Necklace

Novels:

10. Monoatomic Universe

11.My dear Zang Err

Other works:

12.Herbal medicine from mums garden

13.Modern day self healing


Our Team: YKK mr Young, Simon Hall, Marika Chkhik- Monkey D Luffy, Sophia, Ms Grace, Michele Furlan, Mina Lu, Iris Vrabec Beba and my self Damir

story:
Walt Whitman is without contest the most known and best-loved poet in the world, more than a hundred and twenty years after his death. Growing up and coming of age in New York shortly after the war of 1812 and during the Jeffersonian and Jacksonian Revolutions, he exquisitely manifested in poetry and prose the spirit of democracy and our new-found personal liberty. Having performed “Song of Myself” and many of Walt’s Civil War poems from “Drum-Taps,” hundreds of times for over twenty years, from memory, I have become adept at conveying Whitman's presence and dramatically interpreting his poems, enriching their meaning and making the buried gold accessible to those many who might never be able to contact Whitman in a book.


 At the close of the sixty day campaign, I will purchase (if I am not gifted with a used one) some type of vehicle to tour North America in. I will consult with professionals technicians and buy a professional quality camera and microphone, as well as a computer and drive powerful enough to store substantial quantities of footage.  I will arrange tours from the lists of contributors by phone and email, first in loops through North American, radiating from Taos, New Mexico, where I live, and then on to other countries. The bulk of the campaign funds will be used to obtain the professional expertise required to convert the raw footage into a professional documentary suitable for television and the theater.


I anticipate performing in schools and churches, coffee houses, senior citizen facilities, local play houses, war memorials and Civil War and other battle fields (Drum Taps Poems), and venues I cannot even imagine at this point. I will record, on video, the performances as well as the responses of the audiences, both laypeople and scholars, favoring venues that are free and open to the public; and I will alert all contributors, by email and Face Book, where and when these performances will be and periodically update them on the progress of the overall project, posting videos of highlights of performances on YouTube and Face Book regularly.
